original: kha cig na re go rims bzhin du snod kyi 'jig rten la dmigs pa dang / gos dang sman la sogs pa'i dmigs pa dang / da ltar gyi la dmigs pa dang / 'das pa la dmigs pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re go rims bzhin du snod kyi 'jig rten la dmigs pa dang / gos dang sman la sogs pa'i dmigs pa dang / da ltar gyi la dmigs pa dang / 'das pa la dmigs pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: They focus on the physical cosmos, on objects such as clothing and medicine, on present objects and on past objects, respectively.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su ni 'bras bu ma grub pa'i rig pa thams cad 'gags pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yang myong ba thun mong du yod pa yang
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su ni 'bras bu ma grub pa'i rig pa thams cad 'gags pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yang myong ba thun mong du yod pa yang
translated: In the realm of nirvana that possesses the remainder of the aggregates, all consciousnesses that are not established as results cease. Therefore, the feeling that arises from the contact of consciousness with its object, which is discordant with that, is also experienced.

original: myong ngo // yang na de'i 'bras bu grub pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: myong ngo // yang na de'i 'bras bu grub pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: Or it is the feeling that is the result of that consciousness.🔽Moreover, since the two types of feeling have completely ceased, only the feeling that arises from the contact of consciousness with its object is experienced.

original: gzhan yang tshor ba rnam pa gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pas rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig mngon du myong ngo zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa gtan du 'gag par 'gyur ba ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshor ba rnam pa gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pas rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig mngon du myong ngo zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa gtan du 'gag par 'gyur ba ston to //
translated: The remainder of this passage teaches the second type of feeling, which definitely ceases.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:🔽the teaching of the cessation of the remainder of the aggregates and the teaching of the cessation of the remainder of the aggregates.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas par gtan du 'gag par 'gyur ba bstan pa dang / phung po lhag ma med par gtan du 'gag par 'gyur bar bstan pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas par gtan du 'gag par 'gyur ba bstan pa dang / phung po lhag ma med par gtan du 'gag par 'gyur bar bstan pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang bshad pa'i rnam grangs gnyis yod pas so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang bshad pa'i rnam grangs gnyis yod pas so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: This statement of the sūtra has two alternative explanations, and so the explanations are not the same.

original: kha cig na re 'bras bu ma grub pa'i rig pa thams cad 'gags pas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i sems kyi tshe ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu dang / las dang nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba rnams spong zhing 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'bras bu ma grub pa'i rig pa thams cad 'gags pas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i sems kyi tshe ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu dang / las dang nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba rnams spong zhing 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Some say: “All the cognitions of the unaccomplished result cease” means that at the time of the vajra-like mind, future results and the feelings concomitant with karma and affliction are abandoned and cease.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yang myong ba zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa zag pa med pa'i tshor🔽ba myong ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yang myong ba zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa zag pa med pa'i tshor ba myong ba'o //
translated: It is the experience of uncontaminated feeling that is concomitant with the knowledge of the elimination and nonarising of karma and affliction, which are the opposite of that.🔽The experience of the shared is also experienced.

original: thun mong du yod pa yang myong ngo zhes bya ba ni thun mong du yod pa snod @237b kyi 'jig rten rig pa yang myong ba ste /
analyzed: thun mong du yod pa yang myong ngo zhes bya ba ni thun mong du yod pa snod @237b kyi 'jig rten rig pa yang myong ba ste /
translated: The knowledge of the shared, the world receptacle, is also experienced.

original: mdo las gnas rig pa zhes gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mdo las gnas rig pa zhes gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: The sutras state that it is the knowledge of the abode.

original: mdor bsdus pas ni yo byad rig pa dang longs spyod rig pa'i tshor ba gnyis ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas ni yo byad rig pa dang longs spyod rig pa'i tshor ba gnyis ni ma gsungs so //
translated: In brief, the two feelings of the knowledge of requisites and the knowledge of enjoyment are not mentioned.

original: ltos pa'i rig pa ni ma gtogs te 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rig pa ni ma gtogs te 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of dependence is excluded because it is concomitant with attachment.

original: yang na de'i 'bras bu grub pa'i tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'bras bu grub pa'i tshor ba ni gnas ngan len dang bcas pa dang / gnas ngan len med par yang gtogs la mi slob pa'i rgyu la ni gnas ngan len med pa'i tshor ba kho na yod pas de'i phyir yang na zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽mdor bsdus pas gzhan gzugs can gyi gnas rig pa dang / gzugs med pa'i gnas rig pa ni mi slob pa la yang 'byung ngo zhes ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na de'i 'bras bu grub pa'i tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'bras bu grub pa'i tshor ba ni gnas ngan len dang bcas pa dang / gnas ngan len med par yang gtogs la mi slob pa'i rgyu la ni gnas ngan len med pa'i tshor ba kho na yod pas de'i phyir yang na zhes bya ba gsungs so // mdor bsdus pas gzhan gzugs can gyi gnas rig pa dang / gzugs med pa'i gnas rig pa ni mi slob pa la yang 'byung ngo zhes ni ma gsungs so //

original: gzhan yang tshor ba rnams pa gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pas zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa dang / de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa yang spangs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshor ba rnams pa gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pas zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa dang / de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa yang spangs pas so //
translated: Or it is the feeling that is the result of that.🔽Or it is the feeling

original: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig mngon du myong ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni zag pa zad pa la yod pa'i tshor ba rnams ni rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no
analyzed: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig mngon du myong ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni zag pa zad pa la yod pa'i tshor ba rnams ni rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no
translated: He experiences only feeling that arises from contact with cognition. This teaches that the feelings that exist for one who has exhausted the defilements are feelings that arise from contact with cognition.

original: zhe'o // kha cig na re 'bras bu ma grub pa'i rig pa thams cad 'gags pas zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zhe'o // kha cig na re 'bras bu ma grub pa'i rig pa thams cad 'gags pas zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say: All cognitions that have not yet produced their result have ceased.

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba mngon par 'grub pa'i sa bon thams cad 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba mngon par 'grub pa'i sa bon thams cad 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This means that for one who has attained nirvāṇa with remainder, all the seeds that produce future feelings have ceased.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yang myong ngo zhes bya ba ni gnyen por gyur pa'i lam zag pa med pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yang myong ngo zhes bya ba ni gnyen por gyur pa'i lam zag pa med pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: He also experiences feeling that arises from contact with cognition, which is incompatible with that. This refers to the feeling of the uncontaminated path that is the antidote.

original: thun mong du yod pa yang myong zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thun mong du yod pa yang myong zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: He also experiences that which is common. This means that

original: de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa'o //
translated: the object of that is cognition.

original: yang na de'i 'bras bu grub pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang na de'i 'bras bu grub pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Or else, the feeling that is the result of that is as follows:

original: mngon du spyod pas da ltar 'bras bu sbyin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: mngon du spyod pas da ltar 'bras bu sbyin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: The feeling that gives its result in the present through manifest action.

original: gong du bstan pa de dag ni lhag ma med par ma zhugs pa dag tshor ba gsum po de dag dang ldan par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa de dag ni lhag ma med par ma zhugs pa dag tshor ba gsum po de dag dang ldan par bstan pa'o //
translated: Those previously explained are taught to possess those three feelings without entering without remainder.

original: gzhan yang tshor ba rnam pa gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pas rig pa'i 'dus @238a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshor ba rnam pa gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pas rig pa'i 'dus @238a * //
translated: Moreover, all feelings of every kind cease, and only the feeling that arises from contact with awareness is experienced.

original: te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig mngon par myong ngo zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med par zhugs pa'i tshe zag pa med pa'i sems 'ba' zhig lhag ma med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir phyis thun mong du yod pa myong ba dang /
analyzed: te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig mngon par myong ngo zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med par zhugs pa'i tshe zag pa med pa'i sems 'ba' zhig lhag ma med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir phyis thun mong du yod pa myong ba dang /
translated: When one enters without remainder, only the uncontaminated mind remains, because it focuses on the remainderless.

original: de'i 'bras bu grub pa tshor ba yang 'gags nas zag pa med pa'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu grub pa tshor ba yang 'gags nas zag pa med pa'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Later, the feeling that exists in common and the feeling that is the result of that also cease, because only uncontaminated feeling exists.

original: gzhan yang tshor ba rnam pa gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshor ba rnam pa gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, it is said that all feelings of every kind cease.

original: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig myong zhes bya ba 'di ni rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa zag pa med pa 'ba' zhig gi dbang du mdzad nas de skad du bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig myong zhes bya ba 'di ni rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa zag pa med pa 'ba' zhig gi dbang du mdzad nas de skad du bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The feeling that arises from contact with awareness alone is experienced. This is taught from the perspective of only the uncontaminated contact of awareness.

original: gzhan yang mdo'i tshig 'di la slob dpon de gnyis kyis snga ma'i gzhung las gzhan du bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo'i tshig 'di la slob dpon de gnyis kyis snga ma'i gzhung las gzhan du bshad de /
translated: Moreover, these two masters explain the words of this sūtra differently than the former texts.

original: dang po ni 'di skad du lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbyings su ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu'i tshor ba ni 'gag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dang po ni 'di skad du lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbyings su ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu'i tshor ba ni 'gag par 'gyur la /
translated: The first explains it as follows: In the realm with remainder, the feeling of the cause that has not yet arisen ceases.

original: tshor ba gzhan gsum ni yod do zhes bya ba 'di ni zag pa med pa'i tshor ba la rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba kho na nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir tshor ba gsum yod do zhes bstan to zhe'o //
analyzed: tshor ba gzhan gsum ni yod do zhes bya ba 'di ni zag pa med pa'i tshor ba la rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba kho na nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir tshor ba gsum yod do zhes bstan to zhe'o //
translated: This is because uncontaminated feeling is posited as the feeling that arises from contact with the knowledge of thatness.

original: gnyis pa ni 'di skad du mi slob pa'i gang zag gi rgyud la yod pa'i tshor ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med par yang gtogs pas spyir rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'di skad du mi slob pa'i gang zag gi rgyud la yod pa'i tshor ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med par yang gtogs pas spyir rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The second says: Feeling that exists in the mindstream of a nonlearner is both contaminated and uncontaminated and is generally called feeling that arises from contact with knowledge.

original: don de'i phyir lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbyings su gzhan yang tshor ba rnam pa gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: don de'i phyir lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbyings su gzhan yang tshor ba rnam pa gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: For that reason it is said in the sphere of remaining that all feelings of the two types cease without remainder.

original: 'di ltar snga ma'i gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa dang / de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa'i tshor ba gnyis po de dag thams cad 'gags nas mi slob pa'i gang zag gi rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig yod pa'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'di ltar snga ma'i gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa dang / de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa'i tshor ba gnyis po de dag thams cad 'gags nas mi slob pa'i gang zag gi rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig yod pa'o zhes zer te /
translated: Thus, when the contact of one beyond training arises from the knowledge of the person who is beyond training, only the feeling that arises from contact with knowledge remains, since both the knowledge of the former state of the person beyond training and the feeling that is the result of that knowledge have ceased.

original: snga ma'i bshad pa 'di dag ni bsam dgos so //
analyzed: snga ma'i bshad pa 'di dag ni bsam dgos so //
translated: These former explanations should be contemplated.

original: kha cig na re mdo'i tshig 'di la rnam grangs gnyis kyi don yod pas tshor ba rnam pa brgyad las lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbyings su mya ngan las 'das pa na 'bras bu ma grub pa'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig na re mdo'i tshig 'di la rnam grangs gnyis kyi don yod pas tshor ba rnam pa brgyad las lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbyings su mya ngan las 'das pa na 'bras bu ma grub pa'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Some say: Since this sutra passage has two alternative meanings, when one attains nirvana in the realm of residual aggregates from among the eight types of feeling, only the feeling that is not established as a result ceases.

original: nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de'i mi @238b mthun pa'i phyogs rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba myong zhing yang zag pa med pa'i tshor ba 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de'i mi @238b mthun pa'i phyogs rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba myong zhing yang zag pa med pa'i tshor ba 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is associated with affliction, one experiences the feeling that arises from contact with knowledge that is the antidote to that and one obtains uncontaminated feeling.

original: thun mong du yod pa yang myong ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thun mong du yod pa yang myong ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The common ones are also experienced.

original: tshor ba rnam pa brgyad las 'bras bu ma grub pa dang / 'bras bu grub pa ma gtogs par gzhan drug po dag ni so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa rnams thun mong du yod pa'i phyir thun mong du yod pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa brgyad las 'bras bu ma grub pa dang / 'bras bu grub pa ma gtogs par gzhan drug po dag ni so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa rnams thun mong du yod pa'i phyir thun mong du yod pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The six feelings other than the two, the unestablished result and the established result, are called common because they are common to both ordinary beings and āryas.

original: ji ltar mi slob pa la yang ltos pa'i rig pa yod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi slob pa la yang ltos pa'i rig pa yod ce na /
translated: How can there be knowledge that depends on the nonlearner?

original: smras pa / ltos pa ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / ltos pa ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: It is said: There are two types of dependence.

original: 'dod chags kyis gcig la gcig sems pa ni dgra bcom pas spangs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis gcig la gcig sems pa ni dgra bcom pas spangs so //
translated: The desire to think of each other through attachment is abandoned by the arhat.

original: nyon mongs pa med pas bsngags pa brjod cing gcig la gcig sems pa ni dgra bcom pa lnga yang yod pa'i phyir thun mong du yod pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pas bsngags pa brjod cing gcig la gcig sems pa ni dgra bcom pa lnga yang yod pa'i phyir thun mong du yod pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The praise of the absence of affliction and the desire to think of each other is said to be common because it exists for the five arhats.

original: yang na thun mong du yod pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba lnga po kho na dang ldan pas ltos pa ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: yang na thun mong du yod pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba lnga po kho na dang ldan pas ltos pa ni ma gtogs te /
translated: Or the common ones are said to be the five feelings alone, excluding dependence.

original: 'dod chags kyis gcig la gcig chags pa'i phyir dang go sla ba'i phyir mdor bsdus nas ma bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis gcig la gcig chags pa'i phyir dang go sla ba'i phyir mdor bsdus nas ma bstan to //
translated: It is not taught in brief because of attachment to each other due to desire and because it is easy to understand.

original: yang na de'i 'bras bu grub pa'i tshor ba'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la yang da ltar gyi 'bras bu myong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na de'i 'bras bu grub pa'i tshor ba'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la yang da ltar gyi 'bras bu myong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, because the feeling that is the result of that is established, this is because even in the continuum of an arhat, the result of the present is experienced.

original: ci'i phyir tshor ba 'di thun mong du yod pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshor ba 'di thun mong du yod pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is this feeling not called common?

original: smras pa / yang dag pa'i don du na thun mong du yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / yang dag pa'i don du na thun mong du yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: It is said: Although it does not exist in common in the ultimate sense,

original: snga ma'i 'bras bu ma grub pa'i tshor ba la ltos nas yod pa dang med pa'i mtshungs pas de'i phyir logs shig tu bstan to //
analyzed: snga ma'i 'bras bu ma grub pa'i tshor ba la ltos nas yod pa dang med pa'i mtshungs pas de'i phyir logs shig tu bstan to //
translated: it is taught separately because of the similarity of existence and non-existence in relation to the feeling that is the result of the past that is not established.

original: gzhan yang tshor ba rnam pa gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pas rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig mngon du myong ngo zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa dag las bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod do zhes zer te //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshor ba rnam pa gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags pas rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig mngon du myong ngo zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa dag las bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod do zhes zer te //
translated: Also, it is explained in the commentaries that the feeling of all those of two types is completely stopped and only the feeling arising from the contact of consciousness is directly experienced.

original: kha cig na re dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i tshor ba rnams ni bag la nyal dang bral ba'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i tshor ba rnams ni bag la nyal dang bral ba'i phyir zag pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Some say: Feelings existing in the mindstream of an arhat are called uncontaminated because they are free from latent states.

original: sngar gong du tshor ba brgyad po dag ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir thams cad med ces bstan to //
analyzed: sngar gong du tshor ba brgyad po dag ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir thams cad med ces bstan to //
translated: Since it was previously taught that the eight feelings are entirely contaminated, it is taught that all do not exist.

original: de la rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i rtsa ba'i tshor ba gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i rtsa ba'i tshor ba gnyis te /
translated: Here the two types refers to the two basic feelings taught previously.

original: tshor ba brgyad po dag bsdus pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: tshor ba brgyad po dag bsdus pa'o zhe'o //
translated: The eight feelings are subsumed in those two.

original: kha cig na re sems med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: kha cig na re sems med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: Some say: When one enters meditative attainment on mindless meditative stabilization,

original: tshor ba gzhan brgyad po dag 'gag par 'gyur te /🔽zag pa @239a * //
analyzed: tshor ba gzhan brgyad po dag 'gag par 'gyur te / zag pa @239a * //
translated: The other eight feelings cease.

original: med pa'i tshor ba yod do zhes gsungs pa ni sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa'i tshor ba yod do zhes gsungs pa ni sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The statement that there is a feeling that is uncontaminated is from the perspective of the meditative attainment of nondiscernment,

original: btags pa tsam du 'gag par mi 'gyur zhes gsungs kyi yang dag pa'i don du 'gag par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: btags pa tsam du 'gag par mi 'gyur zhes gsungs kyi yang dag pa'i don du 'gag par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: because it is said that it does not cease as a mere designation, but it is not said that it does not cease in reality.🔽When one attains nirvana in the expanse of nirvana that is without remainder, that feeling also ceases forever.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe ni de yang gtan du 'gag par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su gtan du 'gag par 'gyur ba ston to //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe ni de yang gtan du 'gag par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su gtan du 'gag par 'gyur ba ston to //
translated: This is the second point, which shows that it ceases forever in the expanse that is without remainder.

original: 'di ltar lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba de yang 'gag par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba de yang 'gag par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Thus, that feeling that arises from the contact of cognition in the expanse that is without remainder ceases.

original: yang na gong du bstan pa'i thun mong du yod pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa yang 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gong du bstan pa'i thun mong du yod pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa yang 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Or else, the feelings and so on that are common to all sentient beings, as explained above, would also cease.

original: de'i phyir phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad ma lus par gtan du 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad ma lus par gtan du 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that all feelings without exception would completely cease in the realm of nirvana without remainder. This is the second general conclusion.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas yang byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas yang byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then, after the Blessed One had spoken thus, he said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: legs so legs so rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de 'dir yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa dang / shin tu gya nom pa'i rnal 'byor gyi lam las brtsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa la dri ba dris bas khyod rnal 'byor la shin tu rnam par nges shing shin tu mkhas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gong du tshigs rkyang pas rgya cher
analyzed: legs so legs so rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de 'dir yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa dang / shin tu gya nom pa'i rnal 'byor gyi lam las brtsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa la dri ba dris bas khyod rnal 'byor la shin tu rnam par nges shing shin tu mkhas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gong du tshigs rkyang pas rgya cher
translated: Well said, well said, son of noble family! You have asked the Tathagata about the path of yoga, beginning with its perfection here, its complete purity, and its complete excellence. By asking the Tathagata about this, you will become very certain and very skilled in yoga.

original: bshad pa la rnam pa gnyis su phye ste /
analyzed: bshad pa la rnam pa gnyis su phye ste /
translated: Thus, the above is explained extensively in two parts:

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu zhing bsgrub par bskul ba'o zhes bstan pa las /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu zhing bsgrub par bskul ba'o zhes bstan pa las /
translated: the extensive explanation of the characteristics of shamatha and vipashyana, and the conclusion and exhortation to practice.

original: de yan chad du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de yan chad du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: Up to this point, the characteristics of shamatha and vipashyana have been taught.

original: 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu zhing bsgrub par bskul ba zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu zhing bsgrub par bskul ba zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here on, the second part is taught, called the conclusion and exhortation to practice.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba la phan yon yod par bsngags pa dang / ngas kyang zhes bya ba man chad sangs rgyas rnams kyis mtshungs par gsungs pa nyid du bstan pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad kyis bsgrub par bskul ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba la phan yon yod par bsngags pa dang / ngas kyang zhes bya ba man chad sangs rgyas rnams kyis mtshungs par gsungs pa nyid du bstan pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad kyis bsgrub par bskul ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The praise of the benefit of requesting instruction, and the statement beginning “I also” shows that the Buddhas have taught this in the same way. The statement beginning “Son of noble lineage” shows the exhortation to practice.

original: 'di ni dang po mdo nyid kyis brda @239b phrad par zad do //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po mdo nyid kyis brda @239b phrad par zad do //
translated: This is the first, merely the introduction to the sūtra.

original: ngas kyang khyod la yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa dang / gya nom pa'i rnal 'byor gyi lam bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ngas kyang khyod la yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa dang / gya nom pa'i rnal 'byor gyi lam bstan pa ste /
translated: “I also have taught you the path of yoga that is completely perfect, completely pure, and completely refined.”

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ji snyed pa thams cad kyis kyang de ltar bstan pa dang / ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sangs rgyas rnams kyis mtshungs par gsungs pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ji snyed pa thams cad kyis kyang de ltar bstan pa dang / ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sangs rgyas rnams kyis mtshungs par gsungs pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The statement beginning “The past and future perfect buddhas” shows the second, that the Buddhas have taught this in the same way.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: ngas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi las gya nom pa gsungs pa de yang 'ba' zhig gis de skad du bstan pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ngas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi las gya nom pa gsungs pa de yang 'ba' zhig gis de skad du bstan pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The excellent work of serenity and insight that I have taught is not just something that I have taught on my own.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang don de de skad du mtshungs par gsungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang don de de skad du mtshungs par gsungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of this is that the buddhas of the three times have also taught this meaning in the same way.

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo rnams kyis kyang 'di la brten nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo rnams kyis kyang 'di la brten nas /
translated: Sons and daughters of good lineage should also, on the basis of this,🔽strive with great effort to accomplish it.

original: shin tu brtson pas yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rigs so zhes bya ba ni gsum pa bsgrub par bskul ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu brtson pas yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rigs so zhes bya ba ni gsum pa bsgrub par bskul ba ste /
translated: This is the third exhortation to practice.

original: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The sutra itself makes this clear.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to teach this very meaning, the Bhagavān said:

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni le'u 'di la gong du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang dag par bshad pa dang / bka' bzhin du bsgrub par rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis su phye ste bstan pa la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni le'u 'di la gong du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang dag par bshad pa dang / bka' bzhin du bsgrub par rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis su phye ste bstan pa la /
translated: The phrase he spoke these verses and so forth indicates that this chapter is divided into two parts: the correct explanation of serenity and insight, and the demonstration of their practice in accordance with the teachings.

original: yang dag par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang dag par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The correct explanation is also divided into two parts:🔽an extensive explanation in prose and a brief explanation in verse.

original: tshig rkyang pas rgya cher bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'o zhes bstan pa las 'di ni tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig rkyang pas rgya cher bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'o zhes bstan pa las 'di ni tshigs su bcad pas mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief explanation in verse.

original: yang na le'u 'di gcig la mdor bsdu ba na rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: yang na le'u 'di gcig la mdor bsdu ba na rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: Alternatively, this chapter is divided into three parts in a brief summary:

original: tshig rkyang pas rgya cher bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas bzlas te bshad pa dang / bka' bzhin du sgrub par byed pas bstan par sbyar ba las /
analyzed: tshig rkyang pas rgya cher bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas bzlas te bshad pa dang / bka' bzhin du sgrub par byed pas bstan par sbyar ba las /
translated: an extensive explanation in prose, a repetition of the brief explanation in verse, and a demonstration of practice in accordance with the teachings.

original: 'di ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pa bzlas te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pa bzlas te bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the second part, the repetition of the brief explanation in verse.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i gleng bslang ba dang / tshigs su bcad pa nyid kyis bzlas te bshad pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i gleng bslang ba dang / tshigs su bcad pa nyid kyis bzlas te bshad pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: the introduction by way of a verse, and the explanation by way of a verse. This is the first.

original: chos gdags rnam gzhag rnal 'byor dag la ni //
analyzed: chos gdags rnam gzhag rnal 'byor dag la ni //
translated: The Dharma and the yoga are set forth🔽for the yogis who are heedless,

original: gang zhig bag med spyod pa don chen nyams //
analyzed: gang zhig bag med spyod pa don chen nyams //
translated: who are losing the great meaning.

original: chos dang rnal 'byor 'di la brten nas ni //
analyzed: chos dang rnal 'byor 'di la brten nas ni //
translated: Relying on this Dharma and this yoga,

original: yang dag sgrub na byang chub chen po 'thob //
analyzed: yang dag sgrub na byang chub chen po 'thob //
translated: if one practices correctly, one attains great enlightenment.

original: ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa @240a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa @240a * //
translated: From here on is the second.

original: tshigs su bcad pa smos nas yang dag par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa smos nas yang dag par bshad pa ston to //
translated: It teaches the explanation by way of a verse.

original: 'di yang tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa yod pa nyid las rnam pa lngar dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa yod pa nyid las rnam pa lngar dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into five parts from the existence of the five verses.

original: de yang tshigs su bcad pa dang po gcig gis ni chos dang / rnal 'byor gyi rjes su mthun pa dang 'gal ba'i yon tan dang nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: de yang tshigs su bcad pa dang po gcig gis ni chos dang / rnal 'byor gyi rjes su mthun pa dang 'gal ba'i yon tan dang nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: And the first verse teaches the good qualities and the disadvantages that are consistent with and contrary to the Dharma and the yoga.

original: de'i 'og ma tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: The next verse shows the disadvantage of having an object.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa dang zang zing spangs pa'i yon tan bstan te //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa dang zang zing spangs pa'i yon tan bstan te //
translated: The third verse shows the advantages of helping sentient beings and of abandoning material things.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas ni 'dod pas chos ston pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas ni 'dod pas chos ston pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: The fourth verse shows the disadvantage of teaching the Dharma out of desire.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lnga pas ni mngon par zhen pa spangs pa dang sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lnga pas ni mngon par zhen pa spangs pa dang sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: The fifth verse shows the advantages of abandoning attachment and of helping sentient beings.

original: 'di ni dang po chos dang rnal 'byor la brten nas rjes su mthun pa dang 'gal ba'i phan yon dang nyes dmigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po chos dang rnal 'byor la brten nas rjes su mthun pa dang 'gal ba'i phan yon dang nyes dmigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first chapter, on the advantages and disadvantages of the concordances and discordances in dependence on the Dharma and its realization.

original: 'di ltar gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa las bstan pa'i rnal 'byor zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam dag la gang zhig bag med par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa las bstan pa'i rnal 'byor zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam dag la gang zhig bag med par gyur na /
translated: Thus, in the teaching of the twelve branches of the scriptures, which is the presentation of the designation of the Dharma, whoever is heedless with regard to the path of serenity and insight, which are the realizations of the Dharma,

original: don chen po mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu las rab tu nyams par 'gyur la /
analyzed: don chen po mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu las rab tu nyams par 'gyur la /
translated: They will fall away from the great goal, the result of nirvana.

original: gal te bstan pa 'di dang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas yang dag par sgrub par byed na byang chub chen po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gal te bstan pa 'di dang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas yang dag par sgrub par byed na byang chub chen po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: But if they practice correctly on the basis of this teaching, of serenity and insight, they will attain great enlightenment.

original: dmigs bcas lta bas bgegs las thar tshol zhing /
analyzed: dmigs bcas lta bas bgegs las thar tshol zhing /
translated: Those who seek freedom from obstacles through a view that has a reference

original: lta ba de yis chos thob gang zer ba //
analyzed: lta ba de yis chos thob gang zer ba //
translated: and claim to attain reality through that view

original: byams pa de dag rnal 'byor las ni ring //
analyzed: byams pa de dag rnal 'byor las ni ring //
translated: are far from the yoga of Maitreya,

original: dper na gnam sa ring ba ji bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gnam sa ring ba ji bzhin no //
translated: just as the earth is far from the sky.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i nyes dmigs ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i nyes dmigs ston to //
translated: This second verse shows the disadvantage of having a reference.

original: 'di ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas yongs su tshol na dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i lta ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas yongs su tshol na dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i lta ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if one seeks reality in dependence on serenity and insight, one will have a view that has a reference.

original: gal te de lta ba de nyid la mngon par zhen nas chos thob pa yin no snyam du sems shing 'khor ba'i bgegs las thar ba yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te de lta ba de nyid la mngon par zhen nas chos thob pa yin no snyam du sems shing 'khor ba'i bgegs las thar ba yin no zhes zer na /
translated: If one were to conceive of the view as the attainment of the Dharma, and to say that one is liberated from the obstacles of cyclic existence,

original: rnal 'byor gyi lam thag ring bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi lam thag ring bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: then the path of yoga would be very long.

original: dper na gnam sa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gnam sa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: It would be as long as the distance between the sky and the earth.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa khyad par sems kyis zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa khyad par sems kyis zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, the noble Sūtra Requested by Suviśuddhamati says,

original: ji tsam du sems kyis chos rnams rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni log pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du sems kyis chos rnams rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni log pa'o //
translated: “Whatever the mind conceives of phenomena is mistaken.

original: sems @240b kyis chos rnams la rnam par mi rtog pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems @240b kyis chos rnams la rnam par mi rtog pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Whatever the mind does not conceive of phenomena is correct.”

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las kyang /
translated: The Great Exegesis also says,

original: gnam sa rab tu thag ring ste //
analyzed: gnam sa rab tu thag ring ste //
translated: The distance between the sky and the earth is great.

original: rgya mtsho'i pha mtha' dag kyang ring //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i pha mtha' dag kyang ring //
translated: The distance to the other side of the ocean is great.

original: nyi ma 'char nub gnas thag ring //🔽yang dag log chos ring las ring //
analyzed: nyi ma 'char nub gnas thag ring // yang dag log chos ring las ring //
translated: The distance between the rising and setting of the sun is great.

original: zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The distance between the Dharma of reality and the Dharma of unreality is greater.

original: mdo 'di las ni dpe dang po kho na gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni dpe dang po kho na gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This sutra mentions only the first example.

original: sems can don la brtan pas lam rig nas //
analyzed: sems can don la brtan pas lam rig nas //
translated: The steadfast, knowing the path,

original: brtson pas sems can phan 'dogs byed pa yin //
analyzed: brtson pas sems can phan 'dogs byed pa yin //
translated: are dedicated to helping sentient beings.

original: blo ldan bskal pa mthar thug tshad byed na //
analyzed: blo ldan bskal pa mthar thug tshad byed na //
translated: The wise, reaching the end of the eons,

original: zang zing med pa'i dga' ba dam pa 'thob //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i dga' ba dam pa 'thob //
translated: attain the highest joy, which is disinterested.

original: zhes bya ba ni gsum pa sems can la phan 'dogs pa dang / zang zing med pa'i yon tan ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gsum pa sems can la phan 'dogs pa dang / zang zing med pa'i yon tan ston to //
translated: This shows the third and fourth kinds of purity, the purity of helping sentient beings and the purity of being disinterested.🔽Thus, the bodhisattvas, through their steadfast great compassion, help sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can la phan 'dogs pa ni snying rje chen po brtan par gyur pas 'di snyam du sems te bdag ni phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can la phan 'dogs pa ni snying rje chen po brtan par gyur pas 'di snyam du sems te bdag ni phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: They think, “I am the one who helps,” and “There is no one to be helped.”

original: de ni phan gdags par bya ba med do snyam du don de lta bur rig par gyur nas nges sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba dag la bskal pa'i mtha' ji srid par brtson pas na /
analyzed: de ni phan gdags par bya ba med do snyam du don de lta bur rig par gyur nas nges sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba dag la bskal pa'i mtha' ji srid par brtson pas na /
translated: Having understood this matter in this way, they are dedicated to helping sentient beings for as long as the end of the eons.

original: zang zing med pa'i dga' ba thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i dga' ba thob par 'gyur te /
translated: They attain the joy of being disinterested.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos sa yongs su 'dzin pa las /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor pa ni dngos po rjes su 'dzin cing de bzhin nyid rjes su 'dzin par byed kyang 'di snyam du 'di ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos sa yongs su 'dzin pa las / byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor pa ni dngos po rjes su 'dzin cing de bzhin nyid rjes su 'dzin par byed kyang 'di snyam du 'di ni dngos po'o //
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattvabhumi states:🔽The bodhisattva yogīn🔽holds to the thing and holds to reality, but he does not think, “This is the thing, this is reality.”

original: 'di ni de bzhin nyid do snyam du mi sems te zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhib tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin nyid do snyam du mi sems te zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhib tu 'byung ste /
translated: and so on, in detail.

original: 'dir zhib tu ma brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir zhib tu ma brjod do //
translated: But this is not elaborated here.

original: gang dag 'dod phyir chos kyi lung 'bogs pa //
analyzed: gang dag 'dod phyir chos kyi lung 'bogs pa //
translated: He who teaches the Dharma for the sake of desire,

original: de ni 'dod pas 'dod phyir len zhes bya //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pas 'dod phyir len zhes bya //
translated: that is called “taking desire for the sake of desire.”

original: rmongs pas rin thang med pa'i rin po che //
analyzed: rmongs pas rin thang med pa'i rin po che //
translated: The fool, having obtained a priceless jewel,

original: thob nas phyir yang sprang por 'gyur bar byed //
analyzed: thob nas phyir yang sprang por 'gyur bar byed //
translated: again becomes a beggar.

original: ces bya ba ni bzhi pa 'dod pas chos ston pa'i nyes dmigs ston to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bzhi pa 'dod pas chos ston pa'i nyes dmigs ston to //
translated: This shows the disadvantage of teaching the Dharma out of desire.

original: gal te la la zhig grags pa dang rnyed pa yongs su tshol ba gzhan dag la chos ston par byed na /
analyzed: gal te la la zhig grags pa dang rnyed pa yongs su tshol ba gzhan dag la chos ston par byed na /
translated: If someone teaches the Dharma to others out of desire for fame and gain,

original: 'dod pa spangs nas phyir 'dod pa len pa'i chos ston pa zhes bya bas /
analyzed: 'dod pa spangs nas phyir 'dod pa len pa'i chos ston pa zhes bya bas /
translated: The Dharma teacher who, having renounced desire, takes up desire again is called one who has fallen away from the vow of individual liberation.

original: de ni tshig gi sgo nas 'dod pa spangs kyang sems rnyed pa la chags pas ni phyir 'dod pa len pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni tshig gi sgo nas 'dod pa spangs kyang sems rnyed pa la chags pas ni phyir 'dod pa len pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called one who has fallen away from the vow of individual liberation because, although he has renounced desire by means of words, his mind is attached to acquiring wealth.

original: bstan bcos shin tu rgyas par brgya pa las //
analyzed: bstan bcos shin tu rgyas par brgya pa las //
translated: The Catuh-śataka commentary says:

original: bag med pa dang tshul khrims yongs su ma dag pa la smad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: bag med pa dang tshul khrims yongs su ma dag pa la smad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
translated: There is a verse that criticizes carelessness and impure morality:

original: ji ltar rang bzhin @241a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin @241a * //
translated: Just as a dog,🔽when pulled forward by the nose,

original: phan tshun reg pa dang // mdun du khrid na phyir yang 'then pa ltar //
analyzed: phan tshun reg pa dang // mdun du khrid na phyir yang 'then pa ltar //
translated: pulls back with his hind parts,🔽so you, in order to desire,

original: khyod kyis 'dod phyir tshul khrims bsrung ba yi //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'dod phyir tshul khrims bsrung ba yi //
translated: guard morality.

original: dngos po de dag kyang ni de bzhin te //
analyzed: dngos po de dag kyang ni de bzhin te //
translated: Those things are just like that.

original: lus kyis tshul khrims srung bar byed kyang ni //
analyzed: lus kyis tshul khrims srung bar byed kyang ni //
translated: Although you guard morality with your body,

original: sems ni 'dod pa dag gis rab tu khrid //
analyzed: sems ni 'dod pa dag gis rab tu khrid //
translated: your mind is led away by desires.

original: las 'di yongs su dag pa ma yin na //
analyzed: las 'di yongs su dag pa ma yin na //
translated: If this action is not pure,

original: tshul khrims bsrungs pa de yis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrungs pa de yis ci zhig bya //
translated: what is the use of guarding morality?

original: zhes bstan pa lta bu ste de bzhin du rmongs pa gcig gis /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa lta bu ste de bzhin du rmongs pa gcig gis /
translated: In the same way, a single deluded person

original: 'di ltar chos kyi rin po che rin thang med pa thob na yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mi gnyer bas phyir 'jig rten pa'i grags pa dang rnyed pa tshol ba dag ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi rin po che rin thang med pa thob na yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mi gnyer bas phyir 'jig rten pa'i grags pa dang rnyed pa tshol ba dag ni /
translated: who does not strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, even though he has obtained the priceless jewel of the Dharma,🔽is like a worldly person who seeks fame and gain.

original: dper na 'jig rten pa'i gang zag blun pos rin thang med pa'i rin po che thob kyang slar sprang po byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten pa'i gang zag blun pos rin thang med pa'i rin po che thob kyang slar sprang po byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that he is like a worldly fool who, even though he has obtained a priceless jewel, acts like a beggar again.

original: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na gang la la zhig stong pa nyid blang ba'i phyir chos ston pa dag ni yod pa spangs nas stong pa la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na gang la la zhig stong pa nyid blang ba'i phyir chos ston pa dag ni yod pa spangs nas stong pa la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Another explanation is that those who teach the Dharma in order to adopt emptiness are said to abandon existence and cling to emptiness.

original: gang zag blun po de ni chos kyi rin po che rin thang med pa thob kyang /
analyzed: gang zag blun po de ni chos kyi rin po che rin thang med pa thob kyang /
translated: That deluded person, even though he has obtained the priceless jewel of the Dharma,

original: gsung rab kyi dgongs te gsungs pa khong du ma chud pas stong pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa skyed par byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gsung rab kyi dgongs te gsungs pa khong du ma chud pas stong pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa skyed par byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: Abandoning disputes, social interactions, and conceptual elaborations,🔽you should generate the highest effort🔽in order to liberate the world with its gods🔽in this yoga.🔽You should train

original: rtsod dang 'du 'dzin spros la mngon zhen pa //
analyzed: rtsod dang 'du 'dzin spros la mngon zhen pa //
translated: Abandoning disputes, social interactions, and conceptual elaborations means abandoning the strong adherence to them.🔽In order to liberate the world with its gods means in order to liberate the world of sentient beings.🔽In this yoga means in this yoga of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam par spong la brtson 'grus mchog bskyed de //
analyzed: rnam par spong la brtson 'grus mchog bskyed de //
translated: You should generate the highest effort means you should generate the highest effort in order to liberate the world with its gods.🔽Abandoning disputes, social interactions, and conceptual elaborations means abandoning the strong adherence to them.

original: lhar bcas pi yi 'jig rten bsgral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lhar bcas pi yi 'jig rten bsgral ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to liberate the world with its gods means in order to liberate the world of sentient beings.🔽In this yoga means in this yoga of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnal 'byor 'di la khyod kyis bslab par gyis //
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'di la khyod kyis bslab par gyis //
translated: You should generate the highest effort means you should generate the highest effort in order to liberate the world with its gods.🔽Abandoning disputes, social interactions, and conceptual elaborations means abandoning the strong adherence to them.

original: zhes bya ba lnga pa mngon par zhen pa spangs pa dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lnga pa mngon par zhen pa spangs pa dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: In order to liberate the world with its gods means in order to liberate the world of sentient beings.🔽In this yoga means in this yoga of the perfection of wisdom.🔽You should generate the highest effort means you should generate the highest effort in order to liberate the world with its gods.🔽Abandoning disputes, social interactions, and conceptual elaborations means abandoning the strong adherence to them.

original: rtsod pa dang 'du 'dzin dang / spros pa'i mngon par zhen pa rnam par spang pa'i ched du brtson 'grus mchog bskyed de /
analyzed: rtsod pa dang 'du 'dzin dang / spros pa'i mngon par zhen pa rnam par spang pa'i ched du brtson 'grus mchog bskyed de /
translated: In order to liberate the world with its gods means in order to liberate the world of sentient beings.🔽In this yoga means in this yoga of the perfection of wisdom.🔽You should generate the highest effort means you should generate the highest effort in order to liberate the world with its gods.🔽Abandoning disputes, social interactions, and conceptual elaborations means abandoning the strong adherence to them.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams yongs su ba zla ba'i phyir nan tan gyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams yongs su ba zla ba'i phyir nan tan gyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In order to liberate the world with its gods means in order to liberate the world of sentient beings.🔽In this yoga means in this yoga of the perfection of wisdom.🔽You should generate the highest effort means you should generate the highest effort in order to liberate the world with its gods.🔽Abandoning disputes, social interactions, and conceptual elaborations means abandoning the strong adherence to them.🔽In order to liberate the world with its gods means in order to liberate

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Maitreya again addressed the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das dgongs pa zab mo rnam par nges pa'i 'grel pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir bstan pa 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dgongs pa zab mo rnam par nges pa'i 'grel pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir bstan pa 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: What is the name of this Dharma discourse taught in the profound definitive meaning commentary?🔽How should I remember it?

original: bdag gis ji ltar gzung bar bgyi zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa bka' bzhin du sgrub pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bdag gis ji ltar gzung bar bgyi zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa bka' bzhin du sgrub pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here onward, the third part is taught, called the side of practice according to the teachings.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhu ba @241b gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba @241b gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' byams pas de bzhin gshegs pa la zhu ba gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' byams pas de bzhin gshegs pa la zhu ba gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the noble Bodhisattva Maitreya's request to the Tathagata.

original: zhu ba gsol ba la yang dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba la yang dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: In the request, there are two kinds of intentions:

original: bstan pa'i ming zhus pa dang / ji ltar gzung ba zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i ming zhus pa dang / ji ltar gzung ba zhus pa'o //
translated: asking about the name of the teaching and asking how to remember it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said to the Bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di ni rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di ni rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Son of good family, this is called the teaching of the definitive meaning of yoga.

original: rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di la khyod kyis bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zhus pa'i lan du yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di la khyod kyis bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zhus pa'i lan du yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
translated: You should train in this teaching of the definitive meaning of yoga. This is the correct answer to the second question.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan yang dag par bstan pa dang / rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na zhes bya ba man chad bstan pa gsungs pa'i phan yon khyad par du 'phags pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan yang dag par bstan pa dang / rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na zhes bya ba man chad bstan pa gsungs pa'i phan yon khyad par du 'phags pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The correct teaching of the answer to the two questions, and the teaching of the special benefits of explaining this teaching of the definitive meaning of yoga from here on.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na 'khor 'dus pa chen po de las srog chags drug 'bum ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na 'khor 'dus pa chen po de las srog chags drug 'bum ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: When this teaching of the definitive meaning of yoga was explained, six hundred thousand beings from that great assembly generated the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: nyan thos sum 'bum ni rdul spangs nas dri ma dang bral te /
analyzed: nyan thos sum 'bum ni rdul spangs nas dri ma dang bral te /
translated: Three hundred thousand śrāvakas, having abandoned dust, became free from defilements.

original: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rnam par dag pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rnam par dag pa thob par gyur to //
translated: The Dharma eye, completely pure, was attained by the bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos 'bum lnga khri ni zag pa rnams yongs su zad nas sems rnam par grol ba thob par gyur to //
analyzed: nyan thos 'bum lnga khri ni zag pa rnams yongs su zad nas sems rnam par grol ba thob par gyur to //
translated: One hundred fifty thousand śrāvakas, having completely exhausted the defilements, attained liberation of mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis ni rnal 'byor yangs shing rgya che ba'i yid la byed pa thob par gyur to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa gsungs pa'i phan yon khyad par du 'phags pa ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis ni rnal 'byor yangs shing rgya che ba'i yid la byed pa thob par gyur to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa gsungs pa'i phan yon khyad par du 'phags pa ston to //
translated: Seventy-five thousand bodhisattvas attained the mental activity of vast and extensive yoga. This shows the special benefits of teaching the Dharma.

original: phan yon yang rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: phan yon yang rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four kinds of benefits:

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / rdul spangs nas dri ma dang bral te chos kyi mig rnam par dag pa thob pa dang / zag pa rnams gtan du zad nas sems rnam par grol bar gyur pa'i phan yon te /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / rdul spangs nas dri ma dang bral te chos kyi mig rnam par dag pa thob pa dang / zag pa rnams gtan du zad nas sems rnam par grol bar gyur pa'i phan yon te /
translated: arousing the mind of enlightenment, abandoning defilements, becoming free from stains, and attaining the completely pure Dharma eye; completely exhausting the defilements and attaining liberation of mind.

original: phan yon 'di gsum ni gong du bstan pa bzhin no /
analyzed: phan yon 'di gsum ni gong du bstan pa bzhin no /
translated: These three benefits are as explained above.

original: bzhi pa rnams 'byor yangs shing rgya che ba'i yid la byed pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang chos stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa de ni yang sa shing rgya che ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa rnams 'byor yangs shing rgya che ba'i yid la byed pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang chos stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa de ni yang sa shing rgya che ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The two kinds of emptiness of persons and things are called “vast and extensive.”

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ji skad du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gnyis ni rnal 'byor zhes @242a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ji skad du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gnyis ni rnal 'byor zhes @242a * //
translated: As the treatise Summary of the Great Vehicle teaches, “The two paths of śamatha and vipaśyanā are called ‘yoga.’

original: bya'o zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //🔽gnas drug bstan pa'i mdo las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bya'o zhes bstan pa lta bu'o // gnas drug bstan pa'i mdo las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is taught in the Sutra Teaching the Six Topics.🔽🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' des stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong thob pa'i phyir rnal 'byor yangs shing rgya che ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong thob pa'i phyir rnal 'byor yangs shing rgya che ba'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Sūtra Teaching the Six Topics says, “Because bodhisattvas attain śamatha and vipaśyanā that focus on the two kinds of emptiness, it is called ‘mental attention of vast and extensive unification.’🔽”

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni /
translated: The treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds says,

original: lnga po 'di dag ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can rnams la chos bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya che ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can rnams la chos bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya che ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: These five should be known as the extensive benefits of the result of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas teaching the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos bstan pa de nyid kyi tshe chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos bstan pa de nyid kyi tshe chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some sentient beings, at the very time of the teaching of the true Dharma, give rise to the eye of Dharma with regard to phenomena, free from dust and uncontaminated.

original: de nas sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i mdo la zag pa zad pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i mdo la zag pa zad pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, some sentient beings attain the exhaustion of defilements with regard to the sutra of the teaching of the true Dharma.

original: de dag las sems can kha cig ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de dag las sems can kha cig ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do //
translated: Some sentient beings among them generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos thos pa de nyid kyi mod la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i mchog thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las sems can kha cig ni dam pa'i chos thos pa de nyid kyi mod la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i mchog thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some sentient beings among them attain the supreme acceptance of the bodhisattva at that very moment of hearing the true Dharma.

original: de dag las sems can kha cig ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dam pa'i chos bstan pas lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / yang dag par sgrub cing gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshul gyis dam pa'i chos kyi tshul yun ring du gnas par byed par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag las sems can kha cig ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dam pa'i chos bstan pas lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / yang dag par sgrub cing gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshul gyis dam pa'i chos kyi tshul yun ring du gnas par byed par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Some sentient beings, through the teaching of the true Dharma by the buddhas and bodhisattvas, will receive the transmission of the true Dharma, recite it, practice it correctly, and through the process of one teaching many, they will cause the way of the true Dharma to remain for a long time.

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni /
translated: The treatise Ornament of Mahayana Sutras states:

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'chad pas 'bras bu rnam pa lnga 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'chad pas 'bras bu rnam pa lnga 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Bodhisattvas who teach the Dharma attain five results:

original: chos nyan pa dag byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ba dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa dang / chos rnams la rdul spangs nas dri ma dang bral te chos kyi mig rnam par dag pa 'thob pa dang / zag pa zad pa rnams 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: chos nyan pa dag byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ba dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa dang / chos rnams la rdul spangs nas dri ma dang bral te chos kyi mig rnam par dag pa 'thob pa dang / zag pa zad pa rnams 'thob pa dang /
translated: They cause those who listen to the Dharma to generate the mind of awakening, to attain the acceptance that phenomena are unborn, to attain the pure eye of Dharma by abandoning the stains of the phenomena, and to attain the exhaustion of defilements.

original: dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas pa dang / don ma bslabs pa rnams don 'thob pa dang / the tshom ma bcad pa rnams the tshom chad par 'gyur ba dang / the tshom chad pa rnams yang dag pa'i chos sgrib pa med pa'i dga' ba chen po'i rol yongs su longs spyod par 'gyur ba'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas pa dang / don ma bslabs pa rnams don 'thob pa dang / the tshom ma bcad pa rnams the tshom chad par 'gyur ba dang / the tshom chad pa rnams yang dag pa'i chos sgrib pa med pa'i dga' ba chen po'i rol yongs su longs spyod par 'gyur ba'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The holy Dharma will remain for a long time, those who have not learned the meaning will obtain the meaning, those who have not resolved their doubts will resolve their doubts, and those who have resolved their doubts will enjoy the great bliss of the unobscured true Dharma.

original: mdo 'di las ni phan yon rnam pa bzhi @242b yod par gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni phan yon rnam pa bzhi @242b yod par gsungs te /
translated: This sutra mentions four benefits.

original: rnal 'byor yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i bzod pa nyid la bya'o /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i bzod pa nyid la bya'o / // / bam po lnga bcu gnyis pa /
translated: The phrase “mental orientation to yoga” refers to the acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las sa dang pha rol du phyin pa'i le'u ste bdun pa'o zhes bya ba la 'di yang sgo rnam pa gsum du phye nas bstan te /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las sa dang pha rol du phyin pa'i le'u ste bdun pa'o zhes bya ba la 'di yang sgo rnam pa gsum du phye nas bstan te /
translated: This is the seventh chapter, called “The Stages and the Perfections,” in “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: le'u 'di nyid kyi ming bstan pa dang / go rims bzhin du dgongs pa bstan pa dang / tshig gi don yang dag par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: le'u 'di nyid kyi ming bstan pa dang / go rims bzhin du dgongs pa bstan pa dang / tshig gi don yang dag par bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the name of this chapter, the explanation of the intention in sequential order, and the explanation of the meaning of the words.

original: de la le'u 'di nyid kyi ming bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la le'u 'di nyid kyi ming bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the name of this chapter.

original: rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:🔽Bhūmi.

original: bh'u mi zhes bya ba bsgyur nas zhes zer te /
analyzed: bh'u mi zhes bya ba bsgyur nas zhes zer te /
translated: It is said that when translated,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it means like this.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas bcu gcig po dag skye ba la sogs pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas bcu gcig po dag skye ba la sogs pa'i don dang ldan pa'i phyir sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The eleven, beginning with the Joyous, are called stages because they are endowed with the meaning of birth and so forth.

original: sa zhes bya ba'i don de yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba'i don de yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the term stage is explained differently in the treatises.

original: kha cig las ni don rnam pa gcig gis sa zhes bya ba ston te /
analyzed: kha cig las ni don rnam pa gcig gis sa zhes bya ba ston te /
translated: In some, the stage is taught by a single meaning.

original: mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As it is said in the Sūtra Requested by the King of Men:

original: rigs la 'jug pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs la 'jug pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that enters the family is called abiding.

original: gnas pa las ni yon tan rnams skye bas sa zhes brjod do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnas pa las ni yon tan rnams skye bas sa zhes brjod do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Since qualities arise from abiding, it is called a stage.

original: gnas bcu pa'i bshad pa las dge ba'i rtsa ba rim par gnas pa'i gnas gang yin pa de ni sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gnas bcu pa'i bshad pa las dge ba'i rtsa ba rim par gnas pa'i gnas gang yin pa de ni sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The stage of the roots of virtue is called a level.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna written by Master Svābhāvikabhūmi says:

original: chos bdag med pa'i shes pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa'i shes pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: The stage of the knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena is called a level.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: The Yogācāra Levels says:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa sdud cing 'dzin pa'i phyir sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa'o /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa sdud cing 'dzin pa'i phyir sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa'o /
translated: Because it gathers and holds nirvāṇa, it is called a level.

original: kha cig las ni don rnam pa gnyis ni sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig las ni don rnam pa gnyis ni sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Some say that the two aspects of the object are called a level.

original: sngon gyi las bstan pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: sngon gyi las bstan pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: The Sūtra Teaching Past Deeds says:

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni yon tan brgya ston grangs med pa 'dzin par byed pas skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni yon tan brgya ston grangs med pa 'dzin par byed pas skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The buddha level is called birth because it holds the countless teachings of the hundred qualities.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i phyir sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i phyir sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because it causes the full accomplishment of all causes and effects, it is called a “stage.”🔽The treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only states:

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni rnal 'byor ba'i gnas dang yongs su 'dzin pa mchog tu gyur cing skye zhing 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni rnal 'byor ba'i gnas dang yongs su 'dzin pa mchog tu gyur cing skye zhing 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is the supreme abode and support of the yogi and because it causes birth and growth, it is called a “stage.”

original: de yang gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ni skye ba zhes bya'o //🔽yongs su @243a * //
analyzed: de yang gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ni skye ba zhes bya'o // yongs su @243a * //
translated: Because it is an abode, it is called “birth.”

original: 'dzin pa'i phyir ni 'phel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i phyir ni 'phel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is a support, it is called “growth.”

original: kha cig las ni don rnam pa gsum gyis nas zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig las ni don rnam pa gsum gyis nas zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Some say that it is called a “stage” because of three kinds of meaning.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las ji skad du /🔽sa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las ji skad du / sa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The commentary to the noble Buddha-bhumi says:🔽“Stage” means

original: gnas dang spyod par byed pa dang bsdu ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang spyod par byed pa dang bsdu ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: the abode, the activity, and the support.

original: de ni de bzhin nyid dang ye shes bzhi po dag ni longs spyod dang / dgongs pa ro gcig pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ni sangs rgyas kyi gnas dang / spyod yul dang bsdu ba yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin nyid dang ye shes bzhi po dag ni longs spyod dang / dgongs pa ro gcig pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ni sangs rgyas kyi gnas dang / spyod yul dang bsdu ba yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: That is, the reality and the four knowledges are the enjoyment, and the things that are of one taste with the enjoyment and the intention, etc., are the abode, the domain, and the collection of the Buddha, and therefore it is called the stage of the Buddha.

original: de la gnas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de la gnas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Therein, the abode is reality.

original: spyod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes bzhi po dag ste spyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes bzhi po dag ste spyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The domain is the four knowledges, because they are endowed with activity.

original: bsdu ba zhes bya ba ni ye shes bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba zhes bya ba ni ye shes bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The collection is the mind, mental states, etc., that are concomitant with the four knowledges.

original: kha cig las ni don rnam pa bzhis sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig las ni don rnam pa bzhis sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Some say that the stage is so called for four reasons.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i 'grel pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i 'grel pa las ji skad du /
translated: As the Vyakhyayukti says:

original: sa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The stage is so called because of the following:

original: spyod yul dang gnas dang spyod pa dang bsdu bar bya ba'i don yin te /
