analyzed: spyod yul dang gnas dang spyod pa dang bsdu bar bya ba'i don yin te /
translated: It is the domain, the abode, the activity, and the collection of the object.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir sa zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called stages because they are the domain of the yogi.

original: dper na rta'i dkyus pa lta phur de kho na las gzhan phyi rol du mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na rta'i dkyus pa lta phur de kho na las gzhan phyi rol du mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, the hooves of a horse do not go beyond the path.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pas gnas 'di la brten nas rang gi chos brtas shing 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pas gnas 'di la brten nas rang gi chos brtas shing 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, they are called stages because the yogi, in dependence on these stages, increases and expands his own Dharma.

original: dper na lo tog spyod pa'i sa dang 'dra bar de ni de dag gis yin no //
analyzed: dper na lo tog spyod pa'i sa dang 'dra bar de ni de dag gis yin no //
translated: For example, they are like the stage for the performance of a play.

original: yang na rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sar bsdus pa'i ye shes kyi spyod pa 'di la brten nas mngon du byed pa dang / 'di la brten nas 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sar bsdus pa'i ye shes kyi spyod pa 'di la brten nas mngon du byed pa dang / 'di la brten nas 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, they are called stages because the yogi, in dependence on this stage of the wisdom of the stages of yoga, manifests and increases.

original: dper na rin po che'i 'byung khungs kyis lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rin po che'i 'byung khungs kyis lta bu'o //
translated: For example, they are like a source of jewels.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pa dag 'di la spyod par byed cing rang gi chos kyi longs spyod nyams su myong bar byed pa'i phyir sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa dag 'di la spyod par byed cing rang gi chos kyi longs spyod nyams su myong bar byed pa'i phyir sa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, they are called stages because the yogi practices on them and experiences the enjoyment of his own Dharma.

original: dper na ba lang gis dang 'dra bas de ni de dag gis yin no zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang gis dang 'dra bas de ni de dag gis yin no zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the case of an ox, so it is said to be by them.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive analysis should be understood according to the teachings in the treatises Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras, Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahayana, Translation of the Life of Nagarjuna, Commentary on the Noble Buddha Land, and so on.

original: bstan pa rnam pa de @243b ltar tha dad par gyur pa yang 'jig rten pa'i sa bzhin du gong du bstan pa'i don rnams dang ldan pas dpe las ming du btags pa'i phyir sa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bstan pa rnam pa de @243b ltar tha dad par gyur pa yang 'jig rten pa'i sa bzhin du gong du bstan pa'i don rnams dang ldan pas dpe las ming du btags pa'i phyir sa zhes brjod do //
translated: The teachings are differentiated in this way, but since they possess the meanings taught above, like the worldly levels, they are called levels because they are designated by metaphors.

original: rgya gar skad du par mi ta zhes bya ba bsgyur na pha rol du phyin pa zhes zer te /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du par mi ta zhes bya ba bsgyur na pha rol du phyin pa zhes zer te /
translated: In Sanskrit, it is called paramita, which when translated means gone to the other shore.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis 'khor ba'i tshu rol nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyi rol du phyin par byed pa'i phyir pha rol du phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis 'khor ba'i tshu rol nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyi rol du phyin par byed pa'i phyir pha rol du phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they cause one to go from the near side of cyclic existence to the far side of nirvana by the power of generosity and so on, they are called perfections.

original: le'u 'di las sa dang pha rol du phyin pa rnams rgya cher ston pa'i phyir sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u zhes gsungs so //🔽de la go rims kyi dgongs pa bstan pa yang mtshungs pa med par spyod pa la gong du don rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: le'u 'di las sa dang pha rol du phyin pa rnams rgya cher ston pa'i phyir sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u zhes gsungs so // de la go rims kyi dgongs pa bstan pa yang mtshungs pa med par spyod pa la gong du don rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
translated: This chapter is called the chapter on the levels and perfections because it extensively teaches the levels and perfections.🔽The teaching on the intention of the sequence is also similar to the conduct without equal.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bstan pa dang / sa dang pha rol du phyin pa bstan pa'o zhes bstan pa las /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bstan pa dang / sa dang pha rol du phyin pa bstan pa'o zhes bstan pa las /
translated: The two topics taught above are the teaching on sustained calm and profound insight and the teaching on the levels and transcendent perfections.

original: de yan chad du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bstan nas /
analyzed: de yan chad du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bstan nas /
translated: Up to this point, the teaching has been on sustained calm and profound insight.

original: 'di man chad du ni gnyis pa sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo zhes ston te /
analyzed: 'di man chad du ni gnyis pa sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo zhes ston te /
translated: From here on, it is the second part, the explanation of the levels and transcendent perfections.

original: 'di ltar rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i sgo ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i sgo ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two ways of practicing yoga:

original: dang po ni zhi gnas dang pha rol du phyin pa la gnas nas lhag mthong skyed pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo yin pas de'i phyir sngar bstan to //
analyzed: dang po ni zhi gnas dang pha rol du phyin pa la gnas nas lhag mthong skyed pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo yin pas de'i phyir sngar bstan to //
translated: The first is the development of insight while abiding in serenity and the perfections. Since that is the door of the general characteristics, it is taught first.

original: gnyis pa ni sa la brten nas pha rol du phyin pa skyed pa gang yin pa de ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo yin pas de'i phyir phyis bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sa la brten nas pha rol du phyin pa skyed pa gang yin pa de ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo yin pas de'i phyir phyis bstan to //
translated: The second is the development of the perfections in dependence on the levels. Since that is the door of the specific characteristics, it is taught later.

original: yang na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir sngar bstan las la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa skyed pa ni rgyas pa yin pa'i phyir phyis bstan to //
analyzed: yang na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir sngar bstan las la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa skyed pa ni rgyas pa yin pa'i phyir phyis bstan to //
translated: Alternatively, serenity and insight are taught first because they are the summary. The development of the perfections in dependence on the levels is taught later because it is the extensive explanation.

original: go rims kyi dgongs pa bshad zin te /
analyzed: go rims kyi dgongs pa bshad zin te /
translated: The purpose of the sequence has been explained.

original: nga ni tshig gi don bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: nga ni tshig gi don bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now the meaning of the words will be explained.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara addressed the Lord as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: Lord, the Lord has said:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten bodhisattva stages are as follows:

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa dang / dri ma med pa'i sa dang / 'od byed pa'i sa dang / 'od 'phro ba can gyi sa dang / shin tu sbyang bar dka' ba'i sa dang / mngon du gyur pa'i sa dang / ring du song ba'i sa dang /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa dang / dri ma med pa'i sa dang / 'od byed pa'i sa dang / 'od 'phro ba can gyi sa dang / shin tu sbyang bar dka' ba'i sa dang / mngon du gyur pa'i sa dang / ring du song ba'i sa dang /
translated: the stage of utmost joy, the stage of stainlessness, the stage of bright radiance, the stage of blazing fire, the stage of difficult to conquer, the stage of presence, the stage of gone afar,🔽the stage of immovability, the stage of sublime wisdom, and the stage of the cloud of Dharma.

original: mi g-yo ba'i sa dang / legs pa'i blo gros kyi sa dang / chos kyi sprin gyi sa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyis ni bcu gcig pa'o zhes @244a * //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i sa dang / legs pa'i blo gros kyi sa dang / chos kyi sprin gyi sa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyis ni bcu gcig pa'o zhes @244a * //
translated: And, moreover, the Buddha’s stage is the eleventh.

original: gang gsungs pa'i sa de dag rnam par dag pa du dag dang / yan lag du dag gis bsdus lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa tshig gi don yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa'i sa de dag rnam par dag pa du dag dang / yan lag du dag gis bsdus lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa tshig gi don yang dag par ston to //
translated: The following passage up to “How many purities and how many branches are included in those stages?” is the third, the correct teaching of the words.

original: le'u 'di yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: le'u 'di yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This chapter is divided into two parts.

original: zhus pa dang lan dag gis yang dag par bstan pa'i phyogs dang / de nas byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces bya ba man chad bka' bzhin du sgrub pa'i phyogs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa dang lan dag gis yang dag par bstan pa'i phyogs dang / de nas byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces bya ba man chad bka' bzhin du sgrub pa'i phyogs bstan pa'o //
translated: The first part of the chapter is the section on the correct teaching through questions and answers, and the second part, beginning with the words “Then the Bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara,” is the section on the correct practice in accordance with the teaching.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The first part is also divided into two sections:

original: tshig rkyang pas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig rkyang pas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: the extensive explanation through prose and the brief teaching through verse.

original: yang na le'u 'di la rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: yang na le'u 'di la rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: Or else, this chapter is divided into three sections:

original: tshig rkyang pas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bsdus te bstan pa dang / bka' bzhin du yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: tshig rkyang pas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas mdor bsdus te bstan pa dang / bka' bzhin du yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
translated: the extensive explanation through prose, the brief teaching through verse, and the correct practice in accordance with the teaching.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang /
translated: Although there are these two ways of dividing the chapter,

original: 'dir ni re zhig bshad pa snga ma dang sbyar nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni re zhig bshad pa snga ma dang sbyar nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: here I will explain it according to the first way of dividing it.

original: de la tshig rkyang pas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: de la tshig rkyang pas rgya cher rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: The extensive explanation through prose is also divided into four sections:

original: sa rnams rgya cher bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to /
analyzed: sa rnams rgya cher bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to /
translated: The extensive teaching on the levels, and the Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara also addressed the Lord:🔽Bhagavan, how many bases of training do the Bodhisattvas have?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi rnam pa du zhig mchis zhes bya ba man chad kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rgya cher bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi rnam pa du zhig mchis zhes bya ba man chad kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rgya cher bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The extensive teaching on the perfections, and the Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara also addressed the Lord:🔽Bhagavan, are there latent afflictions on those levels?

original: bcom ldan 'das sa de dag la nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal du mchis lags zhes bya ba man chad kyis sa la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgrib pa bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sa de dag la nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal du mchis lags zhes bya ba man chad kyis sa la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgrib pa bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The extensive teaching on the generation of the perfections in dependence on the levels, the obscurations that are the discordant classes, and the Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara also addressed the Lord:🔽Bhagavan, are there latent afflictions on those levels?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du nyan thos kyi theg pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba man chad kyis de bzhin gshegs pas theg pa gcig tu gsungs pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du nyan thos kyi theg pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba man chad kyis de bzhin gshegs pas theg pa gcig tu gsungs pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The Lord has said that the vehicle is one, and so on, up to: the vehicle of the disciples.

original: de ltar rnam pa bzhir bstan pa la yang sa rnams la brten nas ni pha rol tu phyin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / pha rol du phyin pa la brten nas ni @244b sgrib pa rnams sel ba dang / sgrib pa yongs su bsal ba'i phyir ni theg pa gcig gis 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam pa bzhir bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bzhir bstan pa la yang sa rnams la brten nas ni pha rol tu phyin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / pha rol du phyin pa la brten nas ni @244b sgrib pa rnams sel ba dang / sgrib pa yongs su bsal ba'i phyir ni theg pa gcig gis 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam pa bzhir bstan to //
translated: Thus, the fourfold teaching is given in order to show the intention of the Tathagata in declaring the one vehicle, because the perfections arise in dependence on the stages, the obscurations are removed in dependence on the perfections, and the result is attained by the one vehicle because of the removal of the obscurations.

original: de las rnams rgya cher rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
analyzed: de las rnams rgya cher rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
translated: The extensive explanation of the fourfold teaching is divided into six topics.

original: rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of purity.

original: yan lag bcu gcig las brtsams nas sa rnams rnam par dbye ba dang / sa'i ming gi don bstan pa dang / kun du rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis las brtsams nas sa rnams rnam par dbye ba dang / khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad kyis sa rnams rnam par dbye ba dang /
analyzed: yan lag bcu gcig las brtsams nas sa rnams rnam par dbye ba dang / sa'i ming gi don bstan pa dang / kun du rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis las brtsams nas sa rnams rnam par dbye ba dang / khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad kyis sa rnams rnam par dbye ba dang /
translated: The classification of the stages in terms of the eleven masteries, the teaching of the meaning of the names of the stages, the classification of the stages in terms of the twenty two kinds of complete knowing, the classification of the stages in terms of their eight kinds of superiority,

original: skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa las brtsams nas sa rnams rnam par dbye ba dang / smon lam rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas sa rnams rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa las brtsams nas sa rnams rnam par dbye ba dang / smon lam rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas sa rnams rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: the classification of the stages in terms of the superiority of their births, and the classification of the stages in terms of the three kinds of prayers.

original: dang po yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: dang po yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The first of these is indicated by the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po byang chub sems dpas zhu ba gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po byang chub sems dpas zhu ba gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the first request of the bodhisattva.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gsum du bstan te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gsum du bstan te /
translated: This passage from the sutra is also taught in three parts.

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa smos pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du zhes bya ba man chad zhu ba gsol ba nyid kyi bstan pa smos pa dang / gang gsungs pa'i sa de dag ces bya ba man chad zhu ba gsol ba nyid kyi tshig bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa smos pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du zhes bya ba man chad zhu ba gsol ba nyid kyi bstan pa smos pa dang / gang gsungs pa'i sa de dag ces bya ba man chad zhu ba gsol ba nyid kyi tshig bstan pa'o //
translated: The request, the response, and the statement “The Bhagavat said” and so on are the teaching of the request. The statement “Those stages that were taught” and so on are the teaching of the words of the request.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces bya ba 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i ming ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces bya ba 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i ming ste /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara is the name of the bodhisattva who makes the request.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di nang shes rab dang snying rje dang ldan zhing phyi rol tu lus la sogs pa'i las gsum po dag rtsol ba med par rang gi dang gis rang dbang du gyur pas spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di nang shes rab dang snying rje dang ldan zhing phyi rol tu lus la sogs pa'i las gsum po dag rtsol ba med par rang gi dang gis rang dbang du gyur pas spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, this bodhisattva is called Avalokiteśvara because he is endowed with inner wisdom and compassion and because his outer activities of body and so on are effortless, spontaneous, and independent.

original: yang na shes pa dang yul las spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces ming du btags pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na shes pa dang yul las spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces ming du btags pa yin te /
translated: Or else, he is called Avalokiteśvara because he is named from his knowledge and his object.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, in the noble Great Collection Sutra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni snying rje chen po'i chos kyi sgo mo la gnas pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni snying rje chen po'i chos kyi sgo mo la gnas pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: it says, “The bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara is established in the Dharma gateway of great compassion.”

original: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
translated: Moreover, in the Lotus Sūtra,

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang ye shes gya nom stobs kyis ni //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang ye shes gya nom stobs kyis ni //
translated: it says, “Avalokiteśvara, through the power of his vast wisdom,

original: 'jig rten sdug bsngal rnams las yongs su skyob par byed //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten sdug bsngal rnams las yongs su skyob par byed // ces gsungs so //
translated: completely protects the world from suffering.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gzigs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gzigs pa'i mdo las /
translated: And in the Sūtra of the Tathāgata’s Inconceivable Secret,

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs @245a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs @245a * //
translated: it says, “The bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara

original: dbang phyug ni sngar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug ni sngar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas pa yin te /
translated: was a buddha who attained perfect awakening in the past.

original: mtshan yang dag pa'i chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag pa'i chos kyi snang ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: His name was Abhāva­samudgata­raśmi­rāja.”

original: 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pas spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug lung bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pas spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug lung bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: And in the noble Sūtra of the Tathāgata’s Teaching to Avalokiteśvara on Seeing the True Nature,🔽it says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni /
translated: The Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara

original: sangs rgyas byams pa'i rgyal tshab du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas byams pa'i rgyal tshab du gyur pa yin te /
translated: was the regent of the Buddha Maitreya.

original: mtshan ni sangs rgyas kun du ston pa'i ri'i rgyal po zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshan ni sangs rgyas kun du ston pa'i ri'i rgyal po zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: His name was the King of Mountains Who Shows All the Buddhas.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhu ba gsol ba'i gsung rab nyid smos pa ste /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhu ba gsol ba'i gsung rab nyid smos pa ste /
translated: There, the Bhagavat said, “Thus,” and so forth. He mentions the very teaching of the request.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo la sogs pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo la sogs pa las /
translated: Thus, in the noble Sutra of the Ten Stages and so forth,

original: sa bcu'i dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yongs su rdzogs par gsungs pas so //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yongs su rdzogs par gsungs pas so //
translated: the ten stages and the stage of the Tathagata are completely taught.

original: de la gang gsungs pa de dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid kyi tshig yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: de la gang gsungs pa de dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid kyi tshig yang dag par bstan to //
translated: There, “those that are taught,” and so forth, correctly demonstrate the very words of the request.

original: 'di la dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di la dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Here, there are two intentions.

original: dang po ni sa bcu po dag rnam par dag pa bzhi las /
analyzed: dang po ni sa bcu po dag rnam par dag pa bzhi las /
translated: The first is that the ten stages are included in four purities.

original: du dag gis bsdus par 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: du dag gis bsdus par 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: How many of those are included?

original: gnyis pa ni yan lag bcu gcig las ni du dag gis bsdus par 'gyur zhes zhu ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yan lag bcu gcig las ni du dag gis bsdus par 'gyur zhes zhu ba'o //
translated: The second is the question: “By how many of the eleven branches are they included?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Lord said to the Bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara:🔽“Son of noble family, you should know that those stages are included in four purities and eleven branches.”

original: rigs kyi bu sa de dag ni rnam par dag pa bzhi dang yan lag bcu gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sa de dag ni rnam par dag pa bzhi dang yan lag bcu gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: This is the second, the Tathāgata’s correct answer.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: lan mdor bsdus te gsungs pa dang / zhus pa dang lan dag gis rgya cher bshad pa ste /
analyzed: lan mdor bsdus te gsungs pa dang / zhus pa dang lan dag gis rgya cher bshad pa ste /
translated: the brief answer and the extensive explanation through questions and answers.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: ji ltar rnam par dag pa bzhi po dag gis sa rnams bsdus par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhus pa dang lan dag gis rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par dag pa bzhi po dag gis sa rnams bsdus par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhus pa dang lan dag gis rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: “How are the stages included in the four purities?” and so on, it shows the extensive explanation through questions and answers.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: rnam par dag pa bzhis sa rnams bsdus par bstan pa dang / yan lag bcu gcig gis sa rnams bsdus par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa bzhis sa rnams bsdus par bstan pa dang / yan lag bcu gcig gis sa rnams bsdus par bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching on the inclusion of the stages by means of the four purities, and the teaching on the inclusion of the stages by means of the eleven elements.

original: dang po yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: dang po yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The first is taught by means of the question and the answer.

original: 'di ni dang po brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po brtag pa'o //
translated: This is the first question.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The answer is as follows:

original: sa dang po ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par @245b dag pas bsdus so //
analyzed: sa dang po ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par @245b dag pas bsdus so //
translated: The first stage is included in the purity of superior intention.

original: sa gnyis pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pas bsdus so //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pas bsdus so //
translated: The second stage is included in the purity of superior morality.

original: sa gsum pa ni lhag pa'i sems rnam par dag pas bsdus so //🔽lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par dag pa ni sa phyi ma dag tu ches gya nom par 'gyur ba'i phyir sa bzhi po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sa gsum pa ni lhag pa'i sems rnam par dag pas bsdus so // lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par dag pa ni sa phyi ma dag tu ches gya nom par 'gyur ba'i phyir sa bzhi po nas bzung ste /
translated: The third stage is included in the purity of superior mind.🔽The purity of superior wisdom is to be known as included from the fourth stage up to the Buddha stage, because it becomes ever more sublime on the subsequent stages.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the second correct answer.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: The explanation, and the conclusion.

original: 'di ni dang po rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the first explanation.

original: 'di ltar rnam par dag pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par dag pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: Thus there are four purities,

original: mdo 'di nyid las ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: as stated in this very Sutra.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni gnas pa bzhi zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni gnas pa bzhi zhes bshad de /
translated: In the Yogacarabhumi Sastra, they are called the four stations,

original: de'i mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa'i rnam par dag pa bzhi po dag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa'i rnam par dag pa bzhi po dag nyid do //
translated: and they are the four purities stated in this very Sutra.🔽The first of these is included in the purity of superior intention.

original: de las dang po ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pas bsdus so zhes bya ba la lhag pa'i bsam pa de'i bdag nyid kyang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad ba mi mthun te /🔽bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni /
analyzed: de las dang po ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pas bsdus so zhes bya ba la lhag pa'i bsam pa de'i bdag nyid kyang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad ba mi mthun te / bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni /
translated: The nature of superior intention is also explained differently in the various teachings.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /
translated: In the commentary to the Mahayana Samgraha Sastra, it is said to be the essence of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de'i phyir 'grel ba de nyid las lhag pa'i bsam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel ba de nyid las lhag pa'i bsam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, that very commentary teaches that the superior attitude is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni bsam pa rnam par dag pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni bsam pa rnam par dag pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: Moreover, that very commentary explains that nonconceptual wisdom is the purity of attitude.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni mos pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni mos pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra explains that it is the essence of aspiration.

original: de'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa'i le'u las dad pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mos pa dang so sor rtog pa dang / nges par 'byed pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa'i le'u las dad pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mos pa dang so sor rtog pa dang / nges par 'byed pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the chapter on superior attitude explains that superior attitude is the faith that precedes, the discernment of phenomena that precedes, and the aspiration and discernment of the qualities of buddhahood that lead to the discernment of the truths.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa las ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa las ni /
translated: The commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna composed by the master Niḥsvabhāva states:

original: dang pa dang 'dun pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dang pa dang 'dun pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /
translated: It is the essence of faith and aspiration.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las lhag pa'i bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las lhag pa'i bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the same commentary states, the nature of superior intention is as follows:

original: dad pa dang 'dun pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dad pa dang 'dun pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: It is the essence of faith and aspiration.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las kyang de skad du bstan te /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las kyang de skad du bstan te /
translated: The commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu also teaches this.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las @246a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las @246a * //
translated: Therefore, the same commentary states:

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nature of superior intention is as follows:

original: 'dun pa dang mos pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang mos pa'o //
translated: It is aspiration and conviction.

original: de la re zhig 'dun pa ni re zhing tshol ba'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dun pa ni re zhing tshol ba'o //
translated: In this regard, aspiration is the desire and search for something.

original: dad pa ni mos pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dad pa ni mos pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Faith is called conviction.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las kyang de skad du bstan to //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las kyang de skad du bstan to //
translated: This is also taught in the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: In the commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, the Translation of the Words of the Cow, it states:

original: yang dag pa'i bstan pa rnams la sems nges shing som nyi med pa'i phyir dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bstan pa rnams la sems nges shing som nyi med pa'i phyir dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the mind is certain and free of doubt with regard to the true teachings, it is called faith.

original: ji ltar mngon par yid ches pa'i chos nyid la bsgom par 'dun pa gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par yid ches pa'i chos nyid la bsgom par 'dun pa gang yin pa de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The aspiration to cultivate the reality that is thus realized is called superior attitude.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa de'i rnam pa dang / grangs tha dad par gyur pa ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam pa bcu ji snyed bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa de'i rnam pa dang / grangs tha dad par gyur pa ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam pa bcu ji snyed bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: The different aspects and categories of superior attitude are taught in the Yogacarya Levels, which explains ten types of superior attitude.🔽Thus, the Bodhisattvas Levels states:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thog ma nyid du rab tu dga' ba'i sa la gnas pa la bsam pa rnam pa bcus bsam pa dag pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thog ma nyid du rab tu dga' ba'i sa la gnas pa la bsam pa rnam pa bcus bsam pa dag pa thob pa yin no //
translated: Here, a bodhisattva who is on the first bodhisattva level, the Joyous, attains pure superior attitude through ten kinds of superior attitude.

original: slob dpon dang bla ma dang sbyin gnas thams cad la mi slu ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang chos mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la nges pa dang / 'grogs na bde ba'i bsam pa dang nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: slob dpon dang bla ma dang sbyin gnas thams cad la mi slu ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang chos mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la nges pa dang / 'grogs na bde ba'i bsam pa dang nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: The superior attitude of not deceiving all masters, gurus, and worthy ones; the superior attitude of being certain and happy in the company of bodhisattvas; the superior attitude of being free of defilements and secondary defilements; the superior attitude of being free of the two kinds of doubt; the superior attitude of being free of the two kinds of false views; the superior attitude of being free of the two kinds of pride; the superior attitude of being free of the two kinds of fear; the superior attitude of being free of the two kinds of obscuration; the superior attitude of being free of the two kinds of degeneration; and the superior attitude of being free of the two kinds of distraction.

original: bdud kyi las thams cad zil gyis gnon cing rang gi sems la dbang bya ba'i bsam pa dang / 'du byed thams cad la nyes pa'i bsam pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la phan yon gyi bsam pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dge ba rnams sgom pa la rtag tu bya ba'i bsam pa dang /
analyzed: bdud kyi las thams cad zil gyis gnon cing rang gi sems la dbang bya ba'i bsam pa dang / 'du byed thams cad la nyes pa'i bsam pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la phan yon gyi bsam pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dge ba rnams sgom pa la rtag tu bya ba'i bsam pa dang /
translated: The ten kinds of correct intention are the intention to overcome all the activities of Mara and to master one's own mind, the intention to see all compounded things as faults, the intention to see nirvana as a benefit, the intention to constantly practice the meditation of the virtues that are in harmony with enlightenment,

original: bsgom pa de nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa'i rab tu dben pa'i bsam pa dang / 'jig rten gyi zang zing dang / thos pa dang rnyed pa dang bkur sti thams cad la mi lta ba'i bsam pa dang / theg pa dman pa spangs te /
analyzed: bsgom pa de nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa'i rab tu dben pa'i bsam pa dang / 'jig rten gyi zang zing dang / thos pa dang rnyed pa dang bkur sti thams cad la mi lta ba'i bsam pa dang / theg pa dman pa spangs te /
translated: the intention to be in harmony with the solitude that is in harmony with that meditation, the intention not to look for any worldly material things, learning, gain or honor, the intention to abandon the Hinayana and

original: theg pa chen po rtogs par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po rtogs par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i bsam pa ste /
translated: to realize the Mahayana, the intention to benefit all sentient beings,

original: phyin ci log med pa'i bsam pa bcu po 'di dag ni sems de la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log med pa'i bsam pa bcu po 'di dag ni sems de la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: These ten kinds of correct intention are the entry to that mind.

original: de'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is called pure superior attitude.

original: rgya cher rnam par dbye na lhag pa'i bsam pa bco lnga yod de /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par dbye na lhag pa'i bsam pa bco lnga yod de /
translated: If it is analyzed in detail, there are fifteen kinds of superior attitude.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor @246b spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor @246b spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood according to the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa las /
translated: In the commentary on the Mahāyānasaṃgraha composed by the master Niḥsvabhāva,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa brgyad yod de /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa brgyad yod de /
translated: it says that the characteristics of superior attitude are of eight kinds.

original: tshogs kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshogs kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the sake of the collection means

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: that is,

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa dag gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis dang rab tu bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa dag gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis dang rab tu bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the two kinds of collections of merit and knowledge on the stage of action in faith that are taught.🔽For the sake of being worthy of the name of a bodhisattva means

original: bzod pa'i 'os su gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i 'os su gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: that is,

original: chos la so sor rtog pa'i bzod pa mchog thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos la so sor rtog pa'i bzod pa mchog thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: attaining the supreme patience of discernment of phenomena.

original: de ni bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog dag yin no //
analyzed: de ni bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog dag yin no //
translated: because of their counteractives,🔽because of their own-nature,🔽because of their signs,

original: dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: because of their accomplishment,🔽and because of their noninterruption.🔽Because of their object,🔽because of their attention,🔽because of their counteractives,🔽because of their own-nature,🔽because of their signs,🔽because of their accomplishment,

original: theg pa chen po zab cing rgya che ba 'phags pa'i bstan pa dag la dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po zab cing rgya che ba 'phags pa'i bstan pa dag la dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and because of their noninterruption.🔽Because of their object,🔽because of their attention,

original: yid la byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: because of their counteractives,🔽because of their own-nature,🔽because of their signs,🔽because of their accomplishment,🔽and because of their noninterruption.🔽Because of their object,🔽because of their attention,🔽because of their counteractives,🔽because of their own-nature,🔽because of their signs,

original: chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa tsam du rig pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa tsam du rig pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: because of their accomplishment,🔽and because of their noninterruption.🔽Because of their object,🔽because of their attention,

original: gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: because of their counteractives,🔽because of their own-nature,🔽because of their signs,🔽because of their accomplishment,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'o //
translated: and because of their noninterruption.🔽Because of their object,🔽because of their attention,🔽because of their counteractives,🔽because of their own-nature,🔽because of their signs,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: because of their accomplishment,🔽and because of their noninterruption.🔽Because of their object,🔽because of their attention,🔽because of their counteractives,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa de dad pa dang 'dun pas rang gi bdag nyid byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa de dad pa dang 'dun pas rang gi bdag nyid byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of their own-nature,🔽because of their signs,🔽because of their accomplishment,🔽and because of their noninterruption.🔽Because of their object,🔽because of their attention,🔽because of their counteractives,🔽because of their own-nature,🔽because of their signs,🔽because of their accomplishment,🔽and because of their noninterruption.🔽Because of their object,🔽because of their attention,🔽because of their counteractives,🔽because of their own-nature,🔽because of their signs,🔽because of their accomplishment,🔽and because of their noninterruption.🔽Because of their object,🔽because of their attention,🔽because of their counteractives,🔽because of their own-nature,🔽because of their signs,

original: rtags kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtags kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: because of their accomplishment,🔽and because of their noninterruption.🔽Because of their object,🔽because of their attention,

original: sa'i mdun rol pa dang sa la gnas pa dag ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa na sangs rgyas rnams mthong ba'i rtags gang yin pa'o //🔽phan yon gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sa'i mdun rol pa dang sa la gnas pa dag ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa na sangs rgyas rnams mthong ba'i rtags gang yin pa'o // phan yon gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The sign of the bodhisattva who is on the stage of action through faith and who has entered into concentration is that he sees the Buddhas.

original: byang chub dang nye zhing dka' ba med par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub dang nye zhing dka' ba med par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: For the benefit means that he is close to enlightenment and he understands it without difficulty.

original: rgya cher rnam par dbye ba ni tshigs su bcad ba gsum pa dang 'grel pa nyid las bstan te /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par dbye ba ni tshigs su bcad ba gsum pa dang 'grel pa nyid las bstan te /
translated: The extensive classification is taught in the third verse and its commentary.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is taught in detail in the same text.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las ni mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun gyis ston te gnyen por gyur ba bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las ni mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun gyis ston te gnyen por gyur ba bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu, the seven characteristics are taught in order to set forth the antidotes.🔽The second of these is included in the purity of superior morality.

original: de las gnyis pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pas bsdus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de las gnyis pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pas bsdus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The third is included in the purity of superior mind.

original: sa gnyis pas 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa phra mo yongs su spangs nas sa 'di la gnas shing rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang ldan te las kyi nyes pa chung du yang kun du mi spyod na /
analyzed: sa gnyis pas 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa phra mo yongs su spangs nas sa 'di la gnas shing rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang ldan te las kyi nyes pa chung du yang kun du mi spyod na /
translated: On the second ground, having completely abandoned the faults of faulty morality, the bodhisattva who abides on this ground has natural morality and does not engage in even the slightest fault of karma,

original: @247a * // 'bring dang chen po lta ci smos te /
analyzed: @247a * // 'bring dang chen po lta ci smos te /
translated: let alone middling or great faults.

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa des nas gnyis pa bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa des nas gnyis pa bsdus pa yin te /
translated: This completely pure morality includes the second ground.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The extensive analysis is as taught in the Yogācāra Levels.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las sa 'di la 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes ba lnga bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las sa 'di la 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes ba lnga bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: Moreover, the Yogācāra Levels says that on this ground the bodhisattva accomplishes and abides in the four mundane meditative concentrations, the four formless meditative attainments, the four immeasurables, and the five superknowledges.

original: de de dag gis lan mang du gnas te /
analyzed: de de dag gis lan mang du gnas te /
translated: He abides in them many times.

original: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de dag las bzlog nas smon lam gyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams su gang du sems can gyi don byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa mthong ba der skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de dag las bzlog nas smon lam gyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams su gang du sems can gyi don byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa mthong ba der skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Having turned away from those meditative stabilizations, liberations, concentrations, and meditative attainments, by the power of his prayers he is reborn wherever he sees that he can benefit sentient beings and complete the factors of enlightenment.

original: nang gi sems rnam par dag pa la brten nas de'i 'od dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: nang gi sems rnam par dag pa la brten nas de'i 'od dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He is endowed with light based on the inner purity of his mind.🔽Therefore, that abode is called the superior mind.

original: de lta bas na gnas de lhag ba'i sems zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'gyur bas don des nas gsum pa ni lhag pa'i sems rnam par dag pas bsdus so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas de lhag ba'i sems zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'gyur bas don des nas gsum pa ni lhag pa'i sems rnam par dag pas bsdus so zhes gsungs te /
translated: The third is said to be included in the purity of superior mind.

original: rgya cher ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught extensively in the Yogācārabhūmi.

original: de la lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par dag pa ni sa bzhi pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par dag pa ni sa bzhi pa nas bzung ste /
translated: There, the purity of superior wisdom begins from the fourth ground.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar lhag pa'i shes rab kyi sa phyi ma brgyad po dag sdud pas sa bzhi pa nas gong ma gong ma'i sa rnams su shes rab kyi sgo rnam pa sna tshogs ches khyad par du 'phags shing gya🔽nom par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar lhag pa'i shes rab kyi sa phyi ma brgyad po dag sdud pas sa bzhi pa nas gong ma gong ma'i sa rnams su shes rab kyi sgo rnam pa sna tshogs ches khyad par du 'phags shing gya nom par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Up to the level of buddhahood refers to the fact that the latter eight levels of superior wisdom are included in the four levels, from the fourth level onward, because the doors of wisdom on the higher and higher levels are increasingly superior and excellent.

original: 'di ltar sa bzhi pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bzhi pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa'o //
translated: Thus, the fourth level is the level of the superior wisdom that is endowed with the factors of enlightenment.

original: lnga pa ni bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa'o //
translated: The fifth level is the level of the superior wisdom that is endowed with the truths.

original: drug pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa'o //
translated: The sixth level is the level of the superior wisdom that is endowed with dependent origination.

original: bdun pa ni rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pa ni rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The seventh level is the level of the signless that is accompanied by effort.

original: brgyad pa ni rtsol ba med pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni rtsol ba med pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The eighth level is the level of the signless that is without effort.

original: dgu pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dgu pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la gnas pa'o //
translated: The ninth is the stage of the four right discriminations.

original: bcu pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mchog dang yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas @247b pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mchog dang yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas @247b pa'o //
translated: The tenth is the stage of the best and most perfect of the bodhisattvas.

original: bcu gcig pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bcu gcig pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ste /
translated: The eleventh is the stage of the Tathagata.

original: rgya cher ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in detail in the Yogacarabhumi.

original: sa bzhi pa yan chad shes rab 'ba' zhig dang ldan par cis mngon zhe na /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa yan chad shes rab 'ba' zhig dang ldan par cis mngon zhe na /
translated: How is it known that the bodhisattvas from the fourth stage on have only wisdom?

original: smras pa bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa ni rnam pa bzhi las gnas pa bzhi pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa ni rnam pa bzhi las gnas pa bzhi pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: It is said that the bodhisattva who is established in the Yogacarabhumi has four kinds of stages, and the fourth is the stage of superior wisdom.

original: de yan chad shes rab las brtsams nas bstan pa yin par shes so //
analyzed: de yan chad shes rab las brtsams nas bstan pa yin par shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is known that the teaching is based on wisdom from the fourth stage on.🔽Son of noble family, you should know that the stages are summarized by these four kinds of purity.

original: rigs kyi bu rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis sa rnams yongs su bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis sa rnams yongs su bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the second general conclusion.

original: 'di ltar dag pa bzhi po dag ni yon tan rdzas su yod pa yin la sa ni btags pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dag pa bzhi po dag ni yon tan rdzas su yod pa yin la sa ni btags pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, the four purities are substantial qualities, and the stages are nominal.

original: 'di ni rdzas su yod pa dag gis brtags pa bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rdzas su yod pa dag gis brtags pa bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is a summary of the nominal by the substantial.

original: ji ltar yan lag rnam pa bcu gcig gis sa rnams bsdus par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa yan lag bcu gcig sdud par ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag rnam pa bcu gcig gis sa rnams bsdus par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa yan lag bcu gcig sdud par ston to //
translated: The section beginning with “How are the stages summarized by the eleven aspects?” shows the second summary by the eleven aspects.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is also shown in two parts: the request and the response.

original: 'di ni dang po bstan pa la brten nas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po bstan pa la brten nas zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the request based on the first explanation:

original: yan lag bcu gcig dang / sa bcu gcig po dag gnas skabs tha dad pa med kyang don ni tha dad de /
analyzed: yan lag bcu gcig dang / sa bcu gcig po dag gnas skabs tha dad pa med kyang don ni tha dad de /
translated: Although the eleven aspects and the eleven stages do not have different states, their meanings are different.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las mya ngan las 'das pa'i don sdud cing yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las mya ngan las 'das pa'i don sdud cing yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in the treatise Stages of Yogācāra, it says, “Because it gathers and holds the meaning of nirvāṇa, it is called a stage.”

original: longs spyod pa'i gnas kyi don gyi phyir gnas zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i gnas kyi don gyi phyir gnas zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: And because it is the basis of enjoyment, it is called a stage.🔽The treatise Ornament of Mahayana Sutras explains:

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni gnas par mos pas gnas zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni gnas par mos pas gnas zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Because of conviction in abiding, it is called a stage.

original: de la yan lag ces bya ba ni gnas kyi don te /
analyzed: de la yan lag ces bya ba ni gnas kyi don te /
translated: In that passage, “limb” means “stage.”

original: 'di ltar gnas bcu gcig po dag phyogs so so tha dad pa'i yan lag ces bshad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas bcu gcig po dag phyogs so so tha dad pa'i yan lag ces bshad de /
translated: Thus the eleven stages are explained as the different limbs of the different directions.🔽In the explanation of the ten stages, the chapter on the similes states:

original: gnas pa bcu'i bshad pa'i nang nas dpe'i le'u las de las dang po'i yan lag ni chos rnams ji snyed yod pa 'dus pa las sa dang po mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni sa dang po'i yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa bcu'i bshad pa'i nang nas dpe'i le'u las de las dang po'i yan lag ni chos rnams ji snyed yod pa 'dus pa las sa dang po mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni sa dang po'i yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The first limb of the first stage is the accomplishment of the first stage from the accumulation of as many dharmas as there are.

original: 'di ni gnas pa bcu gsum las dang po gnyis ma gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni gnas pa bcu gcig ces bya ste /🔽gnas pa @248a * //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas pa bcu gsum las dang po gnyis ma gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni gnas pa bcu gcig ces bya ste /🔽gnas pa @248a * //
translated: This is called the eleven stages, excluding the first two of the thirteen stages.

original: bcu gcig ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du rigs la gnas pa dang / mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa dang / rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: bcu gcig ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du rigs la gnas pa dang / mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa dang / rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa dang /
translated: Abiding in the lineage, abiding in the stage of devoted engagement, abiding in the stage of joyous perseverance, abiding in superior morality, abiding in superior thought,🔽abiding in superior wisdom endowed with the factors of enlightenment, abiding in superior wisdom endowed with the truths, abiding in superior wisdom endowed with dependent origination, abiding in signlessness with application and effort,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa dang / bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa dang / bden pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang /
translated: abiding in signlessness without application and effort, and abiding in the result of stream enterer.

original: rtsol ba med cing lhun gyis grub pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa mchog dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba med cing lhun gyis grub pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa mchog dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is the signless, which is effortless and spontaneous, the correct and distinct awareness, the supreme bodhisattva stage, and the tathagata stage.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is taught in detail in that same sutra.

original: mdo 'di las ni gnas pa dang po gnyis ma gtogs pa gnas pa bcu gcig las brtsams nas yan lag gi ming gis ston par mdzad pas /
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni gnas pa dang po gnyis ma gtogs pa gnas pa bcu gcig las brtsams nas yan lag gi ming gis ston par mdzad pas /
translated: In this sutra, the first two stages are omitted, and the eleven stages are taught by the names of their branches.

original: de'i phyir 'dir yan lag gis sa rnams sdud par bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir yan lag gis sa rnams sdud par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, in this sutra, the stages are subsumed by their branches.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽The bodhisattvas, on the stage of action through faith, on the basis of the ten dharmas, give rise to the acceptance of the conviction in the Dharma, and because they have cultivated it well, they attain the stage of pure universal responsibility.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sngar mos pas spyod pa'i sa la chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu la brten nas mos pa'i bzod pa shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sngar mos pas spyod pa'i sa la chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu la brten nas mos pa'i bzod pa shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston
translated: This is the second stage, the tathagata stage, which is taught as the reply.

original: to // 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: to // 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the correct response to the question and the general conclusion beginning with “Son of noble family.”

original: lan du yang dag par gsungs pa la yang yan lag bcu gcig pa bstan pa nyid kyis bcu gcig tu dbye ste /
analyzed: lan du yang dag par gsungs pa la yang yan lag bcu gcig pa bstan pa nyid kyis bcu gcig tu dbye ste /
translated: The correct response is divided into eleven parts, as indicated by the eleven topics.

original: 'di ni yan lag dang pos sa rab tu dga' ba bsdus par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yan lag dang pos sa rab tu dga' ba bsdus par bstan pa'o //
translated: The first part includes the presentation of the first bhumi, the Joyful One.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: sa'i mdun rol bas dang por ma zhugs pa bstan pa dang sa de las yang dag par 'das nas zhes bya ba man chad sa'i mdun rol las yang dag par 'das nas sa dang por 'jug pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa'i mdun rol bas dang por ma zhugs pa bstan pa dang sa de las yang dag par 'das nas zhes bya ba man chad sa'i mdun rol las yang dag par 'das nas sa dang por 'jug pa bstan pa ste /
translated: the presentation of the first bhumi, the Joyful One, as the initial entry into the bhumi, and the presentation of the entry into the first bhumi, the Joyful One, as the complete transcendence of the previous bhumi, beginning with “having completely transcended the bhumi that is the completely perfect Joyful One.”

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first part.

original: yan lag bcu gcig po 'di bstan pa la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis @248b yod de /
analyzed: yan lag bcu gcig po 'di bstan pa la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis @248b yod de /
translated: The presentation of the eleven parts also has two explanations:

original: kha cig ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las kyang lang gi tshe bsgyur ba la brten nas sa re re la yang sgrib pa gsum gsum spangs nas yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa thob bar 'gyur ba las brtsams nas sa bcu gcig
analyzed: kha cig ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las kyang lang gi tshe bsgyur ba la brten nas sa re re la yang sgrib pa gsum gsum spangs nas yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa thob bar 'gyur ba las brtsams nas sa bcu gcig
translated: Some say: The commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna explains that based on the transformation of the body, on each level one abandons three obscurations and obtains special qualities.🔽

original: po dag ston te /
analyzed: po dag ston te /
translated: Some say: The treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna sets forth the eleven levels, beginning from the level of the buddhas, because the qualities of each level are attained by abandoning three obscurations on each level.

original: de la bya brag yod pa yang /
analyzed: de la bya brag yod pa yang /
translated: The differences are as follows.

original: de las dang po gcig gis ni sgrib pa rnam pa gsum spangs nas yon tan bcu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las dang po gcig gis ni sgrib pa rnam pa gsum spangs nas yon tan bcu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The first level is attained by abandoning three obscurations and attaining ten qualities.

original: sa bar ma dgu po dag gis ni so so nas sgrib pa gsum gsum spangs nas yon tan brgyad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bar ma dgu po dag gis ni so so nas sgrib pa gsum gsum spangs nas yon tan brgyad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nine intermediate levels are attained by abandoning three obscurations on each level and attaining eight qualities.

original: sa phyi ma gcig gis ni sgrib pa gsum spangs nas yon tan bdun 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa phyi ma gcig gis ni sgrib pa gsum spangs nas yon tan bdun 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The final level is attained by abandoning three obscurations and attaining seven qualities.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des nas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des nas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer te /
translated: By these causes and conditions, the levels are completely perfected.

original: phyis 'og nas ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis 'og nas ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: kha cig na re sa re re la yang spyod pa rnams bsgrubs pas rgyu dang rkyen byed de ji ltar sa rab tu dga' ba la chos spyod rnam pa bcu dang / mos pa'i bzod pa bsgoms pas rgyu dang rkyen byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kha cig na re sa re re la yang spyod pa rnams bsgrubs pas rgyu dang rkyen byed de ji ltar sa rab tu dga' ba la chos spyod rnam pa bcu dang / mos pa'i bzod pa bsgoms pas rgyu dang rkyen byed pa bzhin no //
translated: Some say: Each level serves as cause and condition for the others because the practices are accomplished on each level. For example, the level of the joyous one serves as cause and condition for the others through the cultivation of the ten Dharma activities and the acceptance of the teaching of faith.

original: de la yan lag ces bya ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la yan lag ces bya ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The limbs are as follows:

original: sa bcu'i phyogs kyi cha so so tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni yan lag ces bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: sa bcu'i phyogs kyi cha so so tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni yan lag ces bya'o zhe'o //
translated: The individual parts of the ten levels are called limbs.

original: de la sa dang po bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: de la sa dang po bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The first level is taught in two parts:

original: sa'i mdun rol pas phyi ma'i rgyu spyod pa bsgrub pa bstan pa dang / rang gi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bsgrub par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa'i mdun rol pas phyi ma'i rgyu spyod pa bsgrub pa bstan pa dang / rang gi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bsgrub par bstan pa ste /
translated: the teaching of the practice that is the cause of the later levels and the teaching of the practice that perfects its own limbs.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gang zag smos pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gang zag smos pa ste /
translated: The mention of the person who practices yoga is bodhisattvas.

original: rigs dang ldan pa dang / brten pa'i rigs can gyi gang zag rnam pa gnyis po dag go //
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pa dang / brten pa'i rigs can gyi gang zag rnam pa gnyis po dag go //
translated: There are two kinds of persons: those who possess the potential and those who are potential adherents.

original: sngar mos pas spyod pa'i sa las zhes bya ba ni spyod pa gnas pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: sngar mos pas spyod pa'i sa las zhes bya ba ni spyod pa gnas pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The stage of conduct is the stage of conduct that is based on the stage of devoted interest.

original: sngar bstan pa'i tshogs dang sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mthar phyin pa'i gnas skabs lnga las gnas skabs dang po gnyis la brten nas /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i tshogs dang sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mthar phyin pa'i gnas skabs lnga las gnas skabs dang po gnyis la brten nas /
translated: Of the five stages previously mentioned, the stage of equipment, the stage of preparation, the stage of insight, the stage of cultivation, and the stage of culmination, the first two stages are the stage of conduct that is based on the stage of devoted interest.

original: mos pa shin tu zab pa skyed pas mos pa spyod pas spyod pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa shin tu zab pa skyed pas mos pa spyod pas spyod pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because one generates a very profound devoted interest, it is called the stage of conduct that is based on the stage of devoted interest.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the commentary to the Mahayana-samgraha says,

original: sa rnams la mos pa shin tu zab pa gang yin pa de ni sa'i grangs kyi chos la de khon bzhin du nges @249a * //🔽par 'dzin par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sa rnams la mos pa shin tu zab pa gang yin pa de ni sa'i grangs kyi chos la de khon bzhin du nges @249a * //🔽par 'dzin par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: “The profound devoted interest in the stages is the ascertainment of the phenomena of the stages just as they are.

original: de la chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnas skabs la brten nas spyod pa slong ba ste /
analyzed: de la chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnas skabs la brten nas spyod pa slong ba ste /
translated: The passage beginning based on the ten Dharma activities and so on is an exhortation to practice based on the occasion.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la brten nas yang dag pa'i spyod pa rnam pa bcu 'byung bas so //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la brten nas yang dag pa'i spyod pa rnam pa bcu 'byung bas so //
translated: Because the ten correct practices arise based on the stage of devoted engagement.

original: yang dag pa'i spyod pa rnam pa bcu ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spyod pa rnam pa bcu ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du /
translated: The ten correct practices are as stated in the Yogācārabhūmi:

original: gzhan yang theg pa chen po la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos spyod pa bcu po 'di dag ni sems can yongs su smin par byed par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang theg pa chen po la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos spyod pa bcu po 'di dag ni sems can yongs su smin par byed par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, these ten Dharma activities of bodhisattvas in the Mahāyāna bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa dag yi ger 'drir bcug pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin nyid du mchod pa dang / gzhan dag la sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa dag yi ger 'drir bcug pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin nyid du mchod pa dang / gzhan dag la sbyin pa dang /
translated: Having bodhisattvas write out, memorize, and make offerings to the Mahāyāna sūtras and so on that are included in the bodhisattva canon, and giving them to others,

original: ston pa na gus par byas te nyan pa dang / bdag nyid klog pa dang / de bzhin du kun chub par lung nod pa dang / lung phog pa rnams rgya cher dbyangs kyis kha don byed pa dang / gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston pa dang /
analyzed: ston pa na gus par byas te nyan pa dang / bdag nyid klog pa dang / de bzhin du kun chub par lung nod pa dang / lung phog pa rnams rgya cher dbyangs kyis kha don byed pa dang / gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston pa dang /
translated: One listens with respect to the teacher, and one reads it oneself, and likewise, one receives the oral transmission of the scriptures, and one recites the oral transmission aloud, and one teaches it extensively to others.

original: gcig pu dben par song ste /
analyzed: gcig pu dben par song ste /
translated: One goes alone to a solitary place, and

original: sems pa dang 'jal ba dang / nye bar rtog par byed pa dang / sgom pa'i rnam par rjes su 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa dang 'jal ba dang / nye bar rtog par byed pa dang / sgom pa'i rnam par rjes su 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: one reflects, and one investigates, and one examines, and one engages in the practice of meditation.

original: chos spyod pa bcu po de dag las du zhig bsod nams rgya chen po skye ba'i lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos spyod pa bcu po de dag las du zhig bsod nams rgya chen po skye ba'i lam yin zhe na /
translated: How many of these ten Dharma activities are paths for generating great merit?

original: smras pa / thams cad do //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad do //
translated: All of them.

original: du zhig sbyor ba'i lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: du zhig sbyor ba'i lam yin zhe na /
translated: How many are paths of preparation?

original: smras pa gcig ste /
analyzed: smras pa gcig ste /
translated: One.

original: dgu sogs du zhig sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: dgu sogs du zhig sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i lam yin zhe na /
translated: How many are paths of the purity of the elimination of obscurations?

original: smras pa gcig ste /
