analyzed: smras pa gcig ste /
translated: One.

original: bcu pa'o zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcu pa'o zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: The tenth.

original: chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ni sngar gong du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o /
analyzed: chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ni sngar gong du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o /
translated: These ten Dharma activities should be understood as they were previously explained above.

original: de la mos pa'i bzod pa shin du bsgoms pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: de la mos pa'i bzod pa shin du bsgoms pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: With regard to the statement “because of the cultivation of the patience of conviction,” the commentary to the Compendium of the Mahāyāna says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sngar mos pas spyod pa'i sa la chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu la brten nas smon lam dang / bzod pa bsgoms pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sngar mos pas spyod pa'i sa la chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu la brten nas smon lam dang / bzod pa bsgoms pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur la /
translated: Bodhisattvas, on the basis of the ten Dharma activities, cultivate the aspirational prayers and patience of the stage of engagement through aspiration.

original: smon lam dang bzod pa mngon par grub pas mos pas spyod pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das nas yang dag pa @249b nyid kyi gnas skabs la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon lam dang bzod pa mngon par grub pas mos pas spyod pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das nas yang dag pa @249b nyid kyi gnas skabs la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the actualization of the aspirational prayers and patience, they transcend the stage of engagement through aspiration and enter the stage of the direct realization of reality.

original: de la smon lam ni smon lam rgya chen po bcu'o //
analyzed: de la smon lam ni smon lam rgya chen po bcu'o //
translated: The aspirational prayers are the ten vast aspirational prayers.

original: bzod pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bzod pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Patience is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las /
translated: In the notes of the master Yangchen Gawai Lodrö, it says:

original: sa dang po la mi skye ba'i smon lam dang bzod pa dang / smon lam chen po bcu mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: sa dang po la mi skye ba'i smon lam dang bzod pa dang / smon lam chen po bcu mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
translated: On the first ground, the perfection of patience is superior because one attains the great patience for unborn dharmas and the great aspiration prayers.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: When applied to this explanation, the commentary to the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna says:

original: spyod pa mchog ces bya ba bstan pa 'di sa dang po'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: spyod pa mchog ces bya ba bstan pa 'di sa dang po'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: “The teaching called ‘supreme conduct’ is the nonconceptual wisdom of the first ground.”

original: 'dir mdo 'di'i dgongs pa brtags na dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi po dag la spyir bzod pa zhes ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'dir mdo 'di'i dgongs pa brtags na dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi po dag la spyir bzod pa zhes ston par mdzad do //
translated: When the intention of this sūtra is examined, it teaches that in general the four roots of virtue are patience.

original: yang na lhag pa'i bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog la mos pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang na lhag pa'i bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog la mos pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Alternatively, it teaches that they are the patience of superior intention and the patience of conviction in the supreme dharma of the worldly path.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: In the Sūtra Unraveling the Profound Intention,

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa'i chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu yod pas /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa'i chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu yod pas /
translated: it says that on the level of earnest aspiration, bodhisattvas have ten types of Dharma conduct.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i bzod pa shin tu sgom par byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i bzod pa shin tu sgom par byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The bodhisattva cultivates the patience of the liberation of the bodhisattvas.

original: sa de las yang dag par 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med par 'jug go //
analyzed: sa de las yang dag par 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med par 'jug go //
translated: Having passed beyond that stage, the bodhisattva enters into the faultless reality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gi yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gi yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa ston to //
translated: By that cause and that condition, the bodhisattva perfects that branch.

original: 'di ltar sa dang po dag snga ma'i sbyor ba'i sa'i chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis sbyor ba las yang dag par 'das nas sa dang po'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa dang po dag snga ma'i sbyor ba'i sa'i chos spyod pa rnam pa bcu la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis sbyor ba las yang dag par 'das nas sa dang po'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, by the power of the cause and condition of the ten kinds of Dharma practices of the previous stage of application, having passed beyond application, the bodhisattva enters into the faultless reality of the first stage.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des na yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des na yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By that cause and that condition, that branch is perfected.

original: de la yang dag pa nyid ces bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa nyid ces bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ste /
translated: Here, reality is the uncontaminated noble path.

original: log pa las bzlog pa'i phyir yang dag pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: log pa las bzlog pa'i phyir yang dag pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “reality” because it is the opposite of error.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas sems can la gnod pa ni zas ma tshos pa dang 'dra bas na skyon zhes bya'o //🔽zag pa med pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir yang dag pa @250a * //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas sems can la gnod pa ni zas ma tshos pa dang 'dra bas na skyon zhes bya'o // zag pa med pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir yang dag pa @250a * //
translated: The harm to sentient beings by the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of vision is like undigested food, and so it is called a “fault.

original: nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: ” The path of vision of the pure, noble path eliminates the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of vision, and so it is called “reality free of faults.🔽”

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni gong du rnal 'byor rnam par 'byed pa'i le'u las bshad pa'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni gong du rnal 'byor rnam par 'byed pa'i le'u las bshad pa'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive analysis should be understood as explained above in the chapter on the analysis of yoga.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa de las yang dag par 'das nas ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po rgyud la yod pa'i 'jug go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa de las yang dag par 'das nas ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po rgyud la yod pa'i 'jug go zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the Sutra Unraveling the Intention, it is said that one enters the first bhūmi after completely transcending the level of earnest aspiration.

original: tshig tha dad kyang don mi mthun pa med do //
analyzed: tshig tha dad kyang don mi mthun pa med do //
translated: There are different words, but there is no contradiction in meaning.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo la brten nas yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ba la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo la brten nas yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ba la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutras, there are two explanations of the term faultless reality.

original: kha cig na re dmigs su yod pa gang yin pa de ni skyon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re dmigs su yod pa gang yin pa de ni skyon zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say, Whatever is an object is called a fault.

original: dmigs su med pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom that is not an object is called 'faultless reality.'

original: de'i phyir mdo de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, in that very sutra,

original: bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa nyid skyon ma mchis pa la zhugs pa thob pa'i skyon ni gang lags //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa nyid skyon ma mchis pa la zhugs pa thob pa'i skyon ni gang lags //
translated: Lord, what is the fault of a bodhisattva who has entered the faultless?

original: skyon dang bral ba ni gang lags /
analyzed: skyon dang bral ba ni gang lags /
translated: What is free from fault?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said to Subhuti,🔽Subhuti, a bodhisattva who is skilled in means does not actualize the reality limit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ji tsam du dmigs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni skyon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ji tsam du dmigs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni skyon zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever is associated with objectification for bodhisattvas is all called a fault.

original: thams cad du dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni yon tan zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad du dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni yon tan zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Whatever is not objectified at all is called a virtue.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du zhe'o //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du zhe'o //
translated: This is taught in detail in that very text.

original: kha cig na re chos la sred pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni skyon zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re chos la sred pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni skyon zhes bya ste /
translated: Some say: Following craving for dharmas is called a fault.

original: dper na zas g-yos su ma byas pas nad slong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zas g-yos su ma byas pas nad slong ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like undigested food that causes illness.

original: stong pa nyid khong du chud pa'i shes pas skyon de nye bar zhi bar byed pas de'i phyir yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid khong du chud pa'i shes pas skyon de nye bar zhi bar byed pas de'i phyir yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The knowledge that comprehends emptiness pacifies that fault, and therefore it is called the faultless state of reality.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, in the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutras, it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa ni theg pa gnyis kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur bas byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa ni theg pa gnyis kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur bas byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The cultivation of the six perfections by a bodhisattva who is not skilled in means leads to falling into the levels of the two vehicles.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la smras pa /
translated: said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: chos gang ni skyon zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos gang ni skyon zhes bya zhe na /
translated: “What is called a fault?”

original: rab 'byor gyis @250b smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis @250b smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied:

original: de la skyon ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la skyon ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “The fault there is this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos la sred pa'i rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos la sred pa'i rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the bodhisattva’s following after craving for dharmas.

original: chos la sred pa de nyid ni skyon zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos la sred pa de nyid ni skyon zhes bya ste /
translated: That craving for dharmas itself is called a fault.

original: dper na zas ma tshos pas nad rnams slong ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na zas ma tshos pas nad rnams slong ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like indigestion that brings on disease.

original: de yongs su bsal ba'i phyir skyon med pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yongs su bsal ba'i phyir skyon med pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to eliminate that, it is called faultless.”

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: This is taught in detail in that very sūtra.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo bam po sum cu drug pa dang / bzhi brgya brgyad pa dang / le'u chen po'i mdo las bshad pa phyi ma dang mthun par ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo bam po sum cu drug pa dang / bzhi brgya brgyad pa dang / le'u chen po'i mdo las bshad pa phyi ma dang mthun par ston to //
translated: The explanation in the thirty-sixth chapter of the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutra in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas, the four hundred stanzas, and the Great Chapter Sutra is in accord with the latter.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is as taught in the commentary on the noble Perfection of Wisdom.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las kyang lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las bstan pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las kyang lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las bstan pa dang sbyar te /
translated: The commentary on the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle also explains this in terms of the teaching on changing the body.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When this sutra passage is explained,

original: de las sgrib pa gsum spangs nas yan lag bcu'i yon tan thob pa'i rgyu dang rkyen de'i stobs kyis sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de las sgrib pa gsum spangs nas yan lag bcu'i yon tan thob pa'i rgyu dang rkyen de'i stobs kyis sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
translated: it is said that by abandoning the three obscurations, through the power of the causes and conditions of attaining the qualities of the ten branches, the first ground will be fully perfected.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, in that very commentary,

original: sa rnams so so nas sgrib pa gsum spangs nas /
analyzed: sa rnams so so nas sgrib pa gsum spangs nas /
translated: it is said that on each ground, by abandoning the three obscurations,

original: so so nas yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so nas yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and each one attains the excellence of special qualities.

original: de las dang po pas spong bar byed pa'i sgrib pa gsum ni chos dang bdag tu rnam par rtog pa'i ma rig pa dang ngan song ba'i las kyi ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de las dang po pas spong bar byed pa'i sgrib pa gsum ni chos dang bdag tu rnam par rtog pa'i ma rig pa dang ngan song ba'i las kyi ma rig pa'o //
translated: The three obscurations that are abandoned by the beginner are the ignorance that is the conception of phenomena and a self and the ignorance that is the karma of the lower realms.

original: ma rig pa ni 'di gnyis kyi sbyor ba las mngon par grub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan lan rnam par smin pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni 'di gnyis kyi sbyor ba las mngon par grub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan lan rnam par smin pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The saṃsāra that is established from the application of these two ignorances is called “the maturation of the lower realms.”

original: sgrib pa gsum po dag spang pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum po dag spang pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
translated: One strives with effort in order to abandon the three obscurations.

original: sgrib pa gsum po spangs nas yan lag bcu gcig yongs su rdzogs pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum po spangs nas yan lag bcu gcig yongs su rdzogs pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Having abandoned the three obscurations, one attains the completion of the eleven branches.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: One enters the bodhisattva’s stage of correct samādhi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /
translated: One is born into the family of the tathāgatas.

original: cho rigs smad pa med pa yin /
analyzed: cho rigs smad pa med pa yin /
translated: One is not of a low family.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos spyod pa thams cad las bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos spyod pa thams cad las bzlog pa yin te /
translated: He is the opposite of all worldly conduct,

original: nges par srog gcod pa la sogs pa log par spyod pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par srog gcod pa la sogs pa log par spyod pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not engage in perverse conduct such as killing.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pa las yang dag par 'das pa yin te /🔽gzhan gyi sems shes pa thob pa la @251a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pa las yang dag par 'das pa yin te / gzhan gyi sems shes pa thob pa la @251a * //
translated: He is beyond all supramundane conduct,

original: zla med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has attained the knowledge of the minds of others.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi de bzhin nyid thob pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi de bzhin nyid thob pa yin te /
translated: He has attained the reality of the bodhisattva Dharma,

original: bdag dang gzhan la mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has attained the equality of self and others.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas la legs par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas la legs par gnas pa yin te /
translated: He is well established in the bodhisattva stage,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i de kho na nyid kyi chos thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i de kho na nyid kyi chos thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has attained the reality of the bodhisattva Dharma.

original: dus gsum las 'das shing mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: dus gsum las 'das shing mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa yin te /
translated: He is beyond the three times and has attained equality,

original: chos bdag med pa'i de bzhin nyid thams cad rtogs par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa'i de bzhin nyid thams cad rtogs par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has realized the suchness of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: nges par de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: nges par de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la gnas pa yin te /
translated: He is definitely established in the lineage of the Tathagata,🔽because he has attained the reality of the bodhisattva Dharma.

original: ma 'ongs pa na gdon mi za bar mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na gdon mi za bar mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the future, he will certainly attain supreme enlightenment.

original: sgo nga'i dngos po spangs pa dang 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: sgo nga'i dngos po spangs pa dang 'jig pa yin te /
translated: He abandons the state of the egg and is destroyed,

original: sangs rgyas lam gyi bstan pa ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs bcom nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lam gyi bstan pa ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs bcom nas /
translated: because the teaching of the Buddha’s path destroys the shell of ignorance

original: de las phyi rol du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las phyi rol du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and he passes beyond suffering, beyond its outer shell.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings kun du khyab pa'i don mthong bas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings kun du khyab pa'i don mthong bas /
translated: The bodhisattva, on the first stage, sees the meaning of the omnipresence of the Dharma realm

original: yan lag bcu po 'di dag 'thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yan lag bcu po 'di dag 'thob par 'gyur la /
translated: and obtains these ten aspects.

original: yan lag de 'thob pa'i phyir sa dang po yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yan lag de 'thob pa'i phyir sa dang po yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Because he obtains these aspects, the first stage is completed.

original: de las bcu gcig pas sgrib pa gsum spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni mdo las ma rig pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis zhes gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de las bcu gcig pas sgrib pa gsum spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni mdo las ma rig pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis zhes gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: The eleventh stage is the one on which he abandons the three obscurations, which are mentioned in the scriptures as the twenty-two ignorances.

original: gnas ngan len bcu gcig ni 'og nas rgya cher ston to //
analyzed: gnas ngan len bcu gcig ni 'og nas rgya cher ston to //
translated: The eleven bad tendencies will be explained in detail below.

original: ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun du 'byung ba dag shes bzhin du spyod par mi nus pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yan lag gnyis pas dri ma med pa bsdus par ston
analyzed: ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun du 'byung ba dag shes bzhin du spyod par mi nus pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yan lag gnyis pas dri ma med pa bsdus par ston
translated: This shows that the second branch is included in the stainless.

original: to // 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: to // 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two aspects:

original: snga ma la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par brtson pa bstan pa'o /
analyzed: snga ma la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par brtson pa bstan pa'o /
translated: the first is the teaching on striving to perfect the later practice in the earlier.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar yan lag dang po'i tshe ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul ba'i nyes pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i nyes pa yongs su bsal bar mi nus pas na rgyu dang rkyen des yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yan lag dang po'i tshe ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul ba'i nyes pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i nyes pa yongs su bsal bar mi nus pas na rgyu dang rkyen des yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, at the time of the first branch, one is unable to completely eliminate errors because one has the fault of error that is a subtle downfall. By that cause and condition, it is incomplete.

original: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
translated: In order to perfect that branch, one strives and meditates, and one attains it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By that cause and condition, that branch is perfected.

original: gnyis pa rang gi yan lag nan tan gyis @251b yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir brtson par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa rang gi yan lag nan tan gyis @251b yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir brtson par bstan pa'o //
translated: The second shows that one strives to perfect one's own branch through practice.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i nang nas gnas pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i nang nas gnas pa'i le'u las /
translated: In the Yogācārabhūmi, in the chapter on the stages of abiding, it says:

original: de ltar gnas pa bcu po dag bdag nyid bcu po de dag bdag nyid che ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa bcu po dag bdag nyid bcu po de dag bdag nyid che ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to perfect those ten greatnesses of those ten abodes,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnas pa nyid la 'jug cing gnon to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnas pa nyid la 'jug cing gnon to //
translated: the bodhisattva enters and masters the bodhisattva's discipline of superior morality.

original: gnas de la rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims dang ldan pas log pa'i lam du gtogs pa'i 'chal ba'i tshul khrims chung du yang kun du mi spyod na /
analyzed: gnas de la rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims dang ldan pas log pa'i lam du gtogs pa'i 'chal ba'i tshul khrims chung du yang kun du mi spyod na /
translated: In that abode, one who naturally possesses morality does not engage in even the slightest immorality belonging to the wrong path,

original: 'bring ngam chen po lta ci smos zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'bring ngam chen po lta ci smos zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: let alone the middling or great.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is taught extensively in that very text.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By that cause and condition, that branch is perfected.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: In the commentary to the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna, it says:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang mi ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims las 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun du spyod pa mi rtogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang mi ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims las 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun du spyod pa mi rtogs so //
translated: Because they do not possess the special ability on the first bodhisattva ground, bodhisattvas do not realize the subtle errors of faulty ethics.

original: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: They are unable to do so because of three obscurations:

original: ltung ba phra mo'i nyes pa'i ma rig pa dang / las kyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba phra mo'i nyes pa'i ma rig pa dang / las kyi rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i ma rig pa'o //
translated: ignorance of the faults of subtle downfalls and ignorance of the various aspects of karma.

original: ma rig pa 'di nyid kyi sbyor ba las mngon par grub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di nyid kyi sbyor ba las mngon par grub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The saṃsāra that is accomplished through the application of this ignorance is called “the fully ripened negative tendencies.”

original: sgrib pa gsum po dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par brtson par byed do /
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum po dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par brtson par byed do /
translated: They also make effort to eliminate the three obscurations.

original: sgrib pa gsum po dag spangs nas sa gnyis pa la 'jug cing yon tan rnam par dag pa brgyad 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum po dag spangs nas sa gnyis pa la 'jug cing yon tan rnam par dag pa brgyad 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Having eliminated the three obscurations, they enter the second ground and obtain eight pure qualities.

original: bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / byams pa dang snying rje rnam par dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa mthong ba rnam par dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed par rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / byams pa dang snying rje rnam par dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa mthong ba rnam par dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed par rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: Pure intention, pure love and compassion, pure transcendent perfections, pure vision of the buddhas' deeds, pure maturation of sentient beings,

original: mthu dang yon tan rnam par dag pa'o /
analyzed: mthu dang yon tan rnam par dag pa'o /
translated: pure powers and pure qualities.

original: sa gong ma gong ma nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar dag ni yon tan brgyad po 'di dag ches mchog dang / khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sa gong ma gong ma nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar dag ni yon tan brgyad po 'di dag ches mchog dang / khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
translated: From the second ground up to the buddha level, these eight qualities should be understood as being ever more sublime and superior.

original: yan lag des nas gnyis pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yan lag des nas gnyis pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This completes the second ground of the ultimate awakening mind.

original: rnam par dag pa brgyad ni 'og nas phyis ston to /🔽// bam po lnga @252a * //🔽bcu gsum pa /🔽'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa thob par mi nus pas /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa brgyad ni 'og nas phyis ston to / // bam po lnga @252a * // bcu gsum pa / 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa thob par mi nus pas /

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa ston to //🔽'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽sa gsum pa phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gi yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa thob par mi nus pas so //🔽de lta ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni bying rgod dang bral ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //🔽gzhan yang rtse gcig pa nyid du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa ston to //🔽'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽sa gsum pa phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gi yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa thob par mi nus pas so //🔽de lta ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni bying rgod dang bral ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //🔽gzhan yang rtse gcig pa nyid du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The eight purities will be explained later.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba la ni bying rgod dang bral ba'i mthar thug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba la ni bying rgod dang bral ba'i mthar thug pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term attainment is used because it is the final stage free from laxity and excitement.

original: 'di ltar rab tu zhi zhing dpen pa'i mtha'i gnas yin pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rab tu zhi zhing dpen pa'i mtha'i gnas yin pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called attainment because it is the final stage of complete peace and seclusion.

original: rnam pa gnyis po 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis po 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These two types are called mundane because they are contaminated and because they are engaged in.

original: ting nge 'dzin de dag gi ming yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na ming yang rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag gi ming yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na ming yang rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: If we compare the names of these concentrations with the Yogācārabhūmi Sāstra and its commentary, there are three names.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: mnyam par gzhag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa ste /🔽de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa ste / de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: equipoise, concentration, and meditative attainment.🔽Therefore, the commentary states:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The stage of equipoise is as follows.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mchog bying rgod dang bral bas mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mchog bying rgod dang bral bas mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'am /
translated: It is the supreme concentration that is equipoise free from laxity and excitement.

original: mnyam pa nyid du 'dres pa'am /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du 'dres pa'am /
translated: They are mixed in the state of equality.🔽🔽

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis bskyed pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis bskyed pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the stage of meditative concentration because it is mixed with equality or because it is generated by equality.

original: kha cig na re ming 'di ni sems dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsdus pa yin te /🔽thams cad kyang mnyam pa nyid du gyur cing /
analyzed: kha cig na re ming 'di ni sems dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsdus pa yin te / thams cad kyang mnyam pa nyid du gyur cing /
translated: Some say: This name includes all concentrations that are accompanied by mental activity.

original: yon tan rnams 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnams 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of them are included because they are transformed into equality and because their qualities are mixed.

original: sems med pa dag ni mi bsdu ste /
analyzed: sems med pa dag ni mi bsdu ste /
translated: But those that are not accompanied by mental activity are not included,

original: 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa snga ma las ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa snga ma las ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pas so //
translated: because it is taught that the former verse refers to concentration that is accompanied by mental activity.

original: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni yul so sor nges pa las sems las byung ba'i chos kyi grangs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / sems med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis yon tan rnams 'dren par mi nus pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag @252b pa'i sa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni yul so sor nges pa las sems las byung ba'i chos kyi grangs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / sems med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis yon tan rnams 'dren par mi nus pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag @252b pa'i sa yin no //
translated: It is the stage of meditative concentration because it is the enumeration of a mental factor that is a concentration that is restricted to a specific object, because it is not possible to draw forth the qualities by a concentration that is not accompanied by mental activity.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If that is so, why is it called the stage of meditative concentration?

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi yod pas /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi yod pas /
translated: The stage of meditative concentration is, in brief, of four kinds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: meditative concentration, liberation, meditative absorption, and meditative attainment.

original: de la bsam gtan bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the four meditative concentrations are

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dag go //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dag go //
translated: the four meditative concentrations.

original: rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Liberation is

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad po dag go //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad po dag go //
translated: the eight liberations.

original: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: Meditative absorption is🔽the meditative absorption of emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: the meditative absorption of signlessness, and the meditative absorption of wishlessness.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni mthong ba lnga'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni mthong ba lnga'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Meditative attainment is the meditative attainment of the five eyes.

original: de la mthong ba lnga'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni nang gi lus kyi mi sdug pa la so sor rtog pa dang / keng rus la rnam par shes pa der rgyu bar byed do zhes so sor rtog pa dang / keng rus la rnam par shes pa deng 'dra ba dang /
analyzed: de la mthong ba lnga'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni nang gi lus kyi mi sdug pa la so sor rtog pa dang / keng rus la rnam par shes pa der rgyu bar byed do zhes so sor rtog pa dang / keng rus la rnam par shes pa deng 'dra ba dang /
translated: the discernment that consciousness is like a skeleton,🔽the discernment that consciousness abides in the future,

original: ma 'ongs pa na gnas so zhes so sor rtog pa dang / keng rus la rnam par shes pa der rgyu par byed kyang da ltar gyi la mi gnas kyi ma 'ongs pa la gnas pa kho na'o zhes bya ba so sor rtog pa dang /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na gnas so zhes so sor rtog pa dang / keng rus la rnam par shes pa der rgyu par byed kyang da ltar gyi la mi gnas kyi ma 'ongs pa la gnas pa kho na'o zhes bya ba so sor rtog pa dang /
translated: the discernment that consciousness moves to a skeleton but does not abide in the present but abides in the future alone,

original: keng rus la rnam par shes pa der rgyu bar byed kyang da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa la mi gnas pa'o zhes so sor rtog pa ste /
analyzed: keng rus la rnam par shes pa der rgyu bar byed kyang da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa la mi gnas pa'o zhes so sor rtog pa ste /
translated: and the discernment that consciousness moves to a skeleton but does not abide in the present or future.

original: rgya cher ni bstan bcos bye brag du bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher ni bstan bcos bye brag du bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is extensively taught in the Great Exegesis.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang /
translated: The Levels of Yogic Deeds says:

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o zhes 'byung bas 'di la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o zhes 'byung bas 'di la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no error, because it is said that the meditative attainment of the eight bases of subjugation, the meditative attainment of the ten bases of totality, the meditative attainment of the formless realm, the meditative attainment of nondiscernment and the meditative attainment of cessation exist.

original: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i skyon yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i skyon yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The meditative attainment of mindless states is not a fault of equipoise.

original: de yang dag par mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de yang dag par mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: It is not actual equipoise.

original: kha cig na re ming 'di ni sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dang / sems med pa'i gnas skabs la yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: kha cig na re ming 'di ni sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dang / sems med pa'i gnas skabs la yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: Some say: This name exists for concentration that exists in the context of mind and in the context of mindless states.

original: sems dang bcas pa'i mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa'i mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is equipoise that is concomitant with mind is equipoise that is concomitant with mind.

original: @253a * // yon tan rnams 'dren pa'i phyir dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi dbang po 'dren par yang phal cher mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / bying rgod dang bral ba'i phyir dang / 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi sbyor ba yang rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @253a * // yon tan rnams 'dren pa'i phyir dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi dbang po 'dren par yang phal cher mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / bying rgod dang bral ba'i phyir dang / 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi sbyor ba yang rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it draws forth the qualities, because it draws forth the faculty of equanimity for the most part, because it is free from laxity and excitement, and because it also draws forth the application of equanimity that is free from regret and so on, it is called meditative equipoise.

original: sems med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa 'dren par mi nus mod kyi /🔽mnyam pa nyid kyi dbang po 'dren par phal cher mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa 'dren par mi nus mod kyi / mnyam pa nyid kyi dbang po 'dren par phal cher mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Although the concentration that is without thought cannot draw forth the qualities that are superior,

original: de la yang mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called meditative equipoise because it is similar for the most part in drawing forth the faculty of equanimity and because it is generated by the concentration of equanimity.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa snga ma las ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig ces bshad kyang nyes pa med ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa snga ma las ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig ces bshad kyang nyes pa med ce na /
translated: If this is so, why is it said in the previous verse that it is together with concentration?

original: tshigs su bcad pa las ldan pa zhes bya ba mi mngon par byas pas de dang lhan cig ces bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las ldan pa zhes bya ba mi mngon par byas pas de dang lhan cig ces bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: The word “endowed” in the verse is not explicit, so the word “together” is supplied.

original: yang dag par na mnyam par gzhag pa ni lhan cig bar yang ma yin la /
analyzed: yang dag par na mnyam par gzhag pa ni lhan cig bar yang ma yin la /
translated: In reality, the state of composure is not “together” with the mind.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems med gtogs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang dag pa'i don du na mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i ming ni kun du bsdus par gtogs pa yang yod /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems med gtogs par bstan pa'i phyir ro // yang dag pa'i don du na mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i ming ni kun du bsdus par gtogs pa yang yod /
translated: This is because the state of composure is taught as being “not associated” with the mind.

original: spangs pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: spangs pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the state of composure without conception is also called “associated with complete absorption” and “not abandoned.”

original: sems yod pa dang med pa'i gnas skabs gnyi ga bsdus pa'i phyir ni kun bsdu bar gtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems yod pa dang med pa'i gnas skabs gnyi ga bsdus pa'i phyir ni kun bsdu bar gtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “associated with complete absorption” because it includes both the state in which the mind exists and the state in which the mind does not exist.🔽Moreover, the state of composure without conception and the state of composure that is a cessation are also taught as being of the nature of the state of composure.

original: gzhan yang 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i bdag nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i dang / zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin khyad par du 'phags pa la bya'i /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i bdag nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i dang / zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin khyad par du 'phags pa la bya'i /
translated: Therefore, the term “distinctive” should be understood as referring to the distinction between the states of composure that are associated with impurity and those that are associated with purity.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems thams cad la bya ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir spangs pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //🔽ci'i phyir bsam gtan la sogs pa la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems thams cad la bya ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir spangs pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhe'o // ci'i phyir bsam gtan la sogs pa la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not abandoned because it is not the object of abandonment for all minds that are distracted by the desire realm and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the mind of the desire realm not equipoise?

original: ting nge 'dzin de ni 'gyod pa med pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde bas bsgrubs pa yin la 'dod pa na spyod pa na de lta ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /🔽'di dang sbyar na khams gong ma'i @253b sems rnam par g-yeng ba yang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de ni 'gyod pa med pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde bas bsgrubs pa yin la 'dod pa na spyod pa na de lta ma yin no zhes 'byung ste / 'di dang sbyar na khams gong ma'i @253b sems rnam par g-yeng ba yang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin te /
translated: It is said that concentration is accomplished by non regret, supreme joy, joy, pliancy and pleasure, but that is not so in the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If this is applied to the higher realms, then even the distracted minds of the higher realms are not equipoise because they are similar to the desire realm.

original: de nas phan tshun ltos pa'i mu bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas phan tshun ltos pa'i mu bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Then there are four possibilities of mutual dependence.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig pa yin la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig pa yin la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a factor that is associated with concentration but is not a thought of meditative equipoise.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is it?

original: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems kyi gnas skabs su ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems kyi gnas skabs su ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: It is a thought that is associated with concentration in a state of distraction in the realm of desire, etc., and any thought concomitant with that thought.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa yin la ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa yin la ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a factor that is a level of meditative equipoise but is not associated with concentration.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is it?

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs su ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs la yod pa'i chos rnams gang yin pa'o //🔽ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig pa yang yin la /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs su ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs la yod pa'i chos rnams gang yin pa'o // ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig pa yang yin la /
translated: It is the nature of concentration in a state of meditative equipoise, and any factor that exists in a state of meditative equipoise of non-perception.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a factor that is associated with concentration and is a level of meditative equipoise.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is it?🔽It is a thought of meditative equipoise in the realm of desire, etc., and any thought concomitant with that thought.

original: bsam gtan rnams dang gzugs med pa'i sems yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs kyi sems dang / sems las byung ba la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang gzugs med pa'i sems yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs kyi sems dang / sems las byung ba la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The mind that exists in the states of concentration and formless absorption, and the mind and mental factors that exist in the states of concentration other than those.🔽The answer is:

original: ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: There is no concentration.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a fourth possibility that is neither.

original: gong du bstan pa'i gnas skabs la ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams gang yin ba'o //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i gnas skabs la ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams gang yin ba'o //
translated: This refers to phenomena other than those mentioned above.

original: gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa la yang don ci yod ce na /🔽de la ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos kyi nang na ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba chos gcig gi ming yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa la yang don ci yod ce na / de la ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos kyi nang na ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba chos gcig gi ming yin te /
translated: What is the meaning of concentration, meditative attainment, and equipoise?🔽Concentration is the name of a single phenomenon among the mental factors.

original: sems yod pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid thams cad bsdus shing /
analyzed: sems yod pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid thams cad bsdus shing /
translated: It is the one-pointedness of mind that exists in the states of concentration.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par g-yo ba'i gnas skabs su yang gtogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par g-yo ba'i gnas skabs su yang gtogs pa yin yang /
translated: It is included in all states of concentration, and it also exists in the states of distraction.

original: mdo sde dang bstan bcos dag las ni gtso bo'i dbang du mdzad nas stong pa dang / smod pa med pa la sogs pa la ting nge 'dzin zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mdo sde dang bstan bcos dag las ni gtso bo'i dbang du mdzad nas stong pa dang / smod pa med pa la sogs pa la ting nge 'dzin zhes bstan to //
translated: The sūtras and treatises teach that samādhi is emptiness, non-condemnation, and so on, from the perspective of the primary [factors].

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ming ni sems yod pa dang / sems med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi gnas skabs thams cad la yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag tu gtogs pa yin yang mdo sde dang bstan bcos dag las ni gtso bo'i @254a * //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ming ni sems yod pa dang / sems med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi gnas skabs thams cad la yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag tu gtogs pa yin yang mdo sde dang bstan bcos dag las ni gtso bo'i @254a * //
translated: The name “absorption” is a quality that belongs to samādhi in all contexts, whether the mind is present or absent.

original: dbang du mdzad nas mthong ba lnga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dbang du mdzad nas mthong ba lnga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bstan to //
translated: The sūtras and treatises teach that “absorption” is possessed by samādhis such as the five visions, from the perspective of the primary [factors].

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa zhes bya ba'i ming ni sems yod pa dang / med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs kyi yon tan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa zhes bya ba'i ming ni sems yod pa dang / med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs kyi yon tan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The name “ground of meditative equipoise” is a quality of the context of samādhi, whether the mind is present or absent.

original: sa 'dis ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs thams cad yon tan thams cad bsdus te spyi yin pa'i phyir gcig bus sa'i ming thob pa yin no //
analyzed: sa 'dis ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs thams cad yon tan thams cad bsdus te spyi yin pa'i phyir gcig bus sa'i ming thob pa yin no //
translated: This stage is named after the single quality that is common to all the states of meditative concentration, namely, retention.

original: mdo 'di nyid las ni mdor bsdus nas ming gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las ni mdor bsdus nas ming gnyis bstan te /
translated: In this very sūtra, the two names are taught in brief:

original: mnyam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / sems yod pa dang / sems med pa rnams sdud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / sems yod pa dang / sems med pa rnams sdud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it includes the states of meditative equipoise and distraction, and the states of mind and no mind.

original: de la gzungs zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang / shes rab kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de la gzungs zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang / shes rab kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Here, retention is the nature of mindfulness and wisdom.

original: gzungs de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzungs de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: That retention is, in brief, of four kinds.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du /
translated: As the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzungs dam pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzungs dam pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the excellent retention of bodhisattvas?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be seen as being of four kinds:

original: chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / gsang sngags kyi gzungs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob par byed pa'i gzungs so //
analyzed: chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / gsang sngags kyi gzungs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob par byed pa'i gzungs so //
translated: the dhāraṇī of the Dharma, the dhāraṇī of meaning, the dhāraṇī of spells, and the dhāraṇī that causes the attainment of the bodhisattva’s acceptance.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi gzungs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi gzungs gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ dhāraṇī of the Dharma?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni gang gis thos pa tsam kho nas goms shing kha don bya bar ma byas pa'i ming dang / tshig dang yi ger gtogs pa'i rim bzhin du bsdebs shing rim bzhin du sbyar ba'i yi ge tshad med pa dpag tu tshad med par 'dzin par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dran pa dang /🔽shes rab kyi bskyed pa thob par 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni gang gis thos pa tsam kho nas goms shing kha don bya bar ma byas pa'i ming dang / tshig dang yi ger gtogs pa'i rim bzhin du bsdebs shing rim bzhin du sbyar ba'i yi ge tshad med pa dpag tu tshad med par 'dzin par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dran pa dang / shes rab kyi bskyed pa thob par 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: The bodhisattvas obtain the power of memory and wisdom that enables them to retain the limitless and incalculable letters that are arranged in order and connected in order, which are included in the names, phrases, and letters that they have heard just once, without having to practice them orally.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi gzungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi gzungs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ dhāraṇī of the Dharma.

original: de la don gyi gzungs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la don gyi gzungs gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ dhāraṇī of meaning?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: snga ma dang dran pa las de'i khyad par ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: snga ma dang dran pa las de'i khyad par ni 'di yin no //
translated: The difference between this and the previous one is as follows.

original: chos de bdag nyid kyi don tshad med pa dag ma goms shing yid kyi bya bar ma byas pas dus tshad med pa dag tu 'dzin cing brjed par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: chos de bdag nyid kyi don tshad med pa dag ma goms shing yid kyi bya bar ma byas pas dus tshad med pa dag tu 'dzin cing brjed par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: It is the retention of the meaning of the Dharma for immeasurable periods of time without forgetting it, without mental activity, and without cultivating it.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i don gyi gzungs zhes bya'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i don gyi gzungs zhes bya'o /
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ retention of meaning.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i gsang sngags kyi gzungs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i gsang sngags kyi gzungs gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ retention of mantras?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gang gi gsang sngags kyi gzhi gang dag @254b sems can rnams yams kyi nad yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i phyir byin gyis rlob par byed /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gang gi gsang sngags kyi gzhi gang dag @254b sems can rnams yams kyi nad yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i phyir byin gyis rlob par byed /
translated: Here the bodhisattvas bless the mantra syllables that pacify the various epidemics of sentient beings.

original: yams kyi nang rnam pa du ma yang dag par zhi bar bya ba la de dag grub cing mchog tu grub la /
analyzed: yams kyi nang rnam pa du ma yang dag par zhi bar bya ba la de dag grub cing mchog tu grub la /
translated: They are successful in pacifying the many kinds of epidemics, and they attain the highest success.

original: don yod pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don yod pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: They attain the power of samādhi that is meaningful and not meaningless.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gsang sngags kyi gzungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gsang sngags kyi gzungs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ retention of mantras.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob par byed pa'i gzungs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob par byed pa'i gzungs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the dhāraṇī that causes bodhisattvas to attain the patience of a bodhisattva?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyi rgyu la shin tu spyad pa shes rab dang ldan pa dben pa la gnas shing tshig kyang mi smra la /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyi rgyu la shin tu spyad pa shes rab dang ldan pa dben pa la gnas shing tshig kyang mi smra la /
translated: Here, a bodhisattva who has thoroughly practiced the causes for himself, who is endowed with wisdom, who dwells in solitude, who does not speak,

original: su dang yang mi phud cing de bzhin du ran par za ba dang / bab col du mi za ba dang / kha zas sna gcig za ba dang / sems lhur byed pa dang / mtshan mo yun thung du nyal zhing yun ring du mi nyal ba ni /
analyzed: su dang yang mi phud cing de bzhin du ran par za ba dang / bab col du mi za ba dang / kha zas sna gcig za ba dang / sems lhur byed pa dang / mtshan mo yun thung du nyal zhing yun ring du mi nyal ba ni /
translated: who does not reject anyone, who eats in moderation in that way, who does not eat thoughtlessly, who eats only one kind of food, who is intent on the mind, who sleeps little at night and does not sleep for a long time,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob par byed pa'i gsang sngags bzhi gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa de dag sems shing 'jal ba nye bar rtog ste zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob par byed pa'i gsang sngags bzhi gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa de dag sems shing 'jal ba nye bar rtog ste zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: reflects on, considers, and examines those four secret mantras that cause the attainment of the patience of a bodhisattva that were taught by the Tathāgata.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is as taught in detail in that very text.

original: zhib tu mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in detail according to the explanations of the characteristics.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The concentrations and meditative attainments are the cause of the wisdom of meditation.

original: gzungs ni thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gzungs ni thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu yin te /
translated: The powers of retention are the cause of the wisdoms of listening and reflection.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i shes rab rnam pa gsum bskyed pa'i rgyu thob pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i shes rab rnam pa gsum bskyed pa'i rgyu thob pas /
translated: Because the bodhisattva obtains the cause of generating the three kinds of wisdom, such as the concentrations and meditative attainments,

original: rgyu dang rkyen des lhag pa'i sems kyi yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par gyur par ston to zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des lhag pa'i sems kyi yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par gyur par ston to zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: through that cause and condition, it is taught that the factor of superior mind is perfected.

original: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
translated: By striving in meditation in order to perfect that factor, he obtains it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gi yan lag 'bad de bsgoms pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gi yan lag 'bad de bsgoms pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ston to //
translated: The bodhisattvas, by that cause and condition, complete that member. This shows the second, that one's own member is completed by cultivating it with effort.

original: 'di ltar sa gsum pas ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzungs thob pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //🔽bstan bcos @255a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa gsum pas ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzungs thob pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o // bstan bcos @255a * //
translated: Thus, by the power of the cause and condition of attaining meditative stabilization, meditative equipoise, and retention on the third ground, that member is completed.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: In the commentary to the Compendium of the Mahāyāna,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa gnyis pa la nus pa khyad par can dang mi ldan pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa gnyis pa la nus pa khyad par can dang mi ldan pas /
translated: it says that because the bodhisattvas on the second ground do not have special ability,

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / thos pa'i gzungs dran pa'i stobs dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / thos pa'i gzungs dran pa'i stobs dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they do not attain the four meditative concentrations, the four formless meditative equipoises, and the retention of hearing that has the power of memory.

original: de ltar 'thob par mi 'gyur pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar 'thob par mi 'gyur pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: Not attaining those is due to three obscurations.

original: 'dod pa la sred pa'i ma rig pa dang / thos pa dang gzungs dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sred pa'i ma rig pa dang / thos pa dang gzungs dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa'o //
translated: the ignorance of craving for sense objects, and the ignorance of possessing learning and retention.

original: ma rig pa 'di nyid kyi sbyor ba las mngon par 'grub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di nyid kyi sbyor ba las mngon par 'grub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cyclic existence that is accomplished through the practice of this very ignorance is called the “maturation of negative conditioning.”

original: sgrib pa gsum bo de dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum bo de dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed do //
translated: In order to abandon these three obscurations, one accomplishes the cause of correct effort.

original: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po dag spangs nas sa gsum po la 'jug cing rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la sogs pa yang 'thob la /
analyzed: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po dag spangs nas sa gsum po la 'jug cing rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la sogs pa yang 'thob la /
translated: Having abandoned the three obscurations through correct effort, one enters the third ground and attains the eight special purities and the four meditative concentrations, and so forth.

original: chos kyi dbyings rgyu mthun pa'i don du yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rgyu mthun pa'i don du yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: One also realizes the dharmadhātu as the meaning of natural outflow.

original: yan lag des sa gsum pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yan lag des sa gsum pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Through this branch, the third ground is perfected.”

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos ji ltar thob pa dag la lan mang du bsgoms shing gnas par bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa las sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog mi nus pas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos ji ltar thob pa dag la lan mang du bsgoms shing gnas par bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa las sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog mi nus pas /
translated: and one is unable to rest in equanimity with regard to the mind that is craving for meditative concentration and craving for the Dharma.🔽By these causes and conditions, that branch is incomplete.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi pa yan lag bzhi pas sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can sdud pa ston to //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi pa yan lag bzhi pas sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can sdud pa ston to //
translated: This shows the fourth branch of the fourth ground, the Luminous, which is the cause for attaining the fifth ground.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: sa gsum pa la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gis 'bad de bsgoms pas yongs su ma rdzogs par 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa gsum pa la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gis 'bad de bsgoms pas yongs su ma rdzogs par 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
translated: showing that the latter practice is incomplete on the third ground, and showing that it is incomplete due to one’s own efforts in meditation.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de rkyen rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir sa bzhi pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de rkyen rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir sa bzhi pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, because of these two conditions, the bodhisattva will not complete the factors of enlightenment on the fourth ground.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos ji ltar thos pa dag la lan mang du mi gnas pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa las lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog mi @255b nus pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos ji ltar thos pa dag la lan mang du mi gnas pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa las lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog mi @255b nus pa ste /
translated: One is unable to remain frequently in the way one has heard the factors of enlightenment, and one is unable to rest in equanimity with a predominance of craving for meditative absorption and craving for the Dharma.

original: rkyen rnam pa de gnyis kyis yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnam pa de gnyis kyis yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By these two conditions, that factor is not perfected.

original: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob pa'o //
translated: In order to perfect that factor, one strives and cultivates it, and one attains it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gis 'bad de bsgoms pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gis 'bad de bsgoms pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ston to //
translated: By that cause and condition, those bodhisattvas perfect that factor. This shows the second perfection by one's own effort in cultivation.

original: 'di yang sa bzhi ba dag gis byang chub kyi phyogs thob pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / chos la sred pa rnam pa gnyis spangs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang sa bzhi ba dag gis byang chub kyi phyogs thob pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / chos la sred pa rnam pa gnyis spangs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is also the complete perfection of that branch by the power of the cause and condition of the Bodhisattvas of the fourth stage having attained the factors of enlightenment, and having abandoned the two kinds of craving for meditative absorption and for the Dharma.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: In the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle, it says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa gsum pa la nus pa khyad par can dang mi ldan pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa gsum pa la nus pa khyad par can dang mi ldan pas /
translated: Because the Bodhisattvas of the third stage do not have a special ability,

original: ji ltar bdag gis thob pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs la yid bzhin du gnas pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa spangs nas sems yongs su dag par gnas par mi nus so //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis thob pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs la yid bzhin du gnas pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa spangs nas sems yongs su dag par gnas par mi nus so //
translated: they are unable to abide at will in the factors of enlightenment that they have attained, and they are unable to abide with a completely pure mind, having abandoned craving for meditative absorption and craving for the Dharma.

original: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: The reason they are unable to do so is because of three obscurations:

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i ma rig pa dang / chos la sred pa'i ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i ma rig pa dang / chos la sred pa'i ma rig pa'o //
translated: the ignorance of craving for meditative absorption and craving for the Dharma.

original: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyi sbyor ba las mngon par 'grub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyi sbyor ba las mngon par 'grub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That cyclic existence which is produced by the combination of these two kinds of ignorance is called “the maturation of negative reflex actions.”
