original: sgrib pa de dag spang pa'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sgrib pa de dag spang pa'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed do //
translated: In order to eliminate those obscurations, one accomplishes the cause of correct effort.

original: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po spangs nas sa bzhi pa la 'jug cing rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos la yun ring du gnas pa la sogs pa yang 'thob la /
analyzed: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po spangs nas sa bzhi pa la 'jug cing rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos la yun ring du gnas pa la sogs pa yang 'thob la /
translated: Having eliminated the three obscurations by means of correct effort, one enters the fourth stage and attains the eight special kinds of purity, and also attains the long-term maintenance of the factors of enlightenment, and so forth.

original: chos kyi dbyings gzung ba med pa'i don du yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings gzung ba med pa'i don du yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: And one realizes the meaning of the non-apprehension of the Dharma-element.

original: yan lag des sa bzhi pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yan lag des sa bzhi pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: By that factor, the fourth stage is also completed.”

original: bden pa rnams kyi rigs pa la rnam par dpyad par mi nus pa dang / gzhan yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu mi phyogs pa dang / mngon du phyogs pa nyid yin la byed ba la lhag par btang snyoms su bzhag par mi nus pa dang /🔽@256a * // gzhan yang thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgom par mi nus pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lnga pa yan lag lnga pas sa shin tu sbyang dka' ba
analyzed: bden pa rnams kyi rigs pa la rnam par dpyad par mi nus pa dang / gzhan yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu mi phyogs pa dang / mngon du phyogs pa nyid yin la byed ba la lhag par btang snyoms su bzhag par mi nus pa dang / @256a * // gzhan yang thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgom par mi nus pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lnga pa yan lag lnga pas sa shin tu sbyang dka' ba
translated: One is unable to analyze the reasonings of the truths, one is unable to be impartial toward samsara and nirvana, one is unable to be impartial toward what is to be done,🔽and one is unable to cultivate the factors of enlightenment that are embraced by method.🔽By these causes and conditions, the branches are incomplete.

original: bsdus par ston to //
analyzed: bsdus par ston to //
translated: This teaches the fifth ground, Hard to Overcome, by means of five branches.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also twofold:

original: sa bzhi pa la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gi sa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bsgrub par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gi sa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bsgrub par bstan pa ste /
translated: teaching that the latter conduct is incomplete on the fourth ground and teaching that it is accomplished in order to complete one's own ground.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar sa bzhi bas byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thob par gyur kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bzhi bas byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thob par gyur kyang /
translated: Thus, although the bodhisattva has attained the factors conducive to enlightenment on the four stages,

original: rkyen rnam pa gsum gyi phyir sa lnga pa 'thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkyen rnam pa gsum gyi phyir sa lnga pa 'thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: he does not attain the fifth stage for three reasons.

original: sa dang po ni byang chub kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun thob par gyur kyang bden pa rnams kyi rigs pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dpyad par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang po ni byang chub kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun thob par gyur kyang bden pa rnams kyi rigs pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dpyad par mi nus pa'o //
translated: On the first stage, although he has attained the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, he is not able to analyze the principles of the truths in accordance with reality.

original: de la bden pa rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la bden pa rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the so-called truths

original: 'phags pas bcu pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pas bcu pa'i mdo las /
translated: are as taught in the noble Dashabhumika-sutra:

original: 'phags pa bden pa rnam pa bzhi dang / bden pa rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad du bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa bden pa rnam pa bzhi dang / bden pa rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad du bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: “The four kinds of noble truths, the two kinds of truths, and so on.”

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: They are explained in detail in that very sutra.

original: gnyis pa ni 'khor ba la gcig tu rgyab kyis phyogs shing /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'khor ba la gcig tu rgyab kyis phyogs shing /
translated: The second is that he is completely averse to cyclic existence,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa nyid kyi yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis lhag par btang snyoms su gzhag par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa nyid kyi yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis lhag par btang snyoms su gzhag par mi nus pa ste /
translated: The second is the inability to rest in equanimity with regard to the two types of attention that are directed toward nirvana.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /
translated: As it is said in the treatise, the Establishment of Perception Only:

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa bye brag med pa'i lam ma thob pa'i phyir ro zhes pa bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa bye brag med pa'i lam ma thob pa'i phyir ro zhes pa bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because one has not attained the path that is without distinction between samsara and nirvana.

original: gsum pa ni thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgom par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgom par mi nus pa'o //
translated: The third is the inability to cultivate the factors that contribute to enlightenment in a manner that is embraced by skillful means.

original: sa bzhi pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs thob zin pa yin na /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs thob zin pa yin na /
translated: If the bodhisattva has already attained the factors that contribute to enlightenment on the fourth stage,

original: ci'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom par mi nus she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom par mi nus she na /
translated: why is it said that he or she is unable to cultivate the factors that contribute to enlightenment?

original: smras pa / byang chub kyi chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / byang chub kyi chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is said that there are two types of factors that contribute to enlightenment:

original: dang po ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag ste /
analyzed: dang po ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag ste /
translated: The first is the thirty-seven factors that contribute to enlightenment,

original: sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: as they have been explained previously.

original: gnyis pa ni thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The second is the three aspects of the factors of enlightenment that are embraced by method.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las /
translated: As the noble Sūtra on the Ten Stages says,

original: sa lnga pa'i gnas nas ji skad du /
analyzed: sa lnga pa'i gnas nas ji skad du /
translated: in the section on the fifth stage:

original: bsod nams nye bar rtsom pas ngoms mi shes pa yin /
analyzed: bsod nams nye bar rtsom pas ngoms mi shes pa yin /
translated: “They are not satisfied with the accumulation of merit.

original: ye @256b shes kyi yongs su tshol bas brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa yin /
analyzed: ye @256b shes kyi yongs su tshol bas brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa yin /
translated: They are not interrupted in their effort to seek out wisdom.

original: byams pa dang snying rje chen po'i tshogs yang dag par skyo ba med pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje chen po'i tshogs yang dag par skyo ba med pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: They have the intention never to be discouraged in the accumulation of great love and compassion.”

original: de'i phyir snga phyir bshad pa la phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga phyir bshad pa la phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction between the earlier and later explanations.

original: rkyen rnam pa gsum po des na /
analyzed: rkyen rnam pa gsum po des na /
translated: Because of these three conditions,

original: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: that branch is not completed.

original: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
translated: In order to complete that branch, they strive and meditate, and they attain it.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gis yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed par ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gis yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed par ston to //
translated: This shows that the second is established in order to complete it by oneself.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga po de gong du bstan pa'i skye ba rnam pa gsum gyi stobs kyis yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga po de gong du bstan pa'i skye ba rnam pa gsum gyi stobs kyis yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas complete that element by the power of the three kinds of birth taught above on the five stages.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa las ni nus pa khyad par can bden pa bzhi bsgom par mi nus pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par lta zhing rgyab kyis phyogs shing mngon du phyogs pa yongs su ma spangs pa dang /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa las ni nus pa khyad par can bden pa bzhi bsgom par mi nus pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par lta zhing rgyab kyis phyogs shing mngon du phyogs pa yongs su ma spangs pa dang /
translated: In the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle, it says:

original: sems kyi thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs rnams bsgom par mi nus te /
analyzed: sems kyi thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs rnams bsgom par mi nus te /
translated: On the fourth bodhisattva stage, one is unable to meditate on the four truths with special ability, and one is unable to meditate on the factors of enlightenment that are embraced by the method of mind without completely abandoning the view of samsara and nirvana as separate and facing in different directions.

original: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: One is unable to do so because of the three obscurations.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu rgyab kyis phyogs shing mngon du phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa'i ma rig pa dang / thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu rgyab kyis phyogs shing mngon du phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa'i ma rig pa dang / thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi ma rig pa'o //
translated: They are the ignorance that attends to samsara and nirvana as if they were absolutely separate and distinct, and the ignorance of the accessories of enlightenment that are not embraced by the means.

original: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyi rgyu dang rkyen las mngon par grub pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyi rgyu dang rkyen las mngon par grub pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is produced from the causes and conditions of these two kinds of ignorance is called the maturation of negative instincts.

original: sgrib pa gsum po de dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum po de dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: One establishes the cause of correct effort in order to eliminate those three obscurations.

original: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa dag spangs nas sa lnga pa la 'jug cing /
analyzed: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa dag spangs nas sa lnga pa la 'jug cing /
translated: Having eliminated the obscurations through correct effort, one enters the fifth spiritual level.

original: rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad kyang 'thob la /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad kyang 'thob la /
translated: One also attains the eight kinds of preeminence of purity.

original: rgyab kyis phyogs pa dang mdun du phyogs pa'i sems la sogs pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs pa dang mdun du phyogs pa'i sems la sogs pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And one abandons the mind that is turned away from samsara and is directed towards nirvana.

original: chos kyi rgyun tha dad pa'i don gyi bar du yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyun tha dad pa'i don gyi bar du yang rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: They also understand the meaning of the distinctness of the stream of Dharma.🔽
One also realizes the meaning of the distinctness of the stream of Dharma.

original: lag des sa lnga pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: lag des sa lnga pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: By that branch, the fifth stage is completed.

original: 'khor bar 'jug pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtogs par mi nus pa dang / gzhan yang de la skyo ba mang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor bar 'jug pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtogs par mi nus pa dang / gzhan yang de la skyo ba mang ba'i phyir /
translated: Because one is not able to correctly discern the process of entering saṃsāra, and because one is weary of it,

original: mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pas /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pas /
translated: one is not able to abide in the attention of signlessness.🔽By that cause and condition, that branch is incomplete.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni drug pa yan lag drug pas mngon du gyur ba bsdus pa ston to //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni drug pa yan lag drug pas mngon du gyur ba bsdus pa ston to //
translated: This is the teaching on the sixth branch, which includes the manifest.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: sa lnga pa la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa bstan pa dang / rang gi sa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub par byed pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa lnga pa la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa bstan pa dang / rang gi sa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub par byed pa bstan pa ste /
translated: the teaching on the incompleteness of the later practice on the fifth stage, and the teaching on the accomplishment of one’s own stage.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar sa lnga pas bden pa'i rnal 'byor thob mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa lnga pas bden pa'i rnal 'byor thob mod kyi /
translated: Thus, although the fifth ground obtains the yoga of the truth of the path,

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa gnyis kyis sa drug pa 'thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa gnyis kyis sa drug pa 'thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: it does not obtain the sixth ground due to two causes and conditions.

original: 'khor bar 'jug pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rigs pa so sor rtogs par mi nus pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa la skyo ba mang du skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor bar 'jug pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rigs pa so sor rtogs par mi nus pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa la skyo ba mang du skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: It is unable to individually comprehend the reasoning of dependent origination in terms of the way things really are with respect to engaging in cyclic existence, and it is unable to frequently generate weariness with respect to the afflictions of suffering and origin.

original: mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pa ste /
translated: It is unable to frequently abide in the attention of signlessness.

original: rkyen rnam pa gnyis po des sa drug pa'i yan lag yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rkyen rnam pa gnyis po des sa drug pa'i yan lag yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that due to those two conditions, the branches of the sixth ground are not complete.

original: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
translated: In order to complete those branches, one strives and meditates, and one obtains them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gi sa'i chos yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gi sa'i chos yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa ston to //
translated: Those bodhisattvas, by that cause and condition, complete that factor. This teaches the second, the accomplishment of perfecting the qualities of one's own stage.

original: 'di ltar sa drug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa drug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because the bodhisattva on the sixth stage sees dependent origination,

original: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: that factor is completed.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: In the commentary on the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle,🔽it says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa la 'du byed kyi chos rnams rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba tshul bzhin du mngon du byed pa'i nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa la 'du byed kyi chos rnams rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba tshul bzhin du mngon du byed pa'i nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the bodhisattva on the fifth stage does not have the special ability to properly manifest the uninterrupted arising of conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos la chos mang du bsgoms pas yun ring por yid bzhin du mtshan @257b ma yid la byed pas gnas par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos la chos mang du bsgoms pas yun ring por yid bzhin du mtshan @257b ma yid la byed pas gnas par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he is unable to abide for a long time as he wishes, by mentally attending to the many phenomena of conditioned things that he has cultivated in meditation.

original: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: One is unable to do so because of the three obscurations.

original: 'du byed kyi chos rnams rgyun mi 'chad pas 'jug pa mngon du bya ba'i ma rig pa dang / mtshan ma mang po kun du 'byung ba'i ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi chos rnams rgyun mi 'chad pas 'jug pa mngon du bya ba'i ma rig pa dang / mtshan ma mang po kun du 'byung ba'i ma rig pa'o //
translated: The first is the ignorance of the engagement of the process of manifestation, because the phenomena of formative influence are uninterrupted. The second is the ignorance of the arising of manifold signs.

original: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyi rgyu dang rkyen las mngon par grub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyi rgyu dang rkyen las mngon par grub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That samsara which is established through the cause and condition of these two kinds of ignorance is called the maturation of negative propensities.

original: sgrib pa gsum po de dag spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum po de dag spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate these three obscurations,

original: yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: one establishes the cause of correct endeavour.

original: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po dag spangs nas sa drug pa la 'jug cing /
analyzed: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po dag spangs nas sa drug pa la 'jug cing /
translated: Having eliminated the three obscurations through correct endeavour, one enters the sixth spiritual level and

original: rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad kyang 'thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad kyang 'thob par 'gyur la /
translated: attains the eight special kinds of purity.

original: 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba la sogs pa mngon du byed pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i don kyang rab tu rtogs par 'gyur bas yan lag des sa drug pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba la sogs pa mngon du byed pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i don kyang rab tu rtogs par 'gyur bas yan lag des sa drug pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: and the non-cessation of the arising of formations, etc. are manifested, and the meaning of the dharmadhatu as being without defilement and purification is also fully understood. Therefore, by that branch, the sixth stage is also completed.

original: bar chad med pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa med pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa med pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Because of the absence of uninterrupted and constant attention to signlessness, by that cause and condition, that branch is incomplete.

original: bdun pa yan lag bdun pas ring du song ba'i sa gsum pa ston to //
analyzed: bdun pa yan lag bdun pas ring du song ba'i sa gsum pa ston to //
translated: This teaches the third stage, the stage of Gone Afar, by means of seven branches.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: sa drug pa la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gis yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa drug pa la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gis yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa ste /
translated: the incomplete practice of the later stage on the sixth stage is taught, and the complete practice is taught.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar sa drug pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba sgom pa thob kyang sa bdun pa ltar na mtshan ma med pa 'ba' zhig tu bsgom par mi nus pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa drug pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba sgom pa thob kyang sa bdun pa ltar na mtshan ma med pa 'ba' zhig tu bsgom par mi nus pas so //
translated: Thus, although the sixth level attains the cultivation of dependent origination, it is not able to cultivate only the signless as the seventh level does.

original: mtshan ma med par bsgom pa na rgyun chad pa med cing 'gag pa med pa'i phyir bar chad med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par bsgom pa na rgyun chad pa med cing 'gag pa med pa'i phyir bar chad med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When cultivating the signless, it is uninterrupted and unceasing, so it is called uninterrupted.

original: mtshan mas bar du chod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyun chad pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan mas bar du chod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyun chad pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called uninterrupted because it is not interrupted by signs.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing Cognition-Only says:

original: sa snga ma lnga po dag ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa ni mang la mtshan ma med pa'i bsgom pa ni nyung ngo //
analyzed: sa snga ma lnga po dag ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa ni mang la mtshan ma med pa'i bsgom pa ni nyung ngo //
translated: On the first five levels, cultivation with signs is predominant, while cultivation without signs is slight.

original: sa drug pa la ni mtshan ma med pa'i bsgom pa ni mang la /
analyzed: sa drug pa la ni mtshan ma med pa'i bsgom pa ni mang la /
translated: On the sixth level, cultivation without signs is predominant,

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa ni @258a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa ni @258a * //
translated: while cultivation with signs is slight.

original: nyung ngo // sa bdun pa la ni gcig tu mtshan ma med pa 'ba' zhig tu bsgoms pas /
analyzed: nyung ngo // sa bdun pa la ni gcig tu mtshan ma med pa 'ba' zhig tu bsgoms pas /
translated: On the seventh level, since it is cultivated as only the signless,

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By that cause and condition, that branch is not perfected.

original: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
translated: In order to perfect that branch, he strives and cultivates it, and he attains it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gi sa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bsgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gi sa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bsgrub pa ston to //
translated: By that cause and condition, that branch is perfected.

original: 'di ltar sa bdun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bar chad med pa dang / rgyun chad pa med par mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa mngon du gyur pas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bdun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bar chad med pa dang / rgyun chad pa med par mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa mngon du gyur pas na /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva on the seventh ground, because of the uninterrupted and constant manifestation of the attention of signlessness,

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: by that cause and condition, that branch is perfected.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: This is the explanation of the second chapter, “The Perfection of One’s Own Ground,” from the commentary of the Verses of the Summary of the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa drug pa la 'dus byas kyi chos kyi mtshan ma med pa'i spyod pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba spong pa'i nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang / yun ring por yid bzhin du bar chad med pa dang / rgyun chad pa med par mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa la gnas par mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa drug pa la 'dus byas kyi chos kyi mtshan ma med pa'i spyod pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba spong pa'i nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang / yun ring por yid bzhin du bar chad med pa dang / rgyun chad pa med par mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa la gnas par mi nus so //
translated: He is not able to remain in signlessness for a long time, as he wishes, without interruption, and without a break.

original: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: He is not able to do this because of three obscurations.

original: mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i ma rig pa dang / mtshan ma med pa gcig tu thabs kyis ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i ma rig pa dang / mtshan ma med pa gcig tu thabs kyis ma rig pa'o //
translated: They are the ignorance of the occurrence of subtle signs, and the ignorance of the one-sided method of signlessness.

original: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyi rgyu dang rkyen las mngon par grub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyi rgyu dang rkyen las mngon par grub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cyclic existence that is accomplished from the causes and conditions of these two ignorances is called the maturation of the negative conditioning.

original: sgrib pa gsum dag yang spong ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum dag yang spong ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed de /
translated: In order to eliminate the three obscurations, he accomplishes the cause of correct effort.

original: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum spangs nas /
analyzed: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the three obscurations through correct effort,

original: sa bdun pa la 'jug cing rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad kyang 'thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la 'jug cing rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad kyang 'thob par 'gyur la /
translated: they enter the seventh ground and attain the eight special pure aspects.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos mtshan ma kun du 'byung ba phra mo yongs su spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos mtshan ma kun du 'byung ba phra mo yongs su spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: They completely abandon the arising of all subtle conditioned phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings chos sna tshogs tha dad pa med pa'i don kyang rab tu rtogs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings chos sna tshogs tha dad pa med pa'i don kyang rab tu rtogs par 'gyur bas /
translated: They also realize the meaning of the dharmadhatu, the nondifferentiation of various phenomena.

original: yan lag des sa bdun pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yan lag des sa bdun pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Through that branch, the seventh ground is completely perfected.🔽They are not able to attain mastery over signs, and due to that cause and condition, that branch is not perfected.

original: mtshan ma med par gnas pa la rtsol ba lhag par btang snyoms su bzhag pa dang / gzhan yang mtshan ma la dbang thob par mi nus pas @258b rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brgyad pa yan lag brgyad pas mi g-yo ba'i sa bsdus pa ston to //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par gnas pa la rtsol ba lhag par btang snyoms su bzhag pa dang / gzhan yang mtshan ma la dbang thob par mi nus pas @258b rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brgyad pa yan lag brgyad pas mi g-yo ba'i sa bsdus pa ston to //
translated: Those and so on teach that the immovable ground is subsumed by the eighth branch.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: yan lag de snga ma la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gi yan lag la 'bad pas bsgrub par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag de snga ma la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gi yan lag la 'bad pas bsgrub par bstan pa ste /
translated: the former branch is taught as not being fully completed by the latter practice, and the branch itself is taught as being accomplished through effort.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar sa bdun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de mtshan ma med par gnas pa la rtsol ba spang bar mi nus pa dang / gzhan yang mtshan ma la dbang thob par mi nus pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bdun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de mtshan ma med par gnas pa la rtsol ba spang bar mi nus pa dang / gzhan yang mtshan ma la dbang thob par mi nus pas /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva on the seventh ground is unable to abandon the effort that is the basis of signlessness, and moreover, is unable to attain mastery over signs.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag brgyad pa de ma rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag brgyad pa de ma rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: By that cause and condition, that eighth branch is not completed.

original: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
translated: In order to fully complete that branch, he strives and meditates, and he attains it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes pa ni /
translated: Those bodhisattvas, by that cause and condition, fully complete that branch.

original: gnyis pa rang gi sa'i chos 'bad pas yongs su sgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pa rang gi sa'i chos 'bad pas yongs su sgrub pa ston to //
translated: The second teaches the accomplishment through effort of the qualities of one’s own ground.

original: 'di ltar sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de mtshan ma med par gnas pa de la 'bad pa spong bar nus pa dang / gzhan yang mtshan ma la dbang thob par nus pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de mtshan ma med par gnas pa de la 'bad pa spong bar nus pa dang / gzhan yang mtshan ma la dbang thob par nus pas /
translated: furthermore, is able to attain mastery over signs.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By these causes and conditions, that factor is perfected.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: In the commentary to the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa bdun pa spangs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa bdun pa spangs nas /
translated: it is said that, having abandoned the seventh bodhisattva level,

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / bdag la phan 'dogs pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma la dbang thob pa'i nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang mi ldan te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / bdag la phan 'dogs pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma la dbang thob pa'i nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang mi ldan te /
translated: the bodhisattva does not possess the superior ability to abide in signlessness, to benefit himself, and to attain mastery over signs that benefit others.

original: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: The reason for this inability is the three obscurations:

original: mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa'i ma rig pa dang / mtshan ma la dbang ma thob pa'i ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa'i ma rig pa dang / mtshan ma la dbang ma thob pa'i ma rig pa'o //
translated: ignorance regarding signlessness and so forth, and ignorance of not attaining mastery over signs.

original: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That cyclic existence which is accomplished by these two kinds of ignorance is called “the maturation of negative reflex actions.”

original: sgrib pa gsum po dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed de //
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum po dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed de //
translated: In order to abandon the three obscurations, one establishes the cause of correct effort.

original: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po spangs nas sa brgyad pa la 'jug cing /
analyzed: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po spangs nas sa brgyad pa la 'jug cing /
translated: Having abandoned the three obscurations through correct effort, one enters the eighth stage.

original: rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad kyang 'thob par 'gyur /🔽rtsol ba dang bral ba'i sems kyis mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa la sogs pa @259a * //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad kyang 'thob par 'gyur / rtsol ba dang bral ba'i sems kyis mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa la sogs pa @259a * //
translated: And one also attains the eight kinds of special purity.

original: yang thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang thob par 'gyur /
translated: And one also attains the state of abiding in signlessness with a mind free from effort.

original: chos kyi dbyings 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa'i don kyang rab tu rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa'i don kyang rab tu rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: And one also realizes the meaning of the non-increase and non-decrease of the Dharma-dhātu.

original: yan lag de'i phyir sa brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yan lag de'i phyir sa brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: For that reason, the eighth stage is completed.”

original: rnam grangs dang / mtshan nyid mang po dang / nges pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa la dbang thob par mi nus pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: rnam grangs dang / mtshan nyid mang po dang / nges pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa la dbang thob par mi nus pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Because of that cause and condition, that branch is incomplete.

original: dgu pa yan lag dgu pas sa legs pa'i blo gros bsdus pa ston to //
analyzed: dgu pa yan lag dgu pas sa legs pa'i blo gros bsdus pa ston to //
translated: The ninth branch, the branch of the ninth stage, the stage of Good Intellect, is taught.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: yan lag snga ma la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gi phyogs brtson 'grus kyis yongs su rdzogs par sgrub par byed pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag snga ma la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gi phyogs brtson 'grus kyis yongs su rdzogs par sgrub par byed pa bstan pa ste /
translated: the teaching that the later practice is incomplete in the earlier branch, and the teaching that one's own position is accomplished by the perfection of effort.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: de la rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: de la rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i yul lo //
translated: Among them, the term enumeration is the object of the correct knowledge of Dharma.

original: mtshan nyid mang po zhes bya ba ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mang po zhes bya ba ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'i yul lo //
translated: The term many characteristics is the object of the correct knowledge of meaning.

original: nges pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The etymology of “perfect discernment” is as follows.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'i yul lo //🔽rnam pa thams cad du ston pa la dbang thob pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'i yul lo // rnam pa thams cad du ston pa la dbang thob pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The object of the analytical knowledge of language is called “the differentiation of words.”

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i yul te /
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i yul te /
translated: The object of the analytical knowledge of prowess is called “mastery over teaching in all its forms.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /🔽chos kyi rnam grangs la brten pa'i shes pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las / chos kyi rnam grangs la brten pa'i shes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says,

original: 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa'i thogs pa med pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //🔽chos kyi mtshan nyid la brten pa'i shes pa ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa'i thogs pa med pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o // chos kyi mtshan nyid la brten pa'i shes pa ni /
translated: “The knowledge that is based on the categories of the teachings is as follows: It is the unobstructed insight of the bodhisattva.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The knowledge that is based on the characteristics of the teachings is as follows:

original: byang chub pa'i don la thogs pa med pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //🔽nges pa'i tshig la brten pa'i shes pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub pa'i don la thogs pa med pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o // nges pa'i tshig la brten pa'i shes pa ni /
translated: It is the unobstructed insight of the bodhisattva into the meaning of the teachings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The knowledge that is based on language is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nges pa'i tshig la thogs pa med pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nges pa'i tshig la thogs pa med pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the unobstructed insight of the bodhisattva into language.🔽The knowledge that is based on intrepidity is as follows:🔽It is the unobstructed insight of the bodhisattva into intrepidity.”

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba la brten pa'i shes pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba la brten pa'i shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge that is based on the differentiation of all phenomena

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spobs pa thogs pa med pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spobs pa thogs pa med pa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: It is the unobstructed wisdom of the bodhisattva’s eloquence.

original: 'di ltar sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sa dgu pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ma thob pa'i phyir mi nus pa zhes bshad de //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sa dgu pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ma thob pa'i phyir mi nus pa zhes bshad de //
translated: Thus, it is explained that the bodhisattva on the eighth stage is unable to attain the four analytical knowledges of the ninth stage.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag dgu pa yongs su ma rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag dgu pa yongs su ma rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: For that reason, the ninth branch is not complete.

original: yan lag @259b de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: yan lag @259b de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob bo //
translated: In order to complete that branch, he strives and meditates, and he attains it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The bodhisattva, for that reason, completes that branch.

original: gnyis pa rang gi yan lag brtson 'grus kyis bsgrub par bstan te /
analyzed: gnyis pa rang gi yan lag brtson 'grus kyis bsgrub par bstan te /
translated: This is the second branch, which is taught to be accomplished by one’s own effort.

original: 'di ltar sa dgu pas so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa dgu pas so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because the bodhisattva on the ninth stage attains the four analytical knowledges,

original: thob pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: thob pa zhes bshad de /
translated: It is explained as attainment.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By that cause and condition, that branch is also perfected.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: In the commentary on the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle, it says:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la yang dag par chos bstan pa phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rnam grangs dang / rnam pa la sogs pa la dbang thob pa'i nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang mi ldan pas legs par bshad pa'i gzungs 'thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la yang dag par chos bstan pa phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang rnam grangs dang / rnam pa la sogs pa la dbang thob pa'i nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang mi ldan pas legs par bshad pa'i gzungs 'thob par mi nus so //
translated: “On the eighth bodhisattva ground, because one does not possess the special ability to attain mastery over the characteristics, categories, aspects, and so forth of the perfect teaching of the Dharma, one is not able to attain the dhāraṇī of eloquent courage.

original: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: The reason for not being able to do that is because of the three obscurations.”

original: chos bstan pa dpag tu med pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge dpag tu med pa dang / gong nas gong du shes rab dang / spobs pa dang / gzungs gyi dbang thob pa'i ma rig pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis the tshom bcad nas shes pa skye ba'i ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa dpag tu med pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge dpag tu med pa dang / gong nas gong du shes rab dang / spobs pa dang / gzungs gyi dbang thob pa'i ma rig pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis the tshom bcad nas shes pa skye ba'i ma rig pa'o //
translated: The ignorance of the arising of knowledge is the ignorance of one who, having attained the mastery of the higher and higher wisdom, eloquence, and retention through the immeasurable teaching of the Dharma, the immeasurable words and letters of the Dharma, and the four analytical knowledges, still has doubts.

original: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cyclic existence that is accomplished by these two kinds of ignorance is called the “maturation of negative conditioning.”

original: sgrib pa gsum po dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum po dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed do //
translated: One strives perfectly to eliminate the three obstructions, and thus one accomplishes the cause.

original: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po dag spangs nas sa dgu pa la 'jug cing rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po dag spangs nas sa dgu pa la 'jug cing rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa brgyad kyang 'thob bo //
translated: Having eliminated the three obstructions by striving perfectly, one enters the ninth stage and attains the eight kinds of superior purity.

original: yang dag par chos bstan pa la phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang la sogs pa yang 'thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang dag par chos bstan pa la phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang la sogs pa yang 'thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They also attain the power of perfect teaching of the Dharma and so forth.

original: chos kyi dbyings ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don kyang rab tu rtogs par 'gyur bas yan lag de'i phyir sa dgu pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don kyang rab tu rtogs par 'gyur bas yan lag de'i phyir sa dgu pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: And they fully realize the meaning of the domain of the wisdom of the dharmadhātu. Therefore, they complete the ninth bhūmi.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las bstan pa dang sbyar na ma rig pa gnyis kyis so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las bstan pa dang sbyar na ma rig pa gnyis kyis so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la sgrib par byed de /
translated: When applied to the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna, the two ignorances obscure the four correct and discerning awarenesses.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽ma rig pa dang pos ni @260a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / ma rig pa dang pos ni @260a * //
translated: They are as follows.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa dang po gsum la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa dang po gsum la sgrib par byed do //
translated: The first ignorance obscures the first three correct and discerning awarenesses.

original: ma rig pa gnyis pas ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi pa la sgrib par byed do zhes bshad pa de yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / mdo 'di nyid khungs su bzhag nas /🔽slob dpon yang dag bden pas rang nyid kyis bzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa gnyis pas ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi pa la sgrib par byed do zhes bshad pa de yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / mdo 'di nyid khungs su bzhag nas / slob dpon yang dag bden pas rang nyid kyis bzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: The second ignorance obscures the fourth correct understanding.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa /
translated: This explanation is set forth by the master Paramartha in his commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, and it is based on the Yogacarya Levels and this sutra itself.

original: rgya gar gyi dpe nyid las ni tshig 'di lta bu dang / gtan tshigs 'di lta bu gtan med de /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi dpe nyid las ni tshig 'di lta bu dang / gtan tshigs 'di lta bu gtan med de /
translated: However, these words and this reasoning are not found in the Indian text itself.

original: ma rig pa gnyis pa ni mos pa so so yang dag par rig pa la sgrib par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa gnyis pa ni mos pa so so yang dag par rig pa la sgrib par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second ignorance obscures the correct understanding of interest.

original: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du bya ba dang / rab tu myong ba 'thob par mi nus pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du bya ba dang / rab tu myong ba 'thob par mi nus pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Because one is unable to manifest and fully experience the complete dharmakaya, by that cause and condition, that branch is incomplete.

original: bcu pa yan lag bcu pas sa chos kyi sprin sgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: bcu pa yan lag bcu pas sa chos kyi sprin sgrub pa ston to //
translated: This and more explains how the tenth branch establishes the ground Cloud of Dharma.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: yan lag snga ma las snga ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gi yan lag 'bad de bsgrub par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag snga ma las snga ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gi yan lag 'bad de bsgrub par bstan pa ste /
translated: the non-perfection of the former branches of the path, and the perfection of the latter branches of the path.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar sa dgu ba rgyu yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du bya bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa dgu ba rgyu yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du bya bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: Thus, the ninth stage is unable to manifest the perfection of the Dharma Body because its causes are not yet complete.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary of the master Subhagavajra,🔽it says:

original: 'di ltar sa dgu pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas sku gsum yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa dgu pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas sku gsum yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du bya bar mi nus te /
translated: Thus, the ninth stage is unable to manifest the perfection of the three bodies because it is not yet perfected.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur to zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur to zhes bshad do //
translated: By that cause and condition, that branch is not yet perfected.

original: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob po //
analyzed: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob po //
translated: In order to perfect that branch, he strives and meditates, and thus he attains it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gi yan lag 'bad de bsgrub par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rang gi yan lag 'bad de bsgrub par bstan pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas, by that cause and condition, complete that branch. This is the second explanation of the need to strive to complete one's own branch.

original: 'di ltar sa bcu pa de yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa 'thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bcu pa de yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa 'thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Because that tenth bhumi is completed, the dharmakaya is completed and attained.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By that cause and condition, that branch is completed.🔽In the commentary to the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna,

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: it says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa dgu pa la nus pa khyad par du 'phags pas yang dag par chos ston pa'i chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang @260b ma chags ma thogs pa'i mngon par shes pa drug gi shes rab 'thob par mi nus te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa dgu pa la nus pa khyad par du 'phags pas yang dag par chos ston pa'i chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang @260b ma chags ma thogs pa'i mngon par shes pa drug gi shes rab 'thob par mi nus te /
translated: “On the ninth bodhisattva bhumi, because of the superiority of its power, one is unable to attain the complete dharmakāya of the perfect teaching of the dharma and the wisdom of the six unimpeded higher perceptions.

original: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: The reason for that inability is the three obscurations.

original: mngon par shes pa drug gi shes rab kyi ma rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu gsang ba la 'jug pa'i ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug gi shes rab kyi ma rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu gsang ba la 'jug pa'i ma rig pa'o //
translated: The ignorance of the wisdom of the six supernormal knowledges, and the ignorance of engaging in the very secret qualities of the Buddha.

original: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'khor ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cyclic existence that is accomplished by these two ignorances is called the fully ripened negative tendencies.

original: sgrib pa gsum po de dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum po de dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed do //
translated: In order to abandon those three obscurations, one accomplishes the cause of correct effort.

original: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po spangs nas sa bcu pa la 'jug cing khyad par du 'phags pa'i rnam par dag pa brgyad kyang 'thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang dag par rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po spangs nas sa bcu pa la 'jug cing khyad par du 'phags pa'i rnam par dag pa brgyad kyang 'thob par 'gyur la /
translated: Having abandoned the three obscurations through correct effort, one enters the tenth ground and attains the eight special purities.

original: yang dag par chos bstan pa'i chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa la sogs pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag par chos bstan pa'i chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa la sogs pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: One also attains the complete perfection of the dharmakāya of the correct teaching of the Dharma, and so on.

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don kyang rab tu rtogs par 'gyur pas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don kyang rab tu rtogs par 'gyur pas /
translated: One also realizes the meaning of the basis of mastery over the dharmadhātu.

original: yan lag de'i phyir /
analyzed: yan lag de'i phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: sa bcu pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sa bcu pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: And the tenth level is also completed.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary of the master Paramartha,🔽it says:

original: sa dgu pa yongs su rdzogs nas thob pa'i sku gsum pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dgu pa yongs su rdzogs nas thob pa'i sku gsum pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “When the ninth level is completed, the third body that is attained is called the complete Dharma body.

original: 'di ni yang dag par chos ston pa'i chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par chos ston pa'i chos kyi sku'o //
translated: This is the Dharma body that perfectly teaches the Dharma.

original: chos kyi sku las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa drug gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni sprul pa'i sku yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa drug gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni sprul pa'i sku yin te /
translated: The wisdom of the six superknowledges that arises from the Dharma body is the emanation body.

original: 'di ltar las la dbang thob pas sprul pa'i sku mngon par 'grub pas so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar las la dbang thob pas sprul pa'i sku mngon par 'grub pas so zhes bshad do //
translated: In this way, by attaining power over karma, the emanation body is actualized.”

original: shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dam pa dang / mthong ba dam pa 'thob pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dam pa dang / mthong ba dam pa 'thob pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: By attaining the highest knowledge that is unattached and unobstructed with regard to all objects of knowledge, and by attaining the highest vision, through that cause and condition, that branch is completed.

original: yan lag bcu gcig pas sangs rgyas kyi gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gcig pas sangs rgyas kyi gsungs pa ston to //
translated: The eleventh member shows the teaching of the Buddha.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also twofold:

original: yan lag snga ma la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gi yan lag 'bad de yongs su rdzogs par bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag snga ma la phyi ma'i spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / rang gi yan lag 'bad de yongs su rdzogs par bsgrub pa ste /
translated: the former member is shown as the incomplete practice of the latter, and the latter member is accomplished by the effort of its own member.

original: 'di ni dang po'o /🔽'di ltar sa bcu pas shes bya'i yul thams cad khyad par khong du chud cing chos ston pa nyid kyi chags pa med par shes pa dam pa dang mthong ba dam pa dang / gang zag @261a * //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o / 'di ltar sa bcu pas shes bya'i yul thams cad khyad par khong du chud cing chos ston pa nyid kyi chags pa med par shes pa dam pa dang mthong ba dam pa dang / gang zag @261a * //
translated: This is the first.🔽Thus, the tenth stage is not able to attain the highest knowledge, the highest vision, and the highest unobstructed knowledge of emptiness of all objects of knowledge, and the teaching of the Dharma, because of the attachment to the stage.

original: stong pa nyid kyi thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dam pa dang / mthong ba dam pa thob par mi nus pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dam pa dang / mthong ba dam pa thob par mi nus pas rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su ma rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: By that cause and condition, that member becomes incomplete.

original: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob ste /
analyzed: yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad de bsgoms pas de yang 'thob ste /
translated: In order to complete that member, one strives and meditates, and thus it is attained.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of that cause and that condition, the branch is completely fulfilled.

original: yan lag thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa /
analyzed: yan lag thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa /
translated: Because of that cause and that condition, all the branches are completely fulfilled.

original: rang gi yan lag de 'bad de rdzogs par bsgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: rang gi yan lag de 'bad de rdzogs par bsgrub pa ston to //
translated: This shows that the branch is completely fulfilled through effort.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi sa 'dir shes pa dang / mthong ba thams cad yongs su thob pas rgyu dang rkyen des sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi sa 'dir shes pa dang / mthong ba thams cad yongs su thob pas rgyu dang rkyen des sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: In this way, because all knowledge and all seeing is completely attained on this Buddha ground, because of that cause and that condition, the Buddha ground is completely fulfilled.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the Buddha ground is completely fulfilled,

original: yan lag bcu gcig pa thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gcig pa thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: all eleven branches are completely fulfilled.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: In the commentary to the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur kyang /
translated: it says that although the tenth bodhisattva ground is completely fulfilled,

original: nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i mthong ba dang / shes pa thob par mi nus te /
analyzed: nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i mthong ba dang / shes pa thob par mi nus te /
translated: One is unable to attain the special power, the complete perfection of the purified Dharma Body, and the vision and knowledge that is unattached to all objects of knowledge and unobstructed.

original: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar mi nus pa yang sgrib pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: And the reason for that inability is the three obstructions.

original: shes bya thams cad la chags pa shin tu phra mo'i ma rig pa dang / shes bya thams cad la thogs pa shin tu phra mo'i ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la chags pa shin tu phra mo'i ma rig pa dang / shes bya thams cad la thogs pa shin tu phra mo'i ma rig pa'o //
translated: The subtle nescience that is attachment to all objects of knowledge, and the subtle nescience that is obstruction to all objects of knowledge.

original: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i 'khor pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di gnyis kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i 'khor pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The cyclic existence that is accomplished by these two kinds of nescience

original: gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the “maturation of negative reflex actions.”

original: sgrib ba gsum po de dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sgrib ba gsum po de dag spang ba'i phyir yang dag par rtsol ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed do //
translated: In order to eliminate those three obstructions, one accomplishes the cause of correct effort.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po de dag spangs nas bcu gcig pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug cing khyad par du 'phags pa'i rnam par dag pa bdun dang / skye ba dang bral ba'i rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas sgrib pa gsum po de dag spangs nas bcu gcig pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug cing khyad par du 'phags pa'i rnam par dag pa bdun dang / skye ba dang bral ba'i rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
translated: Through right effort, having abandoned those three obscurations, one enters the eleventh ground, the ground of the tathagatas, and one attains the seven distinctive perfect purities, the perfect purity free from birth, the perfect purity of the dharmakaya and

original: chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i mthong ba dang / shes pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i mthong ba dang / shes pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: the unattached, unobstructed seeing and knowledge.

original: yan lag de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no @261b zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yan lag de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no @261b zhes bshad do //
translated: For that reason, one attains the perfection of buddhahood.

original: kha cig na re yan lag bcu gcig gis sa bcu gcig bsdu ba yang rnam pa gsum du dbye bas de la dang po'i yan lag gcig kyang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re yan lag bcu gcig gis sa bcu gcig bsdu ba yang rnam pa gsum du dbye bas de la dang po'i yan lag gcig kyang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: Some say: The eleven branches subsume the eleven grounds and since they are classified in three, the first branch is also classified in two.

original: gnas skabs snga ma la spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / sa de las yang dag par 'das zhes bya ba man chad kyis rang gis yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs snga ma la spyod pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / sa de las yang dag par 'das zhes bya ba man chad kyis rang gis yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The first part of the verse shows that the previous stage is not fully completed, and the second part shows that one has truly gone beyond that stage.

original: gnyis pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag ces bya ba man chad yan lag dgu po dag ni re re yang yan lag gsum gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag ces bya ba man chad yan lag dgu po dag ni re re yang yan lag gsum gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The second is shown by the words “those bodhisattvas” and so on. Each of the nine branches is divided into three parts.

original: snga ma'i gnas skabs kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa dang / gnas skabs phyi ma yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba man chad yongs su rdzogs par bya bar bsgrub par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i gnas skabs kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa dang / gnas skabs phyi ma yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa dang / yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba man chad yongs su rdzogs par bya bar bsgrub par bstan pa'o //
translated: The first part shows the completion of the previous stage, the second part shows the incompleteness of the next stage, and the third part shows the accomplishment of the completion of that branch.

original: gsum pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag ces bya ba man chad kyi yan lag bcu gcig gis bstan te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag ces bya ba man chad kyi yan lag bcu gcig gis bstan te /
translated: The third is shown by the words “those bodhisattvas” and so on.

original: 'di yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into four parts.

original: gnas skabs snga ma yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa dang / yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba man chad kyis yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bsgrub par bstan pa dang / yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba man chad kyis yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa bzlas te bstan pa'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: gnas skabs snga ma yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa dang / yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba man chad kyis yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bsgrub par bstan pa dang / yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba man chad kyis yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa bzlas te bstan pa'o zhes zer te /
translated: The first part of the verse shows the complete teaching of the previous stage, and the second part shows the establishment of the completion of the branch, and the third part shows the repetition of the completion of the branch.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang bshad pa ni snga ma yang dag pa yin no //🔽rigs kyi bu de ltar yan lag bcu gcig po de dag gis sa rnams ma lus par bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang bshad pa ni snga ma yang dag pa yin no // rigs kyi bu de ltar yan lag bcu gcig po de dag gis sa rnams ma lus par bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o /
translated: Although there are two explanations, the former is correct.🔽Son of noble family, in this way, know that all the stages are included in these eleven branches.

original: // / bam po lnga bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: // / bam po lnga bcu bzhi pa /
translated: This is the second general conclusion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara again said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du sa dang po la rab tu dga' ba zhes bgyi //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du sa dang po la rab tu dga' ba zhes bgyi //
translated: Bhagavan, why is the first bhumi called Very Joyful?🔽Why is the bhumi of a buddha called the bhumi of a buddha?”

original: ci'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar la sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bgyi ba lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa sa'i ming gi don bstan pa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: ci'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar la sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bgyi ba lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa sa'i ming gi don bstan pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the names of the bhumis is presented from here onward.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /🔽'di ni dang po sa rnams kyi ming gi don zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te / 'di ni dang po sa rnams kyi ming gi don zhus pa'o //
translated: This is also presented in the question and the answer.

original: bcom ldan @262a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan @262a * //
translated: This is the question about the meaning of the names of the first bhumi.

original: 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan said to the bodhisattva Avalokitesvara:

original: rigs kyi bu don chen po yongs su grub cing sngon ma 'dris pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems thob nas dga' ba chen po skye bas de'i phyir dang po ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu don chen po yongs su grub cing sngon ma 'dris pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems thob nas dga' ba chen po skye bas de'i phyir dang po ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Son of noble family, having attained the great purpose and the supramundane mind that is not familiar from before, great joy arises. Therefore, the first is called the bhumi of Very Joyful.

original: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: The second shows the reply of the Tathāgata.

original: 'di yang sa bcu gcig bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa bcu gcig tu dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang sa bcu gcig bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa bcu gcig tu dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into eleven parts, because it shows the eleven stages.

original: 'di ni dang pos rab tu dga' ba bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang pos rab tu dga' ba bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the first stage, the Joyous.

original: bshad pa 'di la yang don rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di la yang don rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: This explanation also has two topics:

original: bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i thob pa dang zag pa med pa'i sems thob pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i thob pa dang zag pa med pa'i sems thob pa ste /
translated: the attainment of benefit for oneself and the attainment of the uncontaminated mind.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the commentary to the Daśabhūmika,

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa bla na med pa yongs su grub cing /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa bla na med pa yongs su grub cing /
translated: it says, “Because of the attainment of the highest benefit for oneself and others,

original: 'phags pa'i gnas thog ma kho nar thob pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gnas thog ma kho nar thob pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba zhes bshad do //
translated: and because of the attainment of the first stage of the āryas, it is called the Joyous.”

original: de la 'phags pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Here, the so-called stage of the āryas is uncontaminated wisdom.
