original: sa'i ming gi don rnam par bshad pa yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas kha cig las ni don rnam pa gcig gis rab tu dga' ba'i ming ston pa yang yod de /
analyzed: sa'i ming gi don rnam par bshad pa yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas kha cig las ni don rnam pa gcig gis rab tu dga' ba'i ming ston pa yang yod de /
translated: The meaning of the name of the stage is also explained in the teachings, but the explanations are not the same. In some it is taught that the name Joyful is due to one meaning.

original: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As the Sutra Requested by the King of Men says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' legs par rtogs pa dang / lha'i rgyal po chen po bzhis bden pa gnyis kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi don cig car gsal bar mthong ba zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' legs par rtogs pa dang / lha'i rgyal po chen po bzhis bden pa gnyis kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi don cig car gsal bar mthong ba zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva Su­pratiṣṭhita and the four great kings simultaneously saw the meaning of the equality of the two truths.”

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni de thog ma kho nar bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par nus pa'i yon tan thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni de thog ma kho nar bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par nus pa'i yon tan thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: In the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle, it is explained: “Because at the very beginning one obtains the qualities that are able to accomplish one’s own and others’ goals.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang de skad du bshad do //
translated: Master Vasubandhu and Master Bhāviveka also explain it in that way in their commentaries.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni gong na med pa'i mngon par rtogs pa yang dag par thob nas lhag pa'i dga' ba la gnas pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni gong na med pa'i mngon par rtogs pa yang dag par thob nas lhag pa'i dga' ba la gnas pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa bstan to //
translated: Having attained the unexcelled clear realization, one abides in the joy of the higher training.🔽The Explanation of the Ten Grounds states:

original: gnas pa bcu'i bshad pa las ni thog ma kho nar dge ba'i chos kyi ro thob pas sems kyi dga' ba mang ba'i ming ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gnas pa bcu'i bshad pa las ni thog ma kho nar dge ba'i chos kyi ro thob pas sems kyi dga' ba mang ba'i ming ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: At the very outset, one obtains the taste of virtuous dharmas, and so one is called “the one with abundant mental joy.”

original: kha cig las ni don rnam pa gnyis kyis rab tu dga' ba zhes ston to //
analyzed: kha cig las ni don rnam pa gnyis kyis rab tu dga' ba zhes ston to //
translated: Some sources teach the first ground as “the ground of joy” by means of two meanings.

original: @262b mdo 'di nyid dang / 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa la sogs pa las ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: @262b mdo 'di nyid dang / 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa la sogs pa las ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is as taught in the sutra itself and in the commentary on the Ten Grounds.

original: don rnam pa gsum gyis ston pa yang yod do /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum gyis ston pa yang yod do /
translated: There are also some sources that teach the first ground by means of three meanings.

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As the noble Golden Light Sutra teaches:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: thog ma kho nar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems thob pa dang / sngon ma thob pa gdod thob pa dang / bya ba dang nus pa chen po thob pas ji ltar smos pa bzhin du grub pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: thog ma kho nar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems thob pa dang / sngon ma thob pa gdod thob pa dang / bya ba dang nus pa chen po thob pas ji ltar smos pa bzhin du grub pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: and one obtains great activity and ability, as explained.

original: de la bya ba chen po ni bdag la phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bya ba chen po ni bdag la phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The great activity is the benefit for oneself.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las kyang /
translated: The treatise Establishing the Cognition Only also explains:🔽First, one obtains the nature of the ārya,🔽one manifests the completion of the two kinds of emptiness,

original: thog ma kho nar 'phags pa'i ngo bo nyid thob pa dang / stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du gyur pa dang / dga' ba la phan 'dogs shing dga' ba rgya chen po skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: thog ma kho nar 'phags pa'i ngo bo nyid thob pa dang / stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du gyur pa dang / dga' ba la phan 'dogs shing dga' ba rgya chen po skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: and one benefits oneself and generates great joy.

original: dad pa mang ba la sogs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi rjes su dran pa rnam pa dgu la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi spyod yul yang dag par 'das pa rnam pa bcu la sogs pa dang / dga' ba rnam pa bcu rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: dad pa mang ba la sogs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi rjes su dran pa rnam pa dgu la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi spyod yul yang dag par 'das pa rnam pa bcu la sogs pa dang / dga' ba rnam pa bcu rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni /
translated: The many kinds of faith, the nine kinds of recollection of the Buddha, the ten kinds of transcendence of the sphere of the world, and the ten kinds of joy are analyzed in detail.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa las ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa las ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as they are taught in the commentary to the Ten Stages.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa thams cad yongs su spangs pas de'i phyir gnyis pa ni dri ma med pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i sa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa thams cad yongs su spangs pas de'i phyir gnyis pa ni dri ma med pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i sa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The second stage is called the Unstained because it is free from all the stains of immorality.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: This is also in agreement with the Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning and the Sūtra Unravelling the Threads.

original: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni bral ba dang / rtog pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni bral ba dang / rtog pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The Sūtra of the Questions of King Milinda calls it the stage of freedom and the stage of investigation.

original: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad par /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad par /
translated: Therefore, it says in the verse:

original: bral dang rtog pa rab phye skyes bu ni //
analyzed: bral dang rtog pa rab phye skyes bu ni //
translated: The person who is free from conceptualization

original: rgyal rigs rnams su lus ni rab ston cing //
analyzed: rgyal rigs rnams su lus ni rab ston cing //
translated: manifests a body among the royal class,

original: 'gro ba drug po rnams ni stong khams su //🔽zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug po rnams ni stong khams su // zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: and in the six realms of the world🔽he manifests bodies in the billion worlds.🔽In the noble Golden Light Sutra,

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni /
translated: it is said:

original: ltung ba phra mo'i 'tshal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i phyir dri ma dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ltung ba phra mo'i 'tshal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i phyir dri ma dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is called the 'stage free from defilements' because it is completely purified from all faults of ethics, such as the desire for minor faults.🔽In the noble Sutra on the Ten Stages,

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las ni /
translated: it is said:

original: ser sna dang / phrag dog dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma'i @263a * //
analyzed: ser sna dang / phrag dog dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma'i @263a * //
translated: In order to completely abandon the mind defiled by stinginess, jealousy, and unethical conduct,

original: sems yongs su spang pa'i phyir dri ma dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems yongs su spang pa'i phyir dri ma dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is called the 'stage free from defilements'.

original: 'phags pa ni 'khrul ba'i sems 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa 'byung bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa dang bral nas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs par gyur pa'i phyir dri ma dang bral ba'i sa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni 'khrul ba'i sems 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa 'byung bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa dang bral nas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs par gyur pa'i phyir dri ma dang bral ba'i sa zhes bstan to //
translated: The noble ones are taught to be the stage free of stains because they are endowed with the perfection of pure ethics, free from the afflictions and so on that give rise to the fault of confused ethics.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thag bsrings pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thag bsrings pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna says, “Because the stain of unethical conduct is far removed.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu, it says:

original: rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas sa dang po ltar bsams nas tshul khrims ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas sa dang po ltar bsams nas tshul khrims ma yin gyi /
translated: “The first stage is like that because it is naturally endowed with perfect ethics.

original: tshul khrims yongs su grub pa'i phyir dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma rnams yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su grub pa'i phyir dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma rnams yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: It is the stage of perfect ethics because it is the perfection of ethics, and it is the stage free of the stain of unethical conduct because it is the abandonment of unethical conduct.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las kyang don gyis slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las kyang don gyis slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The commentary composed by Master Svābhāvika also explains the meaning in accordance with the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu.🔽In the Treatise on Exposition,

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni /
translated: it is explained:

original: theg pa gnyis kyi sa las yang dag par 'das shing /
analyzed: theg pa gnyis kyi sa las yang dag par 'das shing /
translated: “Having perfectly transcended the stages of the two vehicles,

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa thob nas 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa thob nas 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: and having attained pure morality, it serves as the antidote to all stains of immorality.”🔽In the Sūtra on the Ten Stages, it is said:

original: gnas pa bcu'i mdo las ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi dri ma rnams dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas pa bcu'i mdo las ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi dri ma rnams dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Because it is free from the stains of the paths of the ten virtuous actions.”

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni /
translated: In the Treatise Establishing Cognition-Only,🔽it is explained:

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang ldan zhing 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa phra mo 'byung ba'i dri ma thag bsrings pa'i phyir dri ma dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang ldan zhing 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi nyes pa phra mo 'byung ba'i dri ma thag bsrings pa'i phyir dri ma dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: “Because it possesses completely pure morality and is far removed from the stains of the arising of the faults of immorality, it is called the stage free from stains.”

original: de ting nge 'dzin dang / thos pa'i gzungs thob pa dag gis shes pa'i snang ba tshad med pa'i gnas byed pas /
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin dang / thos pa'i gzungs thob pa dag gis shes pa'i snang ba tshad med pa'i gnas byed pas /
translated: Because it serves as the basis for the light of knowledge of those who have attained concentration and the retention of what is heard,

original: de'i phyir gsum pa ni 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa 'od byed pa'i sa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum pa ni 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa 'od byed pa'i sa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: therefore the third is called the Luminous Ground.

original: 'di ltar sa gsum bas ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir ni bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyi snang bskyed par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa gsum bas ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir ni bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyi snang bskyed par byed la /
translated: Thus, because of attaining concentration on the third ground, the light of the wisdom of meditation is generated.

original: thos pa'i gzungs thob pa'i phyir ni thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab kyi snang ba bskyed pas de'i phyir gsum pa ni 'od byed @263b pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i gzungs thob pa'i phyir ni thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab kyi snang ba bskyed pas de'i phyir gsum pa ni 'od byed @263b pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: And because of attaining the retention of what is heard, the light of the wisdom of hearing and contemplation is generated. Therefore the third is called the Luminous Ground.

original: yang na sa la ltos nas 'od skyed pa'i gnas byed pas 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sa la ltos nas 'od skyed pa'i gnas byed pas 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, it is called the Luminous Ground because it serves as the basis for generating light in dependence on the ground.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni snang ba'i sa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni snang ba'i sa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the Sutra Unraveling the Intention it is called the Ground of Luminous Light.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni 'od kyi sa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni 'od kyi sa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning calls it the “level of light.”

original: 'od byed pa'i sa zhes 'byung ba ni lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od byed pa'i sa zhes 'byung ba ni lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “level of shining” is used because the translators had different ideas.

original: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra Requested by the Noble King of Men says:

original: shes rab gsal ba'i sa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: shes rab gsal ba'i sa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: “It is the level of clear wisdom.”

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: Therefore, a verse from that sutra says:

original: shes rab gsal zhing stong nyid lta ba 'tha' bral lha yi rgyal //
analyzed: shes rab gsal zhing stong nyid lta ba 'tha' bral lha yi rgyal //
translated: The king of gods, clear wisdom, the view of emptiness free from extremes,

original: zhing khams mang por bdag nyid lus ston sems can 'dren par byed //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: zhing khams mang por bdag nyid lus ston sems can 'dren par byed // ces gsungs so //
translated: Manifests his body in many pure lands and guides sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni /🔽shes rab snang ba'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa dag mi g-yo zhing /
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni / shes rab snang ba'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa dag mi g-yo zhing /
translated: The Sutra of Golden Light says:🔽“Because it is the basis for the immeasurable samadhis of the light of wisdom, it is unshakable and cannot be overcome by anything.

original: gang gis kyang zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs kyis gzhi byed pa'i phyir snang ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis kyang zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs kyis gzhi byed pa'i phyir snang ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is the basis for the dharani of hearing, it is called the level of light.”

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang med pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po dag gong nas gong du gsal zhing yongs su dag par gyur pa'i phyir snag ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang med pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po dag gong nas gong du gsal zhing yongs su dag par gyur pa'i phyir snag ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because the three roots of virtue—non-greed, non-hatred, and non-deludedness—are increasingly clear and pure, it is called the Luminous.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las gnas pa bcu bstan pa dang / legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las gnas pa bcu bstan pa dang / legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The noble Buddha-avatamsaka Sūtra teaches ten levels, and the Sūtra Teaching the Noble Way of Life also teaches ten levels.

original: phal cher 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par ston to //
analyzed: phal cher 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par ston to //
translated: For the most part, these are similar to the levels taught in the noble ten levels Sūtra.🔽The treatise summary of the great vehicle teaches:

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa nyams pa med pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi snang ba chen po'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa nyams pa med pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi snang ba chen po'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is called the Luminous because it is the basis for not losing concentration and meditative absorption and because it is the basis for the great light of Dharma.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las ni /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las ni /
translated: The commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle composed by the master Vasubandhu explains:

original: sa 'dir ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rtag tu mi 'bral zhing nyams pa med pa'i phyir dang / theg pa chen po'i chos kyi snang ba byed pa'i phyir 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sa 'dir ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rtag tu mi 'bral zhing nyams pa med pa'i phyir dang / theg pa chen po'i chos kyi snang ba byed pa'i phyir 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Because meditative concentration, meditative attainment and the light of the Great Vehicle are never separated from and never degenerate on this level, it is called the Luminous.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni /
translated: Extensive differentiation is

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: as taught in the commentary by the master Nāgārjuna.

original: bstan bcos rnam par @264a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par @264a * //
translated: In the Explanation of the treatise,

original: bshad pa las ni ting nge 'dzin shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phung po thob nas ye shes chen po'i snang ba gnas gyur pas 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa las ni ting nge 'dzin shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phung po thob nas ye shes chen po'i snang ba gnas gyur pas 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said: Having attained the aggregate of extremely pure meditative concentration, the light of great gnosis is transformed and so it is called the Luminous.

original: ting nge 'dzin mchog dang / yon tan chen po'i gzungs yongs su grub nas shes rab dam pa'i 'od dpag tu med pa'i phyir yang 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mchog dang / yon tan chen po'i gzungs yongs su grub nas shes rab dam pa'i 'od dpag tu med pa'i phyir yang 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: and because of the light of the immeasurable pure wisdom, it is called the Luminous.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni 'od dang bcas pa'i sa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni 'od dang bcas pa'i sa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom, it is called the Ground of Light.

original: de byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thob pa dag gis nyon mongs pa rnams sreg par byed pa'i ye shes me'i 'od 'phro ba lta bur gyur pas de'i phyir bzhi pa ni 'od 'phro ba can gyis zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can
analyzed: de byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thob pa dag gis nyon mongs pa rnams sreg par byed pa'i ye shes me'i 'od 'phro ba lta bur gyur pas de'i phyir bzhi pa ni 'od 'phro ba can gyis zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can
translated: Because the light of the fire of wisdom that burns the afflictions through the attainment of the factors of enlightenment is like a spreading fire, the fourth is called the Ground of Radiance.

original: rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: 'di ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi ye shes kyi 'od kyis nyon mongs pa'i shing bsreg pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi ye shes kyi 'od kyis nyon mongs pa'i shing bsreg pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the light of the wisdom of the factors of enlightenment burns the tree of the afflictions, it is called the Ground of Radiance.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The sutra Unravelling the Intent and the sutra Profound Unravelling of Intention both state:🔽🔽

original: mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning and the Sutra Unravelling the Profound Meaning also explain this in accordance with what is taught in this very sutra.

original: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang 'od 'phro ba can zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang 'od 'phro ba can zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The Sutra Requested by the Noble King of Men also uses the term “radiant.”

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: Therefore, the verse in that sutra says:

original: shes rab 'od 'phro snang ba dam pa brtson 'grus che //🔽dga' ldan lha yi rgyal po stong khams mang po rgyu //
analyzed: shes rab 'od 'phro snang ba dam pa brtson 'grus che // dga' ldan lha yi rgyal po stong khams mang po rgyu //
translated: The light of wisdom is sublime radiance; great diligence

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: is the king of the gods in Tushita, the cause of many thousands of worlds.

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra of Golden Light states:

original: nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar byed cing ye shes kyi mes snang ba 'phel bar byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can gyi sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar byed cing ye shes kyi mes snang ba 'phel bar byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can gyi sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it pacifies afflictions and increases the light of the fire of wisdom and is the basis for cultivating the factors of enlightenment, it is called the radiant stage.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra of the Ten Sublime Bhumis states:

original: rtag par ye shes kyi 'od gtong ba dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che gzhan dag gis mi 'phrogs pa dag dang mtshungs pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rtag par ye shes kyi 'od gtong ba dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che gzhan dag gis mi 'phrogs pa dag dang mtshungs pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Because it always emits the light of pristine wisdom, like a precious wish-fulfilling gem that is not taken away by others, it is called “radiant.”

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo'i nang nas gnas pa bcu bstan pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo'i nang nas gnas pa bcu bstan pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: The noble Buddha-avatamsaka-sutra teaches this in the chapter on the ten stages.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa las ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa las ni /
translated: The noble Dashabhumika-vibhasa-sastra says,

original: mi brjed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i shing ye shes kyi mes bsreg pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can gyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi brjed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i shing ye shes kyi mes bsreg pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can gyis zhes bya'o //
translated: “It is called ‘radiant’ because it burns up the tree of the afflictions that are not forgotten with the fire of pristine wisdom.”

original: de la mi brjed pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa rang gi ngang gis rgyun du 'byung ba'i phyir mi brjed pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de la mi brjed pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa rang gi ngang gis rgyun du 'byung ba'i phyir mi brjed pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: There, “not forgotten” means that the innate afflictions arise naturally and continuously, so they are called “not forgotten.”

original: bstan bcos mdo'i sde'i rgyan las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo'i sde'i rgyan las ni /
translated: The Abhidharma-sutra-alaṃkāra-śāstra says,

original: byang @264b chub kyi phyogs kyi shes rab gang yin pa de ni 'od kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: byang @264b chub kyi phyogs kyi shes rab gang yin pa de ni 'od kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: “The wisdom of the factors of awakening is the essence of light.”

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis ni shing gi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis ni shing gi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The two obscurations of affliction and the knowable are the nature of the tree.

original: sa 'di'i byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi 'od bskyed nas sgrib pa gnyis kyi shing sreg bar byed pas 'od 'phro ba can gyi sa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: sa 'di'i byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi 'od bskyed nas sgrib pa gnyis kyi shing sreg bar byed pas 'od 'phro ba can gyi sa zhes bshad de /
translated: Since the bodhisattva of this bhumi generates the light of wisdom and burns the tree of the two obscurations, it is explained as the bhumi of Radiating Light.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis sgrib pa thams cad bsreg pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis sgrib pa thams cad bsreg pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: In the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna, it says: “It is called Radiating Light because the phenomena of the aspects of enlightenment burn all obscurations.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni sa 'dir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos khyad par du 'phags pa gnas bas gnas 'di'i dbang gis rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bsregs nas thal bar brlags pas shes rab 'od 'phro ba can gyi sa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni sa 'dir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos khyad par du 'phags pa gnas bas gnas 'di'i dbang gis rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bsregs nas thal bar brlags pas shes rab 'od 'phro ba can gyi sa zhes bshad de /
translated: In the commentary composed by Ācārya Vasubandhu, it says: “Since the phenomena of the aspects of enlightenment are especially present on this bhumi, by the power of this bhumi, all the root afflictions and subsidiary afflictions are burned and reduced to ashes. Therefore it is called the bhumi of Radiating Light of Wisdom.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang don gyis de skad du ston to //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang don gyis de skad du ston to //
translated: And the master Asvabhāva’s commentary also teaches this by implication.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos khyad par du 'phags pa gnas pas nyon mongs pa'i shing bsregs nas shes rab kyi 'od 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos khyad par du 'phags pa gnas pas nyon mongs pa'i shing bsregs nas shes rab kyi 'od 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: And the treatise Establishing the Cognition Only also says that the stage is called “luminous” because it burns the tree of the afflictions with the special factors of enlightenment and increases the light of wisdom.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni 'od 'phel bar byed pa'i sa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni 'od 'phel bar byed pa'i sa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: And the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom says that the stage is called “increasing light.”

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan la sogs pa las sgrib pa gnyis kyi shing bsregs pas shes rab 'od 'phro ba can gyi sa zhes bshad pa dang / slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad thal bar brlags nas zhes bstan pa 'di ni shes bya'i sgrib pa gtan du spangs shing /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan la sogs pa las sgrib pa gnyis kyi shing bsregs pas shes rab 'od 'phro ba can gyi sa zhes bshad pa dang / slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad thal bar brlags nas zhes bstan pa 'di ni shes bya'i sgrib pa gtan du spangs shing /
translated: This is the complete abandonment of the obstructions to omniscience,

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon pa dang / spangs pa thal bar brlags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon pa dang / spangs pa thal bar brlags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and it is called the “overpowering of the afflictions” and “the reduction to ashes of the abandoned afflictions.”

original: gal te de lta ma yin pa ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin pa ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
translated: If it were not so, it would contradict the treatise Compendium of the Mahayana, which teaches:

original: ched du nyon mongs pa bzhag pa dang / nyon mongs pa zad pa la sogs pa zhes bstan pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: ched du nyon mongs pa bzhag pa dang / nyon mongs pa zad pa la sogs pa zhes bstan pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: “The deliberate placement of the afflictions and the exhaustion of the afflictions and so on.”

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag nyid thabs kyis bsgom pa la shin tu dka' bas gdod dbang thob pas de'i phyir lnga pa ni shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni lnga pa shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa bstan pa'o
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag nyid thabs kyis bsgom pa la shin tu dka' bas gdod dbang thob pas de'i phyir lnga pa ni shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni lnga pa shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa bstan pa'o
translated: Since one obtains power over those very factors that contribute to enlightenment through cultivating them with skillful means after a long time, it is called the Difficult to Conquer.🔽This is the explanation of the fifth spiritual level, the Difficult to Conquer.

original: // 'di ltar bsgom par dka' ba las dbang thob pa'i phyir shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba zhes bya'o //🔽mtshams @265a * //
analyzed: // 'di ltar bsgom par dka' ba las dbang thob pa'i phyir shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba zhes bya'o // mtshams @265a * //
translated: It is called the Difficult to Conquer because it is difficult to conquer in the sense that one obtains power over the difficult to cultivate.

original: rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Parinirvāṇa Sūtra states:

original: mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: This is in agreement with what is stated in this very sūtra.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thabs kyis bsgoms pa shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thabs kyis bsgoms pa shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Cultivating the factors that contribute to enlightenment with skillful means is called the Difficult to Conquer.🔽The Sūtra Requested by the King of Men explains:

original: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni shes rab mchog tu gyur pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni shes rab mchog tu gyur pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is called the Ground of Supreme Wisdom.

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: Therefore, it is said in the verse of that scripture:

original: shes rab mchog gis bden pa gsum po gsal bar rtogs //
analyzed: shes rab mchog gis bden pa gsum po gsal bar rtogs //
translated: By the highest wisdom, the three truths are clearly realized.

original: 'phrul dga' lha yi rgyal po zhing ni 'bum phrag brgya //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phrul dga' lha yi rgyal po zhing ni 'bum phrag brgya // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The king of the gods of the Nirmanarati heaven is a hundred thousand leagues.

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni bsgom pa'i thabs kyi shes rab mchog la dbang thob pas shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dag gis zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa'i phyir shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni bsgom pa'i thabs kyi shes rab mchog la dbang thob pas shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dag gis zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa'i phyir shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: In the noble Golden Light Sutra, it is said that the stage is called extremely difficult to conquer because it is extremely difficult to conquer by the highest wisdom that is the method of meditation, because one has attained mastery, and because the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing and cultivation cannot overpower it.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las ni sa 'di la gnas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang / shes rab dang ye shes dang sems kyis shin tu brtags pa dang / ldan pa'i phyir ches gsal zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sa 'og ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang theg pa gnyis kyi dge ba'i rtsa bas mi 'phrogs pas shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las ni sa 'di la gnas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang / shes rab dang ye shes dang sems kyis shin tu brtags pa dang / ldan pa'i phyir ches gsal zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sa 'og ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang theg pa gnyis kyi dge ba'i rtsa bas mi 'phrogs pas shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: The noble Dashabhumika Sutra says, Because it is endowed with the thorough investigation of all roots of virtue, of wisdom, intuition, and mind, this bhumi is very clear, very pure, and the roots of virtue of the lower bhumis and the roots of virtue of the two vehicles cannot steal it away, so it is called the bhumi that is very difficult to conquer.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i nang nas gnas pa bcu bstan pa dang / legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las kyang don gyis de skad du ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i nang nas gnas pa bcu bstan pa dang / legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las kyang don gyis de skad du ston to //
translated: The noble Buddhavatamsaka and the Sutra Teaching the Merits of Purely Practiced Morality also teach this by implication.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa las ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang / thabs mkhas pa thob pas shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba las rgyal ba'i phyir shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa las ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang / thabs mkhas pa thob pas shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba las rgyal ba'i phyir shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The commentary to the noble Dashabhumika Sutra explains, It is called the bhumi that is very difficult to conquer because it is the conquest of what is very difficult to conquer, through the attainment of supramundane intuition and skill in means.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni /
translated: The Levels of Yogic Deeds:

original: sa 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la rnam par nges pa'i shes pa'i mchog ston pas /
analyzed: sa 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la rnam par nges pa'i shes pa'i mchog ston pas /
translated: Because this level is the one on which bodhisattvas teach the highest knowledge of the noble truths,

original: shin tu rgyal bar dka' bas shin tu sbyang dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: shin tu rgyal bar dka' bas shin tu sbyang dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: it is called the difficult-to-conquer level because it is so difficult to conquer.🔽The Ornament of Mahayana Sutras:

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni sa lnga pa ni dka' ba rnam pa gnyis yin te sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la brtson pa ni nyon mongs pa med par dka' ba dang / rang gi sems kyang srung zhing nyon mongs pa med par dka' ba @265b ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni sa lnga pa ni dka' ba rnam pa gnyis yin te sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la brtson pa ni nyon mongs pa med par dka' ba dang / rang gi sems kyang srung zhing nyon mongs pa med par dka' ba @265b ste /
translated: The fifth level is difficult in two ways: it is difficult to be without defilements while working hard to help sentient beings, and it is difficult to protect one's mind and be without defilements.

original: sa 'di'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dka' ba rnam pa gnyis las yang dag par 'das shing shin tu dka' ba las rgyal bar gyur bas shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa 'di'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dka' ba rnam pa gnyis las yang dag par 'das shing shin tu dka' ba las rgyal bar gyur bas shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because the bodhisattvas on this level have gone beyond these two difficulties and have conquered what is very difficult to conquer, it is called the difficult-to-conquer level.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni yang dag pa'i bden pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i shes pa gnyis phan tshun mi mthun pas de bsgrub par dka' ba'i phyir shin tu sbyang dka' zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni yang dag pa'i bden pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i shes pa gnyis phan tshun mi mthun pas de bsgrub par dka' ba'i phyir shin tu sbyang dka' zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because the two, correct and mundane consciousnesses, are mutually incompatible, it is difficult to establish them, and therefore it is called very difficult to train.🔽And Master Vasubandhu and Asvabhāva’s commentaries also teach that meaning.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang don de skad du ston to //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang don de skad du ston to //
translated: The Treatise on Exegesis states:

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes bya mdo sde rnams dang / shes rab dam pa'i phung po shin tu bsgrub par dka' ba 'khor ba dang / zhi ba la mi gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i lam thob pa gang yin pa de ni shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes bya mdo sde rnams dang / shes rab dam pa'i phung po shin tu bsgrub par dka' ba 'khor ba dang / zhi ba la mi gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i lam thob pa gang yin pa de ni shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: That which is called very difficult to train is the attainment of the ārya path that does not abide in either saṃsāra or peace, the wisdom that observes the very pure truths, the sūtras that are objects of knowledge, and the very difficult to attain aggregate of supreme wisdom.

original: gnas pa bcu'i 'grel pa las ni sa lnga pa la yon tan gyi stobs brtas bas bdud thams cad kyis 'jigs par mi nus pa'i phyir shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gnas pa bcu'i 'grel pa las ni sa lnga pa la yon tan gyi stobs brtas bas bdud thams cad kyis 'jigs par mi nus pa'i phyir shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Because the power of the qualities increases on the fifth ground, all māras are unable to frighten him, so it is called the ground difficult to conquer.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig ba tsam du grub pa las ni don thams cad bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig ba tsam du grub pa las ni don thams cad bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The treatise Establishing the Existence of Mind-Only explains all the topics in accordance with the teachings of the Mahāyāna treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa la so sor rtog pa mngon sum du gyur pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa lan mang du byed pa mngon du gyur pas de'i phyir drug pa ni mngon du gyur pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni drug pa mngon du gyur ba'i sa rnam par bshad ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa la so sor rtog pa mngon sum du gyur pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa lan mang du byed pa mngon du gyur pas de'i phyir drug pa ni mngon du gyur pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni drug pa mngon du gyur ba'i sa rnam par bshad ba'o //
translated: The sixth is called the ground of manifestation because the direct perception that individually discerns the engagement of formations and the frequent manifestation of the absence of signs have been actualized.

original: 'di ltar sa 'di la 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa la so sor rtog pa mngon sum du gyur pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa lan mang du yid la byed pa'i don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir mngon sum du gyur pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa 'di la 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa la so sor rtog pa mngon sum du gyur pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa lan mang du yid la byed pa'i don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir mngon sum du gyur pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, this stage is called the stage of direct realization because it has two aspects: the direct realization of the engagement of the formative forces and the frequent attention to the signless.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning also says:

original: mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: This is in accord with what is said in this very sūtra.

original: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni chos mngon du gyur ba zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni chos mngon du gyur ba zhes bshad de /
translated: The Sūtra Requested by the King of Humans explains it as the stage of manifest dharma:

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /🔽chos mngon gyur pa'i skyes bu de dag mi dbang rgyal po zhing ni 'bum phrag snang //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las / chos mngon gyur pa'i skyes bu de dag mi dbang rgyal po zhing ni 'bum phrag snang //
translated: Therefore, in a verse from that text it says:

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Those who have attained manifest dharma are seen as kings of humans in a hundred thousand realms.

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun bar 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sūtra of Golden Light is in accord with what is said in this very sūtra.

original: @266a * // 'phags pas bcu'i mdo las ni sgrib ba med pa'i ye shes kyi sgo mngon sum du gyur pa thob pas shes rab kyi snang ba mngon du gyur pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: @266a * // 'phags pas bcu'i mdo las ni sgrib ba med pa'i ye shes kyi sgo mngon sum du gyur pa thob pas shes rab kyi snang ba mngon du gyur pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: The light of wisdom becomes manifest through attaining the direct realization of the door of unobscured transcendent wisdom.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i nang nas gnas pa bcu bstan pa dang / legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las kyang don gyis 'phags pas bcu'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i nang nas gnas pa bcu bstan pa dang / legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las kyang don gyis 'phags pas bcu'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par ston to //
translated: The Ten Levels Sūtra and the Sūtra Teaching the Ten Qualities of a Superior Person and the Sūtra Teaching Good Expanses are similar in meaning.🔽The Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras teaches:

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas par bsgom pa'i shes rab mngon sum du gyur pas mngon du gyur pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas par bsgom pa'i shes rab mngon sum du gyur pas mngon du gyur pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The level of manifest is so called because the wisdom that meditates without abiding in cyclic existence or nirvana becomes manifest.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i shes pa'i gnas yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //🔽slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i shes pa'i gnas yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do // slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The commentary to the Compendium of the Mahāyāna says, “Because it is the basis of the wisdom that is the knowledge of dependent origination, the perfection of wisdom is actualized.”

original: sa 'di la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i shes pa la gnas pas shes pa 'di'i stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog la gnas pa mngon du gyur nas chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: sa 'di la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i shes pa la gnas pas shes pa 'di'i stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog la gnas pa mngon du gyur nas chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: The commentary composed by the master Vasubandhu says, “In this way, by abiding in the knowledge of dependent origination, through the power of this knowledge, the perfection of wisdom is actualized without conceptualization.

original: rnam par byang ba med pa nyid du rtog pas sa bdun pa la ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa nyid du rtog pas sa bdun pa la ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: Having actualized the supreme perfection of wisdom, by understanding that all phenomena are free from affliction and purification, on the seventh ground, the bodhisattva becomes one who engages in effort.

original: sa brgyad pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: On the eighth ground, he becomes one who engages in effortless activity.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang don gyis de skad du ston to //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang don gyis de skad du ston to //
translated: And the master Asvabhāva’s commentary also teaches this point by implication.🔽And the Daśabhūmivyākhyāna explains:

original: gnas pa bcu'i 'grel pa las ni bdun gyi dngos po rnams dka' nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi chos mngon du gyur pas so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gnas pa bcu'i 'grel pa las ni bdun gyi dngos po rnams dka' nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi chos mngon du gyur pas so zhes bshad do //
translated: “The seven things are difficult to understand, and the bodhisattvas have the Abhidharma as their path.”

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las kyang theg pa chen po bsdus pa las bstan pa dang mthun bar byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las kyang theg pa chen po bsdus pa las bstan pa dang mthun bar byung ngo //
translated: And the treatise Vijñaptimātratāsiddhi is in accord with the teaching in the Mahāyāna Compendium.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni mngon du gyur pa'i sa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni mngon du gyur pa'i sa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: And the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom says, “The manifest stage.”

original: mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa bar chad med cing rgyun mi 'chad par ring du rjes su zhugs shing rnam par dag pa'i sa dang rjes su 'brel pas de'i phyir bdun pa ni ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdun pa ring
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa bar chad med cing rgyun mi 'chad par ring du rjes su zhugs shing rnam par dag pa'i sa dang rjes su 'brel pas de'i phyir bdun pa ni ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdun pa ring
translated: The seventh is called the Gone Afar stage because it is connected with the stage of pure, uninterrupted, and continuous signless attention that has long been engaged.

original: du song ba'i sa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: du song ba'i sa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the stage of Gone Afar.

original: 'di ltar sa 'di la bar chad med cing rgyun chad pa med par mtshan ma med pa'i rjes su zhugs pas na sa @266b drug pa ltar re zhig tsam du mngon du gyur pa ma yin pa dang / gzhan yang brgyad pa rnam par dag pa'i sa dang nye bar gyur pas don rnam pa gnyis po 'di dang ldan pa'i phyir ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa 'di la bar chad med cing rgyun chad pa med par mtshan ma med pa'i rjes su zhugs pas na sa @266b drug pa ltar re zhig tsam du mngon du gyur pa ma yin pa dang / gzhan yang brgyad pa rnam par dag pa'i sa dang nye bar gyur pas don rnam pa gnyis po 'di dang ldan pa'i phyir ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because this stage is without interruption and without break, and because it is engaged in signlessness, it is not manifest, like the sixth stage. Moreover, it is called the stage of Gone Afar because it is close to the eighth stage, the stage of Direct Presence, and because it possesses these two meanings.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang don gyis mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun par ston to //
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang don gyis mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun par ston to //
translated: The Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning and the Sūtra Unravelling the Profound Meaning also teach this in a way that accords with the meaning of this sūtra.

original: mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni ring du rtog pa'i sa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni ring du rtog pa'i sa zhes bshad de /
translated: The Sūtra Requested by the King of the Logicians explains it as the stage of Thorough Investigation.

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: Therefore, the same text says of it:

original: ring du rtog pa mi skye bsam gtan dang po'i rgyal //
analyzed: ring du rtog pa mi skye bsam gtan dang po'i rgyal //
translated: The king of the first concentration, the nonarising of thorough investigation.

original: rtag par zhing ni 'bum phrag du mar sems can sgrol //🔽zhes gsungs so //🔽'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni zag pa med cing par chad med par mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pas rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ring du bsgom pa'i phyir sa de rnam par dag cing sgrib pa med pa dang /
analyzed: rtag par zhing ni 'bum phrag du mar sems can sgrol // zhes gsungs so // 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni zag pa med cing par chad med par mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pas rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ring du bsgom pa'i phyir sa de rnam par dag cing sgrib pa med pa dang /
translated: And always liberates sentient beings in many hundreds of thousands of realms.🔽The noble Golden Light Sūtra says,

original: thogs pa med pas ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thogs pa med pas ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Because of cultivating for a long time the liberations and meditative stabilizations with a signless mental orientation that is free from contamination and free from obstruction, that ground is called the ground Gone Far because it is purified, free from obscurations, and unobstructed.”🔽The noble Sūtra on the Ten Grounds says,

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las zab cing dben la rgyu ba med pa dang ldan pa yang rab tu thob pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las zab cing dben la rgyu ba med pa dang ldan pa yang rab tu thob pa yin te /
translated: “They attain the profound, isolated, and unmoving activity of the actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: khyad par gong du btsal ba'i brtson 'grus kyang yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: khyad par gong du btsal ba'i brtson 'grus kyang yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: And they do not give up the effort to seek the special qualities.”

original: gzhan yang de bas kyang sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir chos kyi bzod pa rnam par dag par 'gyur bas ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bas kyang sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir chos kyi bzod pa rnam par dag par 'gyur bas ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, in order to benefit sentient beings even more, since the patience of the dharma becomes pure, it is called the ground Gone Far Beyond.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo'i nang nas gnas ba bcu bstan pa dang / legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las kyang don gyis 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo'i nang nas gnas ba bcu bstan pa dang / legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las kyang don gyis 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par ston to //
translated: In the noble Buddhavatamsaka Sutra, the ten grounds are taught, and in the Sutra Teaching the Merits of Pure Discipline, the ten grounds are also taught in a way that accords with the noble Dashabhumika Sutra.🔽In the commentary to the noble Dashabhumika Sutra, it is said:

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa las ni mtshan ma med pa'i bar bsgoms pa'i rtsol ba mthar phyin pas 'jig rten pa dang / theg pa pa gnyis kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa las ni mtshan ma med pa'i bar bsgoms pa'i rtsol ba mthar phyin pas 'jig rten pa dang / theg pa pa gnyis kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Since the effort of cultivating up to the signless has been perfected, it is called the ground Gone Far Beyond because it has completely transcended both mundane and transcendent paths of the two vehicles.

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni byang chub sems dpa' ni sa bdun pa la theg pa gcig gi lam dang nye bar gyur pas ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni byang chub sems dpa' ni sa bdun pa la theg pa gcig gi lam dang nye bar gyur pas ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Because bodhisattvas on the seventh level have approached the path of the One Vehicle, it is called the Gone Afar level.

original: ring du song ba su yin zhe na /
analyzed: ring du song ba su yin zhe na /
translated: Who is it that has gone afar?

original: smras pa / rtsol ba'i sbyor ba mthar phyin pas des ring du 'gro @267a * //
analyzed: smras pa / rtsol ba'i sbyor ba mthar phyin pas des ring du 'gro @267a * //
translated: It is said: Because they have perfected the application of effort, they have gone afar.

original: bas na ring du 'gro ba de'i phyir ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bas na ring du 'gro ba de'i phyir ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they have gone afar, they are called Gone Afar.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The treatise Compendium of the Mahayana says, “Because it is the culmination of the conduct that arises from application.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni 'di ltar sa 'di la sbyor ba'i spyod pa'i mthar phyin cing mtshan ma thams cad dang bral bas mi g-yo ba yin yang mtshan ma med pa la da dung rtsol ba dang bcas pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni 'di ltar sa 'di la sbyor ba'i spyod pa'i mthar phyin cing mtshan ma thams cad dang bral bas mi g-yo ba yin yang mtshan ma med pa la da dung rtsol ba dang bcas pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu, it says: “Because on this level they have perfected the conduct that arises from application and are free from all signs, they are immovable. However, they are still said to be making effort at signlessness.”

original: de / slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang don gyis de skad du ston to //
analyzed: de / slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang don gyis de skad du ston to //
translated: And the master Niḥsvabhāva­śānti teaches this in his commentary.

original: gnas ba bcu'i 'grel pa las ni khams gsum pa las thag ring por gyur cing chos kyi rgyal po'i gnas dang nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ring du song ba'i sa zhes bshad do //🔽bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni mtshan ma med pa'i gnas pa mthar phyin cing /
analyzed: gnas ba bcu'i 'grel pa las ni khams gsum pa las thag ring por gyur cing chos kyi rgyal po'i gnas dang nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ring du song ba'i sa zhes bshad do // bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni mtshan ma med pa'i gnas pa mthar phyin cing /
translated: In the Daśabhūmika-vyākhyā, it is explained that the ground is called Gone Afar because it is far from the three realms and is close to the abode of the king of Dharma.🔽In the treatise Establishing Cognition Only, it is said that the ground is called Gone Afar because it is the culmination of the state of signlessness

original: sbyor ba'i mthar phyin pa yin pas 'jig rten pa dang theg pa ba gnyis kyi lam las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ring du song ba'i sa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mthar phyin pa yin pas 'jig rten pa dang theg pa ba gnyis kyi lam las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ring du song ba'i sa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and the culmination of application, and it is far from the paths of both mundane beings and the vehicle of the hearers.

original: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba med pa thob pas mtshan ma rnams las kun du byung ba'i nyon mongs pas mi bskyod pas de'i phyir brgyad pa ni mi g-yo ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa mi g-yo ba'i sa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba med pa thob pas mtshan ma rnams las kun du byung ba'i nyon mongs pas mi bskyod pas de'i phyir brgyad pa ni mi g-yo ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa mi g-yo ba'i sa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: Since he has attained the effortless state in signlessness, he is unshaken by the addictions that arise from signs. Therefore, the eighth stage is called the Immovable.

original: 'di ltar sa 'di la rtsol ba'i nyon mongs pa dag gis mi bskyod pas na mi g-yo ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa 'di la rtsol ba'i nyon mongs pa dag gis mi bskyod pas na mi g-yo ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, this stage is called the Immovable because it is unshaken by the addictions of effort.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: In the commentary on the Compendium of the Mahayana, the Bodhisattva Stages, it says:

original: mdo'i tshig 'di la don rnam pa gsum gyis ston te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di la don rnam pa gsum gyis ston te /
translated: In this verse of the sutra, the meaning is taught in three ways.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa 'di nyid las mtshan ma dang / nyon mongs pa dang / rtsol ba dag gis mi g-yo ba'i phyir te /🔽'di ltar sa 'di yul rnam pa gnyis yod pas dang po ni de kho na'i yul te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa 'di nyid las mtshan ma dang / nyon mongs pa dang / rtsol ba dag gis mi g-yo ba'i phyir te / 'di ltar sa 'di yul rnam pa gnyis yod pas dang po ni de kho na'i yul te /
translated: Therefore, in this very commentary, it says: Because it is unshaken by signs, addictions, and effort.

original: mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, this stage has two kinds of objects. The first is the object of reality, called signlessness.

original: byang chub sems dpas yul de la gnas shing mtshan ma rtsol ba thams cad kyis mi bskyod pas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas yul de la gnas shing mtshan ma rtsol ba thams cad kyis mi bskyod pas so //
translated: The bodhisattva, dwelling in that object, is unshaken by all efforts at signs.

original: gnyis pa ni kun rdzob kyi yul te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni kun rdzob kyi yul te /
translated: The second is the object of the conventional.

original: de ni mtshan ma thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: That is called all signs.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yul de la gnas kyang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yul de la gnas kyang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi bskyod pa'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva, dwelling in that object, is unshaken by all afflictions.

original: mi g-yo ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is called the unshakable stage.

original: mtshan ma rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning also explains this in a way that accords with this sūtra.

original: @267b mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni mnyam pa nyid du bsgom zhes bshad de /
analyzed: @267b mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni mnyam pa nyid du bsgom zhes bshad de /
translated: The Sūtra Requested by a King also explains it as meditation on sameness.

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: Therefore, the same text says in a verse:

original: mnyam bsgom byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gnyis pa'i rgyal //🔽gang g'a'i zhing la 'jug cing sems can thams cad sgrol //
analyzed: mnyam bsgom byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gnyis pa'i rgyal // gang g'a'i zhing la 'jug cing sems can thams cad sgrol //
translated: The bodhisattva who meditates on sameness is the victor of the second concentration.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: He enters the field of the Ganges and liberates all sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa la dbang thob pas nyon mongs pa rnams kyi kun du spyod pas mi bskyod pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa bsgom pa la dbang thob pas nyon mongs pa rnams kyi kun du spyod pas mi bskyod pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “The stage of unshakable is so called because one has attained mastery in the cultivation of attention to signlessness and is unshaken by the occurrence of the afflictions.”

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni 'phags pas bcu'i mdo dang / sangs rgyas phal po che la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni 'phags pas bcu'i mdo dang / sangs rgyas phal po che la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive differentiation should be understood according to the teachings in the sutra of the Ten Stages, the Flower Ornament Sutra, and so on.🔽The commentary to the sutra of the Ten Stages says,

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo'i 'grel pa las ni rnam par smin pa'i mdo spyod pa yongs su byang zhing mtshan ma med pa la bar chad med pas mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo'i 'grel pa las ni rnam par smin pa'i mdo spyod pa yongs su byang zhing mtshan ma med pa la bar chad med pas mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: “The stage of unshakable is so called because the conduct of the maturation stage is purified and one is unshaken by the signless and uninterrupted.”

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni sa brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rtsol ba'i 'du shes gnyi gas mi bskyod pas de'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni sa brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rtsol ba'i 'du shes gnyi gas mi bskyod pas de'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because the eighth level is unshaken by either the perception of attributes or the perception of effort that is the absence of attributes, it is called the Immovable.🔽The treatise Compendium of the Mahayana states:

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni mtshan ma dang rtsol ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyis mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni mtshan ma dang rtsol ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyis mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because it is unshaken by any attributes or the effort that is the absence of attributes.🔽In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu, it is explained:

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad ba'i 'grel ba las ni sa 'dir mtshan ma ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyis mi g-yos shing rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rang gi dang gis 'jug pas so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad ba'i 'grel ba las ni sa 'dir mtshan ma ji snyed yod pa rnams dang / mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyis mi g-yos shing rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rang gi dang gis 'jug pas so zhes bshad do //
translated: “On this level, one is unshaken by any attributes or any effort and nonconceptual wisdom occurs naturally.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni 'di ltar mtshan ma thams cad dang mngon bar 'du byed pa thams cad kyis de'i sems g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir dang / sa bdun pa la mtshan ma thams cad kyis mi g-yo zhing kun du mi 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni 'di ltar mtshan ma thams cad dang mngon bar 'du byed pa thams cad kyis de'i sems g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir dang / sa bdun pa la mtshan ma thams cad kyis mi g-yo zhing kun du mi 'byung mod kyi /
translated: and although on the eighth ground the mind is not moved by any signs and does not manifest,🔽nevertheless, because it has not attained mastery over effortless engagement, it is still associated with application.

original: 'on kyang rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa la dbang ma thob cing sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / sa brgyad pa la ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug cing sbyor ba'i rtsol ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa la dbang ma thob cing sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / sa brgyad pa la ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug cing sbyor ba'i rtsol ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because on the eighth ground the mind engages effortlessly without the exertion of application,

original: 'di ni sa bdun pa dang brgyad pa'i bye brag go zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni sa bdun pa dang brgyad pa'i bye brag go zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: this is the distinction between the seventh and eighth grounds.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni rnam grangs gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni rnam grangs gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: The commentary on the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna, translated by the one called Vṛddhi, teaches this by means of two enumerations.

original: dang po ni mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: dang po ni mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun no //
translated: The first is in accordance with what is taught in this sūtra.

original: @268a * // gnyis pa ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa las bstan pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: @268a * // gnyis pa ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa las bstan pa dang mthun no //
translated: The second is taught in the commentary on the Compendium of the Mahayana composed by the master Nāgārjuna.🔽The commentary on the Ten Stages says:

original: gnas pa bcu'i 'grel pa las ni lha dang bdud dang tshangs ba dang dge sbyong dang / bram ze gang gis kyang de'i yi dam las bskyod par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas pa bcu'i 'grel pa las ni lha dang bdud dang tshangs ba dang dge sbyong dang / bram ze gang gis kyang de'i yi dam las bskyod par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because no god, demon, Brahmā, ascetic, or priest can shake his resolve,

original: mi g-yo ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it is called the stage of immovability.🔽The treatise Establishing Representation Only says:

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rang gi dang gis rgyun mi 'chad cing mtshan ma'i rtsol ba'i nyon mongs pas mi bskyod pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rang gi dang gis rgyun mi 'chad cing mtshan ma'i rtsol ba'i nyon mongs pas mi bskyod pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because nonconceptual exalted wisdom is uninterrupted by itself and is unshaken by the afflictions of exertion for signs,🔽it is called the stage of immovability.

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros shin tu yangs shing rgya che ba thob pas de'i phyir dgu ba ni legs pa'i blo gros kyi sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros shin tu yangs shing rgya che ba thob pas de'i phyir dgu ba ni legs pa'i blo gros kyi sa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros
translated: Because he has attained the extremely virtuous, vast, and extensive intelligence that is unhindered in teaching the Dharma in all its aspects, therefore the ninth is called the Ground of Excellent Intelligence.

original: kyis rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: kyis rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the ninth ground, Excellent Intelligence.

original: kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni nyes pa dang thogs pa dang rmongs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni nyes pa dang thogs pa dang rmongs pa la bya'o //
translated: The term unhindered means faultless, unobstructed, and unconfused.

original: 'di ltar sa 'di la rnam pa thams cad du chos sna tshogs ston pa la dbang thob pas thogs pa med cing yangs shing rgya che ba'i blo gros thob pa de yang shin tu dge ba'i phyir legs ba'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa 'di la rnam pa thams cad du chos sna tshogs ston pa la dbang thob pas thogs pa med cing yangs shing rgya che ba'i blo gros thob pa de yang shin tu dge ba'i phyir legs ba'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because he has attained the unhindered, vast, and extensive intelligence that is able to teach the various aspects of the Dharma in all its aspects on this ground, and because that intelligence is extremely virtuous, it is called Excellent Intelligence.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: In the Sutra Unraveling the Intention and the Sutra Unraveling the Profound Meaning,

original: mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun bar 'byung ngo //
translated: it appears in accordance with what is taught in this sutra.

original: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal bos zhus pa'i mdo las ni shes rab snang ba dang bcas bzhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal bos zhus pa'i mdo las ni shes rab snang ba dang bcas bzhes bshad de /
translated: The Sutra Requested by the Noble King of Men explains that it is the light of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: Therefore, a verse from that sutra says:

original: shes rab snang byed skyes bu bsam gtan gsum pa'i rgyal //
analyzed: shes rab snang byed skyes bu bsam gtan gsum pa'i rgyal //
translated: The light of wisdom is the king of the third concentration,

original: gang dag stong phrag zhing rnams su ni cig car snang //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang dag stong phrag zhing rnams su ni cig car snang // zhes gsungs so //
translated: who appears simultaneously in thousands of fields.

original: 'phags ba gser 'od dam ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: 'phags ba gser 'od dam ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra of Golden Light explains:

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi phung bo gsum rab tu shes shing ye shes de'i rjes su 'brang bas legs pa'i blo gros zhes bshad de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi phung bo gsum rab tu shes shing ye shes de'i rjes su 'brang bas legs pa'i blo gros zhes bshad de /
translated: One who perfectly knows the three types of aggregates of sentient beings and follows that wisdom is called Sadaprarudita, “always weeping.”

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: The Sutra of the Buddha’s Extensive Praise also teaches this.🔽The commentary on the Sutra of the Ten Noble Dharmas explains:
