original: 'phags pas bcu'i 'grel ba las ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i stobs kyis chos bstan pa yongs su grub nas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pas bcu'i 'grel ba las ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i stobs kyis chos bstan pa yongs su grub nas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Having perfected the teaching of the dharma through the power of analytical discrimination, one benefits others.

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni sa dgu pa la ni so so @268b yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i shes rab khyad par du 'phags pas skad cig ma gcig la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na lha dang mi la sogs pa rnam
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni sa dgu pa la ni so so @268b yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i shes rab khyad par du 'phags pas skad cig ma gcig la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na lha dang mi la sogs pa rnam
translated: The treatise Ornament of Mahayana Sutras explains:🔽On the ninth level, the wisdom of the four correct and discerning awarenesses is especially exalted, so in a single instant a bodhisattva can answer many questions simultaneously,

original: pa tha dad bas skad cig tha dad pa dag gis don tha dad pa dag byang chub sems dpa' de la dris pas na sgra skad gcig gis dris pa mang po la lan cig car 'debs shing mang po'i the tshom rnams gcod pas des na legs pa'i blo
analyzed: pa tha dad bas skad cig tha dad pa dag gis don tha dad pa dag byang chub sems dpa' de la dris pas na sgra skad gcig gis dris pa mang po la lan cig car 'debs shing mang po'i the tshom rnams gcod pas des na legs pa'i blo
translated: cutting through the doubts of many beings.

original: gros kyis zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gros kyis zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The treatise Summary of the Great Vehicle explains:

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because they attain the especially exalted wisdom of the four correct and discerning awarenesses.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las ni sa 'di'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la blo gros zhes bya ste /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las ni sa 'di'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la blo gros zhes bya ste /
translated: The cognition of the analytical knowledges on this ground is called “intelligence.”

original: blo gros shin tu dge ba'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: blo gros shin tu dge ba'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because that intelligence is extremely virtuous, it is called “Excellent Intelligence.”🔽The commentary composed by Master *Svābhāvika states:

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni 'di ltar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa thob pas so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi nang nas mchog tu gyur cing /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni 'di ltar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa thob pas so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi nang nas mchog tu gyur cing /
translated: Because one attains the superior cognition of the four analytical knowledges, one becomes supreme among those who possess the analytical knowledges.

original: shes pa nyid blo gros yin pa'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa nyid blo gros yin pa'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
translated: Because cognition itself is intelligence, it is called “Excellent Intelligence.”

original: de la so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four analytical knowledges are the analytical knowledge of phenomena and so on.

original: de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa la dbang thob pas ni ming dang tshig thams cad khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa la dbang thob pas ni ming dang tshig thams cad khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: By attaining mastery in the analytical knowledge of phenomena, one comprehends all names and phrases.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa la dbang thob pas ni /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa la dbang thob pas ni /
translated: Through mastery of the analytical knowledge of meaning,

original: don thams cad kyi tshul rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don thams cad kyi tshul rab tu rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: one realizes the mode of all meanings.🔽Through mastery of the analytical knowledge of language,

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa la dbang thob pas ni sgra skad thams cad rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa la dbang thob pas ni sgra skad thams cad rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: one becomes skilled in discerning all sounds and languages.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pas ni phyogs bcu thams cad du dbang thob pa'i spobs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pas ni phyogs bcu thams cad du dbang thob pa'i spobs pas ston par byed do //
translated: Through the analytical knowledge of clear expression, one teaches with the clear expression of mastery in all the ten directions.

original: sa 'di la sngon ma thob pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa thog mar thob pa'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa 'di la sngon ma thob pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa thog mar thob pa'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This ground is called Perfect Understanding because one first attains the analytical knowledge that one did not previously have.

original: 'phags pa gnas bcu'i 'grel ba las ni shes rab de gong nas gong du cher gsal zhing shin tu dul ba nyid du gyur pas legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa gnas bcu'i 'grel ba las ni shes rab de gong nas gong du cher gsal zhing shin tu dul ba nyid du gyur pas legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The commentary on the Ten Grounds says that it is called Perfect Understanding because that wisdom becomes brighter and brighter and is completely disciplined.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las shin tu gya nom pa'i so @269a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las shin tu gya nom pa'i so @269a * //
translated: This concludes the section on the establishment of cognition only from the Treatise on Cognition Only.

original: so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su grub pas phyogs bcu kun du legs par chos ston pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su grub pas phyogs bcu kun du legs par chos ston pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only, it says, “Because of the accomplishment of the four extremely subtle right discriminations, he teaches the Dharma well in all the ten directions.”

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i shes pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i shes pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom, it says, “Knowledge skilled in the characteristics.”

original: gnas ngan len gyi lus nam mkha' lta bu la chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa sprin chen po lta bus khyab cing khebs pas de'i phyir bcu pa ni chos kyi sprin gyis zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcu pa chos kyi sprin rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi lus nam mkha' lta bu la chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa sprin chen po lta bus khyab cing khebs pas de'i phyir bcu pa ni chos kyi sprin gyis zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcu pa chos kyi sprin rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: “Because the body of negative tendencies, like space, is covered and pervaded by the great cloud of the complete perfection of the body of truth, the tenth is called Cloud of Dharma.”

original: 'di ltar bdag dang chos su 'dzin pas yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni las su mi rung ba'i phyir gnas ngan len zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag dang chos su 'dzin pas yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni las su mi rung ba'i phyir gnas ngan len zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the seed that is completely soaked with the apprehension of self and phenomena is called “negative tendencies” because it is unserviceable.

original: stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis dang / bdag med pa'i don la sgrib pa'i phyir mdo las nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis dang / bdag med pa'i don la sgrib pa'i phyir mdo las nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it obscures the two kinds of emptiness and the meaning of selflessness, the scripture says that it is like space.

original: sa bcu po de la chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu'i chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa ni sprin chen po dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: sa bcu po de la chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu'i chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa ni sprin chen po dang mtshungs te /
translated: The ten stages are like a great cloud, because the Dharma Body is perfected in ten aspects in the realm of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi dbyings mngon du gyur pa ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i chos kyi sku gnas ngan len nam mkha' lta bu la khebs pa'i phyir chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mngon du gyur pa ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i chos kyi sku gnas ngan len nam mkha' lta bu la khebs pa'i phyir chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma Body is perfected in the realization of the realm of the Dharma, and the Dharma Body that arises from meditation is like a cloud that covers the space-like depravity.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni nam mkha' lta bu'i nyes pa dag la ni sprin chen po lta bu'i chos kyi skus kun du khyab pas zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni nam mkha' lta bu'i nyes pa dag la ni sprin chen po lta bu'i chos kyi skus kun du khyab pas zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says, “The Dharma Body pervades like a great cloud the space-like faults.”

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni sems can nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa las byung ba'i lus gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs la /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni sems can nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa las byung ba'i lus gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs la /
translated: Any body that arises from the faults of sentient beings’ afflictions is like space.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku ni sprin chen po ltar sems can gyi khams la khyab cing chos ston par snang ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku ni sprin chen po ltar sems can gyi khams la khyab cing chos ston par snang ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata’s Dharma body pervades the realm of sentient beings like a great cloud and appears to teach the Dharma.

original: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni dbang bskur ba'i sa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa mi'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las ni dbang bskur ba'i sa zhes bshad do //
translated: The Questions of King Māndhātṛ Sūtra explains this as the “level of consecration.”

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: Therefore, the same text says in verse:

original: dbang bskur byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rgyal //
analyzed: dbang bskur byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rgyal //
translated: The bodhisattva who is consecrated is the king of the fourth concentration.

original: zhing ni gang g'a'i 'bum phrag dag du sems can mang po sgrol //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhing ni gang g'a'i 'bum phrag dag du sems can mang po sgrol //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He liberates many sentient beings in a billion Ganges-like buddhafields.

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni chos kyi sku nam mkha' lta bu dang / shes rab sprin chen po lta bus thams cad kun la khebs shing khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las ni chos kyi sku nam mkha' lta bu dang / shes rab sprin chen po lta bus thams cad kun la khebs shing khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The dharmakāya is like space, and wisdom is like a great cloud, because it covers and pervades everything.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang @269b las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang @269b las /
translated: The master’s notes on the true meaning of the Ornament of the Middle Way says:

original: nam mkha' lta bu zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rnam pa gsum gyi dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rnam pa gsum gyi dper bstan pa'o //
translated: “Like space” illustrates the three aspects of suchness.

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' yang don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' yang don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
translated: Space has three meanings.

original: dang po kun rdzob gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyi chos kyi sku'i dper bstan te /
analyzed: dang po kun rdzob gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyi chos kyi sku'i dper bstan te /
translated: The first is the example of the essence of the dharmakāya,

original: 'khor ba mi sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba mi sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not obscured by saṃsāra.

original: gnyis pa mtha' med pa ni rab tu gsal ba'i chos kyi sku'i dper bstan te /
analyzed: gnyis pa mtha' med pa ni rab tu gsal ba'i chos kyi sku'i dper bstan te /
translated: The second is the example of the very clear dharmakāya,

original: rab tu gsal bar gyur mod kyi 'on kyang mthar phyin pa ma yin pas nam mkha' ltar yongs su dag pa'i gnas kyang yod /
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar gyur mod kyi 'on kyang mthar phyin pa ma yin pas nam mkha' ltar yongs su dag pa'i gnas kyang yod /
translated: because it is very clear, but since it is not ultimate, there is a completely pure state that is like space.

original: rdul dang khug rnal sogs pa dang bcas pa'i gnas kyang yod de /
analyzed: rdul dang khug rnal sogs pa dang bcas pa'i gnas kyang yod de /
translated: There is also a place that is accompanied by dust, mist, and so on,

original: dper na lam la yod pa'i chos kyi sku lta bu'am /
analyzed: dper na lam la yod pa'i chos kyi sku lta bu'am /
translated: for example, the Dharma Body that exists on the path,

original: yang na dbu ma'i lam shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang na dbu ma'i lam shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: or, again, the knowledge of the middle path.

original: gsum pa ni yongs su dag cing rdul dang khug rna med pa ni 'phags pa'i 'bras bu chos kyi sku'i ye shes kyi dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni yongs su dag cing rdul dang khug rna med pa ni 'phags pa'i 'bras bu chos kyi sku'i ye shes kyi dper bstan pa'o //
translated: The third is the completely pure, dust-free, mist-free, which is taught as an example of the Dharma Body of the fruit of the noble one's wisdom.

original: de la sprin chen po lta bu zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dang ye shes kyi dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la sprin chen po lta bu zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dang ye shes kyi dper bstan pa'o //
translated: Among them, like a great cloud is taught as an example of suchness and wisdom.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum te /
translated: This also has three aspects:

original: lam gyi mdun rol du ngo bo nyid kyis thob pa dang / lam du zhugs te bsgoms nas thob pa dang / lam gyi 'og tu mthar phyin pa'i gnas thob pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi mdun rol du ngo bo nyid kyis thob pa dang / lam du zhugs te bsgoms nas thob pa dang / lam gyi 'og tu mthar phyin pa'i gnas thob pa'o //
translated: the attainment by nature in front of the path, the attainment by cultivating the path, and the attainment of the stage of perfection after the path.

original: kun la zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis thob pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / ye shes de bzhin nyid kyi don kun la khyab bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun la zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis thob pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / ye shes de bzhin nyid kyi don kun la khyab bar gyur pa'o //
translated: As for in all, the suchness and wisdom attained by nature pervade the meaning of suchness in all.

original: khebs shing zhes bya ba ni bsgoms nas thob pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: khebs shing zhes bya ba ni bsgoms nas thob pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: “Covered” is the suchness attained through cultivation.

original: khyab pa zhes bya ba ni mthar phyin nas thob pa'i de bzhin nyid dang ye shes te /
analyzed: khyab pa zhes bya ba ni mthar phyin nas thob pa'i de bzhin nyid dang ye shes te /
translated: “Pervading” is the suchness and intuition attained through culmination.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi don la khyab par gyur pas yul dang shes pa gnyis phan tshun khyab cing 'tsham par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi don la khyab par gyur pas yul dang shes pa gnyis phan tshun khyab cing 'tsham par gyur pa'o //
translated: Since it pervades the meaning of suchness, the object and intuition mutually pervade and fit together.

original: de la sprin zhes bya ba ni char ba nyid yin pas char pa yang don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /🔽dang po ni rdul mi ldang bar byed pa de bzhin du lam gyi mdun rol gyi ngo bo nyid kyi shes pa yang rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i don dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: de la sprin zhes bya ba ni char ba nyid yin pas char pa yang don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te / dang po ni rdul mi ldang bar byed pa de bzhin du lam gyi mdun rol gyi ngo bo nyid kyi shes pa yang rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i don dang ldan pas so //
translated: “Rain” is the rain itself, and the rain has three meanings.🔽The first is that it prevents dust from rising up; similarly, the intuition of reality in the path’s preliminary stage has the meaning of being pure and free from the afflictions.

original: gnyis pa ni dri ma 'khru bar byed pa de bzhin du lam du zhugs pa yang nyon mongs pa spong zhing nyes pa spong ba'i don dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dri ma 'khru bar byed pa de bzhin du lam du zhugs pa yang nyon mongs pa spong zhing nyes pa spong ba'i don dang ldan pas so //
translated: The second is that it cleanses stains; similarly, the one who has entered the path has the meaning of abandoning the afflictions and abandoning faults.

original: gsum pa ni myu gu skyed par byed pa de bzhin du lam gyi 'og tu yang myu gu skyed par byed pas so //

translated: O sons of the victors, in just the same way, the great clouds of the tathāgatas, the great light of the Dharma, the great radiance of the Dharma, and the great Dharma rain that enters into the secrets of all tathāgatas🔽cannot be endured or held🔽by any bodhisattva on any stage other than the bodhisattvas on the tenth stage.

analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam du gyur nas rnam pa thams cad du shes bya'i spyod yul las mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi phyogs yin pas mngon par
translated: The second moment is the path of liberation, and the complete enlightenment with respect to the entire domain of objects of knowledge is the mental state concomitant with the four knowledges.

original: rdzogs par byang chub ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par byang chub ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “complete enlightenment.”

original: de la sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas ni don rnam pa lnga dang ldan no //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas ni don rnam pa lnga dang ldan no //
translated: Here, “buddha” has five meanings.

original: sa ni don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
analyzed: sa ni don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
translated: The stage has three topics.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore, the commentary to the stage of a buddha states:

original: de la sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i chos thams cad dang / mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad las bdag nyid blo bye ba /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i chos thams cad dang / mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad las bdag nyid blo bye ba /
translated: Buddhahood is endowed with the exalted wisdom of omniscience, free from the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, and is the nature of all phenomena, the mind that is the nature of all aspects.

original: sems can thams cad gnyid log pa dang 'dra ba las padma kha bye ba lta bur gyur pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad gnyid log pa dang 'dra ba las padma kha bye ba lta bur gyur pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is like a lotus that has opened from sleep, it is called buddha.

original: sa ni gnas pa dang spyod yul dang bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: sa ni gnas pa dang spyod yul dang bsdus pa ste /
translated: The stage is the basis, the domain, and the collection.

original: de ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes rdzogs par longs spyod pas dgongs pa ro gcig pa 'dres pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi gnas dang spyod yul dang bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes rdzogs par longs spyod pas dgongs pa ro gcig pa 'dres pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi gnas dang spyod yul dang bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: That is the transcendent state of the buddhas because it is the pure dharmadhātu, the enjoyment of the mirror-like pristine consciousness, the pristine consciousness of uniformity, the individually discriminating pristine consciousness, and the pristine consciousness of successful activities.

original: de la don rnam pa lnga ni don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi mkhyen pa dang ldan pa dang / don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi yul rab tu rtogs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan sad par mdzad pa dang / ma rig pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la don rnam pa lnga ni don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi mkhyen pa dang ldan pa dang / don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi yul rab tu rtogs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan sad par mdzad pa dang / ma rig pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The five topics are the ultimate, possessing the knowledge of the relative, the thorough realization of the ultimate and relative objects, awakening oneself and others, and being free from ignorance.

original: shes rab rnam par grol ba brnyes pas gnyid log pa las sad pa dang mtshungs ste /
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol ba brnyes pas gnyid log pa las sad pa dang mtshungs ste /
translated: Since one attains the liberation of wisdom, it is like awakening from sleep.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has abandoned the desire of the desire realm.

original: sems rnam par grol ba brnyes @272a * //
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba brnyes @272a * //
translated: He has attained the liberation of mind,

original: pas padma kha bye ba dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: pas padma kha bye ba dang mtshungs te /
translated: and is like a lotus that has blossomed.

original: don rnam pa lnga po de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don rnam pa lnga po de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called Buddha because he possesses these five meanings.

original: 'dir mdo 'di nyid las ni don rnam pa bzhi dang ldan par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir mdo 'di nyid las ni don rnam pa bzhi dang ldan par bstan te /
translated: Here, in this very sūtra, he is taught to possess four meanings.

original: dang po ni sgrib pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: dang po ni sgrib pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: The first is freedom from obscurations,

original: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra mo gnas su spangs pas zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra mo gnas su spangs pas zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: because he has abandoned the very subtle obscurations of affliction and the knowable.

original: gnyis pa ni ye shes gnyis dang ldan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ye shes gnyis dang ldan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is possessing two kinds of wisdom:

original: sems can stong pa nyid dang chos stong pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: sems can stong pa nyid dang chos stong pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
translated: the wisdom of the emptiness of sentient beings and the wisdom of the emptiness of phenomena.

original: chags pa med pa dang thogs pa med pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa med pa dang thogs pa med pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what is referred to by “without attachment and without obstruction.”

original: gsum pa ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi yul rab tu rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi yul rab tu rtogs pa ste /
translated: The third is the full realization of the objects of the ultimate and the conventional.

original: rnam pa thams cad du shes par bya ba'i spyod yul zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du shes par bya ba'i spyod yul zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the object of all knowledge, as it is said, ...the object of all knowledge.

original: bzhi pa ni bdag dang gzhan sad par mdzad pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bdag dang gzhan sad par mdzad pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the one that awakens both oneself and others,

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nyid kyi phyir zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nyid kyi phyir zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: as it is said, ...because of full enlightenment.

original: de la don rnam pa gsum ni thams cad kyi gnas dang spyod yul dang bsdus par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la don rnam pa gsum ni thams cad kyi gnas dang spyod yul dang bsdus par gyur pa ste /
translated: The three meanings are the basis of all, the object of all, and the summary of all,

original: sngar gong du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gong du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: as was previously taught above.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las sangs rgyas kyi sa ni chos rnam pa lngas bsdus te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las sangs rgyas kyi sa ni chos rnam pa lngas bsdus te 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, in the noble Buddha-bhumi-sutra, the Buddha-bhumi is said to be included in five dharmas:

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / ye shes bzhi po dag go zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / ye shes bzhi po dag go zhes gsungs te /
translated: the pure dharmadhatu and the four knowledges.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in detail in that sutra itself.

original: 'dir mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bcu gcig pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bcu gcig pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, in order to summarize, it is said that the eleventh is called the Buddha-bhumi.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra mo spangs nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra mo spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the extremely subtle afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience,

original: chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa thams cad las mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba brnyes pa'i phyir bcu gcig pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa thams cad las mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba brnyes pa'i phyir bcu gcig pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: because he has attained manifest, complete enlightenment with respect to all aspects of the obstructions to omniscience, the eleventh is called the Buddha Ground.🔽The Sutra Unravelling the Profound Hidden Meaning says:

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni bag chags shin tu phra ba thams cad dang / yul thams cad shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags dang bral nas chags pa med cing thogs pa med par chos thams cad la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir bcu gcig pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni bag chags shin tu phra ba thams cad dang / yul thams cad shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags dang bral nas chags pa med cing thogs pa med par chos thams cad la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir bcu gcig pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Having abandoned all extremely subtle predispositions and all objects, having become free of the predispositions that are obstructions to omniscience, because he has attained mastery over all phenomena without attachment and without obstruction, the eleventh is called the Buddha Ground.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o /
translated: The extensive differentiation should be understood according to the commentary on the ten levels, the commentary on the compendium of the great vehicle translated as the “change of the time of the ox” and the levels of the bodhisattva.
